text: Barwa brunatna, piana obfita, trwala. Aromat to srednio intensywna szynkowo-ogniskowa wedzonka, gorzka czekolada i ciemna melasa. W smaku pol pelne, z nieco wyrazniejsza wedzonka. Czekolada, kawa zbozowa, melasa, likrecja.
Drank a 2013 bottle 17-06-17 in Stockholm at Thierrys after the BBQ. Rich taste. Smoke is subtle. Sweet ish chocolaty. Good.
W aromacie delikatne nuty wędzonego drewna, troche kawy i czekolady, w smaku powtorka aromatu, finisz popiołowy. Srednie, jednak u nas się wędzi lepiej.

0,65 l bottle from Just in Beer, Groningen. 2013 version. Pours out jet black. One finger beige head. Intensive fruity with a lot of smoke and some bacon one the nose. Taste starts well balanced between porterlike fruitieness, choco and increasing smoke. No real carbonation as expected. Nice one.

Wersja 2013. W zapachu czekolada, palone słody, nuty drewniane, karmel, wędzonka jest w moim odczuciu bardzo delikatna. W smaku sporo karmelu, palone słody, wędzona papryka. Ogólnie całkiem przyzwoite piwo, ale niewiele poza tym.
Leather, liquorice, vanilla hints of smoke. The smokiness grows larger in the finish.

Bottle shared on train on way to CWC III thanks to s_hartshorne, cheers Shane. Black beer with tan head. Aroma of smoked cheese, black malts and some roast coffee. Taste is roasted malts, smoked bacon and dark malts. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Train beer, courtesy of Shane. Very dark, cola brown. Film of tan head. Nose has savoury smoke. Ripe, dark berry fruits. Some woody notes. Taste is soft, smoky sweet. Some dryness. Smooth and full mouthfeel. Smoky sweet finish, with a light, vinous bitterness.

Bottle from bier huis. On train to cotteridge 3. Black good tan head. Aroma is smoked bacon dark fruits taste the same good ashy wood notes nice sweetness. Really smooth subtle carbonation. Very good.
Quite standard for a smoked porter but at the same time very balanced and incredibly well done.

Bottle @ home, Cellared 2012 vintage - bought 2012. Aroma is smoky with delicate vanilla notes, chocolate, leather, licorice, tobacco, dark fruits. Vinous notes in perfect balance. Palate is smooth with medium carbonation. Nice duration. Flavors of smoke, leather, licorice, milk chocolate, vanilla, plums, wood. Finish is dry with lingering leather belt,  peat  sweet plums and salt licorice. Is just getting better...

650ml bottle from Systembolaget, vintage 2012. Black with a dense tanned head, rich lacing. Smoky aroma with sweet dried fruit, figs, dates, leather and licorice. Medium-bodied, soft carbonated, thin and smooth mouthfeel. Smoky taste, leather, tobacco, dark chocolate, caramel, toast and prunes. Mild cocoa bitterness in the finish.

Bottle. Dark brown, almost black color, tan head. Very nice smell of tobacco, smoked plums and bacon, which is however not present in aroma. Aroma is smoked, but slightly bland and watery. Not bad, but not great either.

Doft: kraftig rökdoft, sherry, metall, salami, ek.
Smak: ekrökig först sen chark, aningen coca-cola men mer besk än söt, aningen citron.
En helt fin øl der smager tilpas af røg, ikke for meget, men det passer ikke helt porteren

Pours deep dark colour with a decent, tan head. Aroma of smoke that tends to revolve around peated notes somewhat, soy sauce, a touch of chocolate - not bad but with more intensity expected. The taste brings the same notes packed in a concoction suffering from a body deficiency syndrome. The beer is quite allright but it definitely doesnt live up to expectations.

$9 paid for a 2016 22floz bottle. Pours with one finger head receding to a patchy layer atop the dark-brown contents. Aroma carries a strong scent of campfire. Feel is great, and the Worcestershire sauce-like flavor is good. Yet, this beer is not as top notch as I once thought. My palate may have changed to desire a little less smoke. Still it is solid and good drinking beer.

Flaska från SB, vintage 2012. Provning med ölsällskapet. Svart med gräddigt beiget skum. Torra, rostade toner av aska, kaffe, chark, torv, rökt ek. Mellanstor. I smaken rökiga toner, kaffe, tobak, chark, aska, tjära, lite grädde och gräddkola. Väl balanserat och relativt lättdrucket. Rökigheten inte alls farlig, väl integrerad med andra smaker. Elegant och gott.
2013-0,65cl bottle.aroma of camp fire.taste of dried fruits,faint smoke ,roasted malt and dark chocolate .a good but simple porter.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 (bottle)
Aroma:pure smoked ham smell,hint of chocolate and dark bread.
Appearance:dark almost black color,small dense head,
Taste:semi-sweet,flavour of smoked malt,ham and roasted malt.
Palate:medium body,quite watery,low to medium carboantion.
Overall:Very smokey well-made brew but its bit overhyped IMO.
Wonderful porter ….......................................... via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 3, 2017 Bottle at Erzbierschof MC, vintage 2013. Pours dark brown. Aroma is smoked salmon over typical porter notes. Body is medium, still smoked, a bit ashy, low but rather lively carbonation. Medium palate. Round and soft Very good!

A malty smell of chocolate, some smoke. The beige medium large creamy head has a short duration, the body is black. A smoky taste of dark chocolate and malt, the long finish is quite bitter. The body is medium strong, creamy and oily, also silky with a soft carbonation.
On tap at the Riverwalk. Pours black with a tan head. Smoky dark roasted malt and dark chocolate in the aroma and taste. Outstanding stuff.

0.65l bottle. Dark brown color with brown head. Aroma is roasty, dark fruits, coffee, caramel with great smoked malt aroma. Taste is roasty with coffee notes and nice smoked malt flavor. Medium body. Its awesome beer with great smoked character.

2013 vintage. Smoked ham, prunes, chocolate, caramel and coffee in nose. Pours very dark brown with tan lacy head. Taste is medium sweet with chocolate, caramel, bonfire notes, dried fruits, coffee, herbs. Medium bitter finish, soft to average carbonation. Overall very good, perfectly balanced classic.

Bottle (2013 Edition). Dark brown to black color with huge creamy beige head. Aroma is nice smoked, smoked meat, malt, coffee, dark chocolate, ash, wood, hops. Taste is nice balanced, solid malty and hoppy, smoked with coffee and dark chocolate, ashy. Good one

Bomber, 2013 vintage, bought for a small price in Alkmaar (shop probably thought it was way past its date). Black color. Beige head with reasonable retention. Aromas: smoked malts, a bit tar, sweet. Retronasal its sweet, smoked, creamy, tar. Flavor is moderate sweet, roasted, a hint of fruity sourness. Medium bodied. Quite soft mouthfeel. Finish is raosted, ashy, moderate bitter.
VINTAGE 2013: Nice creamy, smooth and drinkable. Aroma is moderately malty, roasted, smokey, vanilla. Taste is moderately sweet and moderately bitter. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Bardzo dobry porter. Ładna, biała piana. Mały lacing. Tworzy obwolutę. Barwa czarna z prześwitami. Aromat bardzo przyjemnej wędzonki i wędzonej śliwki, dodatkowo nuty ogniska. W smaku słodkie, czekoladowe, wędzonkowe, karmelowe z tyłu. Niskie nasycenie. Gładkie. Świetnie ułożone. Bardzo smaczne.

geurend naar Worschester sauce
met een smaak van wisky met rookmout
redelijk droge afdronk
aparte smaak niet lekker 
had misschien te jong gedronken maar dan moest er nog een hoop gebeuren voor een goede porter

Bottle shared with ebone1988 for the Koleminer20 turns 3k and Ebone1988 turns 1.6k Bonanza. 22 oz bottle. The pour is a darker brown with a thicker cap of light tan head and a couple spots of lace as it falls. The aroma is all smoke. There is a hint of roasted malt and a light chocolate, but the chocolate dominates it. I dont like it. The flavor is much of the same. Heavy smoke, light chocolate malt and a hint of matallic. Ugh. The mouth feel is thinner and slick with a hint of brighter carbonation and a lingeringly smoky and roasted malt finish. No thanks.

Bottle shared with koleminer20 for the Koleminer20 Turns 3k and Ebone1988 turns 1.6k Bonanza. For the book. Aroma is bonfire, smoked meats, roasted malt, maybe some wood, decent. Appearance is dark brown, light brown head, poured thin. Taste is super smoky, roasted malt, burned wood, bacon, burned toast, just plain burned. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, smoky wood aftertaste. Overall, it is what its advertised.

(2013 Vintage) Rich smokey aroma, with some underlying roast notes. Pours a dark ruby red with a thin light tan head. Roasted notes are the predominant flavor, pairing nicely with a smokey finish. Lighter bodied then you may expect, this is a fantastic smoked porter, and could work as a nice introduction to smoked beers.

Bottle, 0,65l, shared with my colleagues. Pitch black color with thin creamy light brown head and nice lacing. Aroma of smoke, leather, roasted malt and chocolate. Taste starts with medium sweet roasted malt and chocolate, follows by smoked ham, leather and rubber, mouthfeel is warming, while finish is mild bitter. Medium to full body, oily texture and average carbonation in palate. Aged for few years, drank in few minutes...

Leje sie ciemno brunatne, barwa adekwatna. 
Zapach suszone owoce,dymny ogniskowy oraz leciutki sosik sojowy ale bardzo bardzo delikatny. Zapach złożony i pięknie utleniony oraz palone słody, lekka kawa i czekolada. 
Smak tutaj jest pięknie wędzonka na pierwszym planie razem z utlenieniem w postaci śliwki i sherry, później pojawiają sie ciemne słody które objawiają sie czekoladą i kawą. 
Jedyny problem tego piwa to brak ciała ale to długo leżakowana 16 więc nie oczekiwałem oleju silnikowego. :D 
Goryczka średnia do niskiej lekko palona. 
Wysycenie średnie dla mnie za wysokie.

Bottle from Pivoteka, Zagreb. Shared with Vinja 666, Tanja, Davor and Goran. Black with red tint, small off-white head. Peat and wood, moderate aromatic, some chocolate, leather and black olives. Dry, very good balance of smokey and roasty. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, soft texture, lasting aromatic finish. Very well made: creamy, balanced, full taste, just right strenght!

Barwa prawie że czarna z jasnobeżową pianą. W aromacie wędzona szyneczka , trochę czekoladki, trochę rodzynek. W smaku jest wędzonka, kawa, delikatnie czuć czekoladę i suszone owoce. Solidny porter, który cieszy.
Dark brown at the middle with a dark ruby tint supporting a light brown head. The aroma and flavor is all sweet smoke with hints of black licorice and caramel.

Shared 65cl bottle, 2013 vintage. Pours dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is dominated by smoke, tar, a bit roasted, touch of dark fruits. Taste is light to medium sweet and bitter, smoke, dark fruits, finishes roasty with hints of coffee. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily and smooth. Good, but not very complex. I expected more.
Bottle at home, 29th December 16. Pours deep dark brown. Aroma is smoked meat, iodine. Taste is smoke, meat, wood, fire, iodine. Good, man
Bottle form importer. Tasted various version vintage, older better than younger. High smoke taste but well balanced.

2012 vintage. Bottle at Lebanese in Byfleet. 10/12/16. Bought at Wine Rack, West Byfleet. Rich aroma, smoke, tar and molasses. Pitch black, although no head. Light bitter. Smokey but not overpowering. Light bodied. Extremely drinkable. Love it.

2008 vintage. Dark opaque colour, with a medium brown head that holds for a while. Good lace.
Aroma is smoky but not so overwhelmin as in other smoked beers, coffee, dark fruits, caramel. Palate is creamy, with medium body (I expected it a bit more dense), normal carbonation. Taste is smoky caramel, dark fruits, coffee, chocolate. Good.
A standout in the category! It is reminescient of Stones, but amped up in the flavor department. This is great beer. 22oz bottle

Bottle from Deocinck, Vichte - BE. Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: roasted malt, caramel, coffee notes. Dark fruits. Taste: medium body with roasted malt backbone, sweet and bread notes. Good balance. Highly drinkable. Good attenuation. Aftertaste: roasted malt, caramel, alcohol.
Intense smoked notes, coffee, dark brown/black with a good tan head, mediu body, medium carbonation, smoked but with more coffee and chocolate...a simple but extraordinary porter.

Bottle. Pours dark with thick brownish head. Aroma of Smoked cheese, peat, touch of dried plums, licquorice. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, lot of smoked cheese and some peat on tongue. Medium body, slick texture, lively carbonation, long light bitter finish. Nicely ballanced.
2012 vintage. Poured black with a thick tan head. Aroma of sweet rauched malt. Medium to slightly watery body, flavour is of the smoked malt with some restrained bitterness. Surprisingly smooth.
0,5l bottle, 2012 vintage. Pours black with medium sized tanned head. Smoke, chocolate, liquorice. Almost creamy. Not overtly sweet for my liking, just right. Very good.

22 ounce bottle, 2013 vintage. Kinda surprised to see the 2013s on the shelf in Ohio since this is Alaskans first year distributing here, but Im not complaining! Served in a Great Lakes Brewing snifter, the beer pours dark brown/black with about an inch tan head that stayed around for a while. Theres also a decent amount of lacing. I like the aroma, the brew smells like smoked malt/meats, coffee, roasted malt and some dark fruit. For the most part I think the taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also some chocolate and woodiness noticeable too. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its smooth and a bit creamy with a moderate amount of carbonation. Its also easy and enjoyable to drink. I thought this was a good overall brew. The smoke is definitely noticeable but not overpowering. Its a nice combination of smoky, sweet and roasty flavors, certainly worth picking this one up! $8.99 a bomber.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

2013 Vintage tested pre, consumed during and celebrated post Whats Brewing 1516-2016. (bb "at least 2025") - Alderwood smoked replaces the Old World porkchop and Bamberg bacon with subtle, nearly breezy woodsmoke (as in smoked salmon), framing dry cocoa powder, lush pillowy dark malts (red berry, wet boughs) and great dryness in a unique smoked beer that is almost as sessionable as Schlenkerla itself. Layered (woody, coffeebean, cigar leaf) bitter aftertaste. - An unexpectedly suave and "mature" revelation and hard-to-deny New World classic that shines with balanced "terroir" flavours. Something both in the air and that glacier water? Looking forward to some verticals.

@bartlebiers 2016 Whats Brewing feat. Joe Stange. Aromas of smoked malt, roast, hints of milk chocolate with a very clean taste and a well-done balance of smoked and roasted malts. Lots of aroma for this quite low abv.
Bottle, 2008 vintage at tasting panel at Warszawski festiwal piwa. Nice malty and smoke aroma, hint of soy sauce. Taste is pretty dry, light sweet, flavor of smoke, ham, dark fruits.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2017 Pours a deep brown to black with a light brown head. Aromas of malt and smoke. Taste the same with a little sweetness from the malt. A nice smoked porter. Very complex ale. Light to medium mouth feel with little lacing in the glass.

Rocznik 2012. Piwo czarne z lwkkimi refleksami, biala piana znikajaca bardzo szybko w szkle. W aromacie dym i wedzonka z ogniska, ciemne owoce jak wisnie i troche kawy. W smaku popiol, lukrecja i sos sojowy. Dosc kwaskowe, niezbyt slodkie z palona goryczka i wysyceniem na srednio niskim poziomie. Na jezyku gadkie i kremowe ze srednim cialem. Zdecydowanie dla fanow wedzonek.

Originally rated on 12/4/08. Thankfully I finally found some of this, my bottle was brewed in 08. Aroma was a nice smokey presence not too strong, not too weak, good balance. Also there were hints of fruit and coffee. Predominant flavor of smoke with hints of chocolate and coffee, mouthfeel was a little on the thin side but not bad. I am not a big fan of smoked beers but, overall it was a pretty good porter thats worth a try.

(2008 vintage). Black. Mostly roasted but also somewhat smoked aroma and flavour. Not that rich. Moderately sweet and bitter taste. Medium body with a slightly watery mouthfeel. Overall, a good porter but nothing outstanding. It could easily be more smoked and full.

Black with small white head. Medium malty sweetness with hints of caramel, loads of coffee, chocolate and some faint roastiness complimented by solid dose of smoky notes reminiscing campfire. Avarage bitterness and medium body, slick texture, medium carbonation. Complex yet drinkable, you can dive into smoke and find chocolaty and coffee with roastiness and caramel sweet backbone.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2016 Elche, Hirsche ich werd wahnsinnig, denn kurz voher erschnupperte ich die Dämpfe des verbrannten Leders zum ersten Mal. Im Mund formen sich dann ausgefallene Rauch, Röst und fruchtig süße Flavours zu einem Ganzen zusammen. Die anfänglich dominante Säure wird schnell von der Hopfenbittere abgefedert und das alles im gekonnt von röstmalzigen Rauchungen flankierten Korpus. Rund und extrem gut drinkable. 0,66l Vintage 2012 Bottle von BEYOND BEER IN HH. 12.

Vintage 2012
chocolate, coffee, toast, roasty, heavy smoke, 
black, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, sticky, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish, well balanced,

On vacation in Alaska 650ml bottle of black colored body with a off white head and a roasted malt coffee hops aroma a roasted malt coffee chocolate herby alcholic bitter taste with a alcholic bitter finish

Bottle, 2012 edition, 650 ml from Pivoljub. Courtesy of and shared with JFK10000 & Miro B. Pours dark brown with small light brown head. Roasted malts, smoke, wood, chocolate. Creamy texture. Light sweetness. Medium bodied.

Black colour, foamy tan head. Malty aroma, raisin, some coffee and vanilla. Taste is malty, slightly roasted, a little bit bitter. Smooth mouthfeel, medium body, low carbonation. Good porter but could be more heavily smoked.
650ml bottle at Josh. Vintage 2006. Aroma and taste are smoked, chocolate notes, roasted malt. Very pleasant.
Draft. Pours a dark brown. Aroma and taste are smokey roasted malts and some chocolate.

Pullo @ Alko. Reittaus nro 900. Kaatuu lasiin sysimustana, noin kahden sormen paksuisen tiiviin vaahdon suojaamana. Tuoksusta löytyy savuisuutta, joka kääntyy hieman viskimäisen turpeiseen suuntaan, tervaa, paahdetta ja hivenen myös tummaa hedelmää ja suklaisuutta. Maussa suklaisuus ja lievä paahde ottavat isointa roolia alkuun, niiden jälkeen tulee savuinen turpeisuus, aivan kuin monissa skottiviskeissä, ilman alkoholin poltetta. Hiven tummaa hedelmää on myös joukossa. Suutuntuma on melko täyteläinen (varsinkin prosentteihin nähden) ja maitoinen. Hyvin tehty svauolut, jossa on sellaista skottiviskin turpeisuutta eikä savukinkkua, kuten savuoluissa yleensä. Täyteläinenkin tämä on, varsinkin prosentteihin nähden. Hieno kokemus, savuoluiden parhaimmistoa ehdottomasti, ja oluenakin hyvä, vaikken tyylistä niin välitäkään.

Bottle sample tasted at BBF Lab Madrid 2016 on the 02/07/2016. Black colour with a small light brown to beige head. Aroma has tons of smoke BBQ, ash, espresso, cocoa beans, dark chocolate and spices. Taste is BBQ and cococa beans. Next one please!

I love the smell. Subtle hints of smoked meat, with some "woody" elements in there as well. Apperence is pretty dull, black with minimal head. A slight bitter taste, with balanced smoke aromas. Hints of bacon or other smoked meat. Medium body, low carbonation. I love this one, very well balanced smoked porter.

Bottled from BierNavigatie, 2012 vintage tasted in 2016. Dark brown to black colored, creamy brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, smoke, licorice, perhaps some coffee and chocolate. Malty bitter flavor, smoky. For a Porter this beer leans a bit towards Schwarz and Rauchbier. Im not sure what the aging has done to the beer, thats something to investigate another time. Nice beer, although im not as big as a fan as many others.

Il gusto al naso è di affumicato e ricorda da vicino i profumi della miscela da pipa Balkan Sobranie nella vecchia confezione in latta, precedente al 1998, densa di sapori orientali coltivati in Macedonia, ben equilibrati con il Latakia dellomonima regione della Siria, una ineguagliabile pienezza del gusto e finezza di aroma. Lintensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è apprezzabile. Il cappello di schiuma ha una discreta resistenza, è cremosa e voluminosa. Le bollicine sono fini. La carbonazione è media. Il sottostante perlage è dato da bollicine fini, con carbonazione persistente ed insistita. Il colore è scuro impenetrabile. Il corpo è strutturato ma duttile. Il dolce è medio e lamaro è medio, non si surclassano. Inoltre si aggiunge un accenno di umami. Lintensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è godereccio. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono luppolate ma anche di birra impegnativa. Il finale è lungo e complesso. Il retrogusto è intenso e persistente. In bocca laroma riporta sentori di miele, fieno, pane tostato, fiori, frutta secca, erbe aromatiche, alcol presente, liquirizia, uva passa, fumo e vaniglia.

5-te najlepsze Smoked Ale na świecie. Wersja na rok 2015. 
 Data butelkowania:  09/08/2015 
 Kolor:  Ciemny brąz. Pod światło wydaje się w miarę czyste. 
Piana:  Średnia, drobnoziarnista w kolorze kremowo-beżowym.
Piana jest początkowo dość burzliwa, jednak po kilku chwilach pęka do grubszych pęcherzyków i opada w dół.
Na ściankach szkła umiarkowane zdobienia 
 Zapach:  Wspaniała woń słodów wędzonych. Na dzień dobry zapach wędzonej śliweczki. Dalej lekkie nuty dymu z ogniska i pieczonej skórki od chleba. Nie jest to wędzonka na miarę Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier, ale za to profil zapachowy jest tutaj bardziej różnorodny.
Poza wędzonymi nutami sporo gorzkiej czekolady i subtelna paloność. 
 Smak:  W smaku początkowo gładziuteńkie, śliskie na języku, kremowe. Wędzonka zdecydownie w klimacie śliwki węgierki. Mocna, zdecydowana, intensywna.
W oddali spalony patyk z ogniska i subtelna torfowość.
Nuty czekoladowe zostały zepchnięte na drugi plan. Po ogrzaniu uwydatnia się także parzona, mocna kawa. Pojawia się również większa paloność i mocna kwaskowata, ściągająca język wytrawność.
Goryczka średnia, długi wędzony, kwaskowaty finisz.
Średnie ciało, tutaj mogłoby być ono ciut tęższe.
Fest wędzone, solidne piwo. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Kultowy Alaskan Smoked Porter z Browaru Alaskan Brewery z Juneau na Alasce.

Piwo okazało się strzałem w 10-kę, ale zarazem nie przebiło niemieckiego Schlenkerla w kategorii Piw Wędzonych.
Bardzo fajna śliwkowa wędzoneczka, przechodząca w dym spalonego patyka z ogniska.
Dopełnieniem dla niej są akcenty gorzkiej czekolady i mocnej palonej kawy.
Jedynym mankamentem jest silna kawowa wytrawność, która pozostawia nieco drażniące odczucie w ustach.
Faktura średnia i takie samo nagazowanie.
Bardzo dobra pozycja. Punkt obowiązkowy na liście dla wszystkich, którzy uwielbiają piwa wędzone.

Bottle 0,66L. Im rating four years aged example. Very, very dark brown color with medium big, creamy, light brown head. Aroma of light smoked bacon and dark chocolate. Taste starts light bitter with some dark coffee and strong coffee. Finish is the same with some long lasting aftertaste. Medium to full body, creamy texture & soft carbonation.

2012 bottle. Deep dark brown colour with nice big head on top. Aroma has smoked malts, roasted malts, some coffee. Taste starts with roasted coffee and malts, there is some smoke flavours too. Medium body with lowish carbonation. A bit mellowed down during the years but still a nice porter.
Bottle at BGBB3 bottle share, sample. 2012 vintage. Lots going on, smoke, liquorice, earthy notes, vanilla, peat. Quite nice.

650 ml bottle (2012). Black, with a dense brown head. Sweetish and smoky aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, liquorice and berries. The flavour is roasted malty, smoky, with liquorice and notes of chocolate, and a dryish, slightly burnt hoppy finish. Very tasty.

Dark brown color, tiny frothy head, perfect lacing. Aroma is absolutely beautiful. Its like a smoked chocolate. This mix is perfectly balanced perfectly put all together. Taste is super nice as well but not mind blowing. Here the wooden roasted notes are on the front, bit of chocolate in the end. Its a bit over carbonated, especially since its from the tap. In overall this one is far above other ~6,5 abv porters and stouts.

Bottle from 2008. Light smokeyness, licorice, dried fruits. Some banana and vanilla. Very complex and very subtle. Sweet and light bitter. This one aged well.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 Donkerbruin tegen zwart, onderin het glas tegen het licht in nog net wat donker rood. Schuimkraag is bruin en zakt direct weg naar een laagje, mooie laagvorming langs het glas....bij draaien een olieachtige film langs het glas..... prachtig om te zien.
Aroma: Gerookte ham of spek, zoethout, vanille en chocola.
Smaak: Behoorlijk gerookt en assig, donker chocolade, iets koffie en iets kruidig. Een zoete afdronk met vanille die overgaat in een kampvuurachtige smaak/ervaring. Op het einde nog een kleine bitter. Die rooksmaak blijft mooi lang even nawerken..... erg prettig. Behoorlijk CO2 wat een vol mondgevoel geeft. Volle body en zacht en romig. Licht droog op het einde. Was niet goedkoop maar de prijs zeker waard. TOP deze Smoked Porter.

Black and tan. Smoky aroma, hint of licorice and coffee. Fairly dry, smoky flavor with coffee, very dark chocolate and umami notes. Full body, medium carbonation. Nice.

Pretty good but I expected more. Definitely very smokey and ashy, and sweet. Just a little thinner palate than I expected and slightly metallic taste. Not bad.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance- solid cola black in colour with thick sandy brown foam. Aromas- Roasted aroma, salty smoked salmon with an underlying sweet vanilla. Palate- silky smooth, full bodied but light on the tongue. Taste- smokey roasted nuts, salmon, dark chocolate, overall- a complex and great tasting beer, really glad I tried and would happily drink again- had this for an end of 2nd year (uni) treat and its been worth the wait.

Almost jet black color (torch bearly shines through) with nice thick brown foam. Aromas of smoked salmon, smoked carp, pepers and spices used in meat and fish? With notes of smooth dark malts, roasted nuts, dry sweet seaweed and light notes of wood, campfire smoke and charcoal. Palate, full body, creamy smooth texture leaving nice smoked dark malts and woody finish. Taste, smooth sweet of wood smoke, creamy dark malts, then develops into more salty dry wood taste. Overall, really nice, never smelled a beer like this, loved it! Was expencive but really worth it, would have it again and do recomend!
Bottle shared at hopaholic. Black colour, head disappears immediately. Nose of cured meat. Taste is black ham with some smoke. Very nice smoked.

2012 bottle. Pours a pitch black with a thin mostly lasting foamy light beige head. Aroma is of dark fruits, liquorice, chocolate, smokey. Taste is of dark chocolate, peaty, dark fruits, blackcurrant, fig. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Dark brown with light brown edges. Sparse beige head. Aroma intensity 4/5. Toast, chocolate, malt, tomato and blackcurrant in the nose. The smoke really comes in the taste, alongside with oregano. Medium sweet. Bitter finish. Thin texture. Medium to full body
Bottle from lovecraft aveiro. Color is dark brown. Head is persistent and brown. Light sweetness, medium bitterness. Aroma is liquorice, wood smoke, fire, light chocolate. Pretty tasty.

At Mrks. Clear dark brown nearing black with light tan head. Very bbq smokey sweet chocolate malts, toffee, coffee, goodness. Light sweet, medium bitter. Very smooth smoke taste, well balanced, lovely in all the right ways.

Bottle 2012 shared thanks to Mrk. Black with small light brown head. Lots of smoke, BBQ, ash, espresso, cocoa beans, dark chocolate, dried chilies but without the burn, earthy, dried leaves. Light sweet and under medium bitter. Medium bodied with slick feel. Very nice.

Dark-brown, tar like color with a beige head. Interesting smell of smoked salmon and roast. Light, easy-to-drink beer with a intense smokey & coffee-chocolate aroma and a stout note. Interesting beer indeed, would try it again, but its price is quite high :D

2015 vintage. Pours dark as a starless night. Normal head volume, outstanding lacing and world class retention.

Nearly world class nose of rich smoked malt that delivers a nice campfire bacon aroma. Had it been a bit more intense, it would have achieved world class status. Underneath roll light roast, chocolate and hop notes.

Heavy medium body with a smooth and somewhat creamy texture. World class carbonation that provides a burst in the middle and a finely bubbled prickly finish. The body / carbonation ratio is perfect and really allows the flavor to open up.

The flavor profile is quite outstanding. Surprisingly, the smoked malt delivers a subdued campfire bacon flavor, not the delicious intensity of Schlenkerla. In other words, this one is balanced better. This balance, or lack of smoke intensity, allows the other flavors to shine. Light bitter bakers chocolate, hints of molasses and a light hop spiciness appear from the middle on. Bitterness is light and has both a hop and roast character. As middle bitterness begins to fade, sweetness (caramel, molasses) maximizes and smoked malt comes to the forefront. It delivers a slight campfire bacon flavor but is mostly oak smoke. The finish is slow sweet fade that leaves a lingering oak smoke and just a hint of dryness.

Bottled in 2012, drank 3,5 year after that.. Almost black colour with big beige head. Moderate aroma of dark malts, some bread, light smoke and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Soft carbonation. Medium to full body. Decent stuff, but in my opinion its overrated. Ive expected much more.

Huge smoke made me break out a few scotches for comparison. This porter has more smokiness than Ballantines Finest but not as much as an Ardbeg 10-year-old. What it has that the scotches dont is hints of chocolate in the aroma. The body was a letdown--much thinner than expected--and the taste is bland and, now on the finish, overwhelmed with smoke. Given that the bottles label encourages aging and I opened it just six months after bottling, perhaps getting another and letting it sit a bit would be a good idea and a more fair test.

Vintage 2012. Pours beautiful black beer with light brown head. Aroma is a bit metallic, but mostly roasted malt and wonderful smoke. Taste is roasted malt, hoppy grassy and.... smoke! A wonderful balanced smoked porter, I love it.

F: average, beige, average lasting.
C: very dark brown to dark, non-transparent.
A: roasted malt, bacon, smoked ham, dark chocolate, espresso.
T: 650ml bottle, 2013, from Malting Pot in Brussels, roasted malt, a lot of bacon, smoked meat, red berries, very smooth mouthfeel, light bitterness with long smoky notes and hit of chocolate finish, very well balanced, full body, medium to low carbonated, one of my favourite beer, worth to try.
Pours a dark brown with off-white head. Malt and smoke on nose. Palate is well-balanced smoke and malt. Absolutely delicious!

Ciemnobrunatny, nieprzejrzysty. 
Piana beżowa, drobna, opadła do kożuszka . 
Ślady na szkle nikłe. 
W aromacie nuty wędzone. Potem lekka paloność i gorzka czekolada. Trochę słodyczy w aromacie. 
W smaku przyjemnie wędzony, lekkie nuty drewniane. W posmaku garbnikowe i dębowe. 
Po ogrzaniu bardziej pełne i lekko słodsze. 
Bardzo dobre.

Draft to shorty at Yardhouse Vegas pour opaque dark brown with moderate tan head. Nose smoked peat, bacon, roasted malt, very meaty. Taste kind of all over, I get moderate bitter, then red fruit flavors, followed by lots of smoke. Smokey peat, umami. Ashy roasted finish.
tried at Lincoln Tap House and Kitchen. Colour black with a large tan head. The aroma is a light peat smoke with fruit, and vanilla. Taste is stronger smoky, with a burnt finish.
Klares dunkelbraun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, Röstaromen, leicht rauchig, etwas Speck, Karamell, leicht fruchtig, dunkle Schokolade. (ASP 2013)

Aroma - roast barley, smoke, and peat.
Appearance - black body, with a head 1" and fallow in color. Foamy, and settles slowly. Some lacing.
Taste - peat, slight jerky-like smoke (similar to Wild Bills Jerky), a little spice, roasted barley, and touch of ancho pepper.
Palate - full body, thick feel, average carbonation, and smoked bitters.

Bottiglia del 2012 invecchiata di 3.5 anni. Nerissima con schiuma marroncina finissima e compatta di buona persistenza. Ottimo aroma dolce di caramello e malto tostato, una vena di cioccolato e affumicatura, leggeri dark fruits. Spettacolo al palato, affumicatura perfetta, pancetta, speck, un po di note di cioccolato e di vaniglia. Beverina, carbonazione medio bassa. Eccellente.

Beer intense dark brown, almost black. When pouring the foam layer is not particularly large, but attractive for its coffee and the remains left in the glass in every sip color. Medium length, not end completely disappear leaving a thin tan collar.
Aroma very defined roasted malts accompanied by smoky notes reminiscent of a roaring fire. subtle notes of cocoa and wood enclosed under cover of roast and smoke. spicy and different nuances German Rauch, since in this case it is smoked with alder wood and beech no.
intense roasted malt taste, with notes of coffee and caramel complemented smoke and spicy nuances that are reflected in the nose. Touches to embers and ashes, derived from smoking. some nuances are also distinguished herbs and wild plants
Pours black with a large tan head that leaves a thin lacing. The aroma is a strong, peat smoke smell. A nice, smooth porter with the flavours of cigars, peat, earth and vanilla.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 Butelka 0.5l (26.12.2026). Piwo totalnie czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana bezowa, obfita, drobna, calkiem trwala, ladnie oblepiajaca scianki szkla odmierzajac kazdy lyk. W aromacie wyrazna wedzonka o szynkowym charakterze. W smaku palone z dlugim i bardzo wyraznym wedzony posmakiem przyjemnie gryzacym w jezyk. Piwo pelne, tresciwe w odczuciu ale pijalne a leciutko sciagajaca goryczka fajnie pobudza slinianki do pracy, az chce sie wziac nastepny lyk.

15-01-2016, CP, flink gegist

Smoked porter 2012. Caramel, geroosterd malt. Lekkere gerookte nasmaak die lang blijft hangen.
Affumicato delicato, meno aggressivo delle classiche rauch. Aromi di caffè, cioccolato, liquirizia. Retrogusto caratteristico che ricorda laceto balsamico.
Exceptional balance of smokey malt, sweet chocolate, and coriander aroma taste. Pairs well with red meats: burgers & steaks.

Dark brown to black colored, small beige to tan head, not very lasting, nice lacing. Aroma is of black and roasted malts and quite smokey. Taste is medium sweet caramalt, dark chocolate, roasted malt and decent amounts of smoke, medium roasted bitterness, lasting smoked bacon finish. Full- bodied, average- carbonation, creamy.
One of the best smoked Porters I have ever had. Aroma has a bonfire smoke smell to it. Taste is a chocolate smoke. Sits really well on the palate. All around a awesome smoked Porter

Bottle. Black black, next to no head. Aroma chocolate, faint smoked cedar wood. Taste milk chocolate, coffee. Finish bitter chocolate. Lovely.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle aged for about four years, BBE 09/18/2012.
A clear very dark mahogany body with a large brown head that settles to a thin layer. Nose has nice smoky notes, oak, bacon, smoked meat, caramel and bourbon. Taste is mildly sweet with heavy smoky accents and a mild dry finish. Soft carbonation and medium to thin palate. Quite nice smoked beer with pleasant aromas and smooth flavor.

bottle, pours dark brown with strong beige head. Aroma of cocoa, caramel, smoke, roasted malt, earth and raisins. Quite high sweetness with a slightly ashy bitterness in finish. Not worth that money but still a nice brew.
Tap. Near black with one finger head. Smoky bacon flavor, but not overdone. Chocolate malts. Im not a big fan of smoked beers, but this is nicely done.

Pours brown with tan head. Aroma is smoke, chocolate and dried fruits. In taste medium sweet, malty, chocolate and smoky notes (ham). Medium body, smooth texture, soft carbonation and meidum bitter finish. Very good smoked porter, icon of style.
An excellent smoked porter, super smooth and silky, with notes of chocolate, dried fruit and cocoa on top of an excellent slightly bitter combination of dark cherries and some faint vanilla.

Bottles at birthday party brought by the Grussings. First off, this has been one of my most sought after beers for years and it was a pleasure to try two different versions (2012 and 2011 I believe). Nice amount of smoke that isnt overbearing, porter is very nice and roasty. Excellent.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is smoke, liquid smoke, smoked meats, beef jerky, some licorice. Taste is big smoked meats and malts with a bitter coffee finish. Really great! Up there with the Schlenkerla Rauchbiers.

600ml bottle served in a big Lager glass. 2012 Edition. Best before 2016. 
A: Pours a deep brown color forming a big light and bubbled tan head with medium retention that leaves only few lacings in the glass. 
S: Strong notes of roasted and smoked malts in the nose. Notes of dark chocolate and coffee. Earthy yeasts and flowery hops. Hints of vanilla and cherry wood. 
T: Sweet upfront. Strong notes of roasted and smoked malts. Notes of dark chocolate and coffee. Earthy yeasts and flowery hops. Vanilla and cherry wood. Sweet biscuity finish. Moderate bitterness. 
M: Medium to heavy body. Molasses. Strong and persistent notes of roasted and smoked malts in the aftertaste. 
O: Great drinkability. Excellent Porter. Masterpiece.

Bottle. Pours black with beige head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, malt, vanilla, smoke. Flavor is sweet and bitter, malt, fruits, citrus, smoke, some bacon, roast. Body is slightly watery. Finish is dry, smoke with some bacon. Overall: very good.

Dark brown beer, small brown beer. Nose is bacon, ash, campfire smoke, roast, malt. Flavor is malt, smoke, mild ash, roast, coffee hints. Dry and smokey finish, hints of ash, fruit notes. Lingering smokey acidity. Pretty nice.
Colorado trip 2013. Roasty with moderate smokiness and some savory. Some molasses and hint licorice.
Pours a murky dark brown color with khaki head. Nice smoky aromas and well balanced

(650ml 2012 bottle shared @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Nov 27 2015) Pours black with a small pale tan cap. Aroma strongly campfire or something artificial even, a bit of ashy roasted malt in behind, there is some underlying sweet dark malt and chocolate but its rather buried and faded. On the palate, again lots of campfire, ashtray and slight bacon. A bit of sweet molasses malt and dark chocolate, vague fruity hints, finishing with a bitter, rather astringent roast/ash/smoke character and just a little sweet malt. Aftertaste quite smoky as well. Medium bodied. I felt like the malts had faded a bit with age and left the smoke behind, robbing it of balance.

From 0,65l vintage 2013 bottle, Pours dark brown to almost black nontransparent liquid, small creamy brown head, Aroma: moderate smoked, roasty, black coffee, dark chocolate, red berries, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light to medium sour, pronounced roast malt notes, smoked bacon, cranberry, lemon peel, very well balanced, simple and strong, Palate: full body, soft carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, long roasty bitter sour aftertaste, Overall: very nice smoked porter, in fact not too much smoked, mainly nice roasted maltiness with some fruity notes, well ballanced, smooth, simple but very well done, enjoyed.
UPDATED: DEC 6, 2015 Shared 22 oz. bottle. Dark brown with tan head. This one is all charcoal, smoke and roasted malt. Medium-bodied. A nice winter-warmer.

Aroma: like a campfire with some maltiness and alcohol underneath; Appearance: very dark with pillowy tan head that slowly dissipates; some lacing; dominated by smoke flavor; slightly reminiscent of liquid smoke but Im trying to get over it; underlying porter is sweet and malty; Palate: heavy with smoky and sweet finish; Overall: like pumpkin ale, its good until you hit the wall with the smokiness; would enjoy about once per year; improves as temperature rises.
On tap at 3 Square in Maple Grove. Wife really liked this one wants me to hunt some more down for the fridge. Get lots of smoke. Good Porter.

Watching the Grey Cup at the Yard House with my home team in it. First of three dark beers. Pours a dark brown colour with a beige creamy-frothy head, good retention and lacing. Vanilla nose over chocolate malts and some smoke. The smoke is more present in the taste over the roasted malts and decent hops. Chocolate notes. A nice smoked dark beer that is well-balanced and not too overpowering on the smoke-side.
Alaska claimed! Oaky. Smoky. Lighter for a porter. Not really mind blowing. The oak is too overpowering.

Tap; pours black with a mocha colored head; smoky aroma with roasted malt, chocolate, licorice, and dark fruit; taste is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, and hints of dark fruits and smoke; dry smoky finish with light bitterness; excellent smoked porter

Pours a dark color with a tan head with various sized bubbles with some lacing. Smell is a very strong, smoky campfire smell. The bottle is what attracted me to it when it claimed it was one of the best beers ever made. Taste is MINDBLOWINGLY good! If youre a fan of expensive coffee, this may be the brew! Roasted coffee, roasted nuts and seeds, dark chocolate, a dash of dark fruits and a nice snap at the end. Most high quality beers have a feel of watered down motor oil going down and this most certainly does!

The only gripe is that itll set you back nearly 7$ for a single bottle, but its well worth it!

22 oz bottle poured at a tasting. 2012 vintage. I have been able to find a decently wide variety of vintages of this just hanging around market shelves, so I hope to play the vertical game on this one. Pours black, with a tan swirl fizz head. Huge smoked aroma, as expected. A ton of roasted malt, with the nice camp fire character throughout. Standout beer. Awesome.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 Release 2012 & 2013: pours black color, clear, slightly haze, with off-white foamy, stable head. visually low carbonation. Aroma: prevail malt aroma of smoked, like smoked bacon, with dark malts, which takes on coffee, dark chocolate, supported with aroma of dark fruits, like plums, prunes.
Flavor: strong malt flavors, which takes on coffee, dark chocolate, with smoky note in the background, supported with strong fruity notes of dark fruits, especially of plums and cherries. Hop flavors takes on pine. Hop bitterness is moderate medium, malt sweetness is medium, finish is sticky, dry, body is light full, carbonation is low, texture is soft.

Aroma is nice and baconny. Roasted chocolate notes, some coffee. Good aroma. Taste is nice and creamy with some bitterness. Carbonation is on the high side and body is medium. Together with the carbonation this takes away from the beer and makes is too light bodied for me.

Bottle 65cl. (vintage 2012, bottle date 18/09/12). Almost opaque deep ruby brown color, large frothy tan head, mostly diminishing, good lacing; strong smoked aroma, roasted malts, bacon, light vanilla, hints of chocolate and coffee; taste is smoky, medium sweet and bitter, light chocolate; full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, rich aftertaste, mild bittersweet, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee; a rich, complex and well-balanced smoked porter, a beer like a meal.

2015 Vintage - Poured into pint glass.

This hearty winter seasonal is warm and inviting, & unique in flavor due to their use of alder wood. 

A beautiful dark brown color, almost black.

Smells of good smoke.

The flavor is one of charred wood, roasty chocolate, & fruity highlights of cherry or plum as it warms. Theres a pleasant smoky aftertaste & finishing notes of black tea. Its smokey but not terribly bitter as other attempts at rauchbiers outside of Germany can tend to be. 

The mouthfeel creamy, beckoning you to take one more sip.

45 out of 50

Pours a dark brown with a thin off-white head. Aroma is smoke, jerky, caramel, and chocolate. Flavor is smoke and jerky, with some caramel and subtle chocolate. Has a moderate bitterness. Great beer with unique smoked malts.

Sample @ Borefts Beer Festival 2015. Pours pitch black with a big brown head. Aroma is malty, roasty, smokey, dark fruits, chocolate. Taste is roasty, dark chocolate, dark fruits, caramel, coffee, gunpowder, smoke.

2012 Vintage poured into a teku showing dark translucent brown with a finger of thick latte colored foam. 

The nose is shows a good mix of moderately intense whisky, smoke, and steel tank. 

The palate is medium bodied and very foamy. Flavors of very light smoke and some bourbon notes. Light smoky bitterness on the finish with a light smoked nuttiness. The finish returns back to the smoky bitterness. Overall, a very foamy and lightly flavored easy drinking porter. Flavor is lighter than what I wanted but that the body and foaminess combine together to make it very drinkable.

(Alaskan Smoked Porter) Bottle 650 ml at home, vintage 2012. Served into a snifter, ABV 6.5%
Totally black colour on the body, almost two full fingers of a quite thick, beige head. Pretty good retention.
Aroma has smoke, roasted malts, liquorice, light vanilla, fruity notes of prunes among others.
Taste has subtle smoke, leather, dark roasted malts, coal, chocolate. Nicely bitter finish with a light smokey aftertaste.
A bit thin on the body with good carbonation, sticky on the palate. 
Great beer.

Bottle 2012 (re-rate, because I forgot to put the year in ) @ home. Pours black with a small fizzy, fast disappearing, beige head. Aroma of smoke, bacon, some chocolate, roasted malts. Taste is light bitter, roasted malts, smoke, bacon, some dark chocolate, bitter coffee. Bit thin mouthfeel. Aftertaste of smoke and dark chocolate. Not bad, but expected a little more with this reputation.

2012 bottle. Solid smoke aroma, both wood and meat. Clear, very dark brown with unstable light beige head. Complex smoke flavour, roast and coffee, chocolate later on. Good bitterness to balance. Light mouthfeel, easily drinkable. Perfect with cheese on a friday afternoon...

650ml bottle, vintage 2012. Pours a medium to abundant, frothy and creamy, beige/gray head; deep black color, nice retention. Smells sweet cocoa beans, wood, delicate espresso, bit of spice / vanilla. Tastes full roasted malts, chocolate, dried fruits, hints of licorice, light smoked; both medium sweetness and bitterness, clean roasty and smokey finish. Quite low carbonation, medium body, slick texture. Great balance and drinkability for the style of beer, very nice and smooth

0.65l bottle, vintage 2012. Very dark ruby, almost black body, light brown head. Aroma of smoke, chocolate, caramel and sour cherry. Taste is like the aroma, but its more fruity and has a decent floral hop bite to it. Awesome beer.

Rating #1100. Årgang 2012. Gave fra Heidi. Kulsort. Lækker røget porter med masser af røgmalt, afdæmpet chokolade og kaffe. Blid i munden og ikke så voldsom som ventet, men meget smagfuld og afbalanceret.

2012 vintage. Pours clear dark brown with minimal brown head. Aroma is heavy yet balanced roasted malts, dark chocolate, nuts. Heavy hops, spruce, lemon, orange. Leather, dough, sweat. Notes of tar, smoke, red berries, tobacco. Moderate sweet, bitter and acidic. Long sharp and metallic aftertaste. Body is medium, palate is watery to oily, carbonation is medium. Excellent but lacks some body.

Edycja 2013.
Kolor: Ciemno brunatny. Piwo jest idealnie klarowne.
Piana: Obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, mało trwała, pozostawia niezły lacing.
Aromat: Średnio intensywna wędzonka (nie kojarzy się z szynką, raczej w typie dymu z ogniska), rodzynki, trufle z nadzieniem rumowym, czekolada, wędzona śliwka, kawa - aromat jest świetny i bardzo złożony.
Smak: Goryczka niska do średniej, nieco zalegająca, pełnia średnia, piwo jest półwytrawne. Wędzonka (bardziej intensywna niż w aromacie), kawa, rodzynki, rum, czekolada schodzi tu na dalszy plan. Bardzo dobre piwo.
Wysycenie: Niskie do średniego - Ok.
Opakowanie: Charakterystyczna etykieta. Brak konkretnych informacji poza ABV. Poczytałbym to za wadę, gdyby nie to, że piwo jest marką samą w sobie i jest wśród beergeeków bardzo rozpoznawalne.
Uwagi: Świetne piwo, ale bardzo degustacyjne. Spotkałem się z opinią, że jest bardzo pijalne i jej nie podzielam. Tym niemniej w kategorii porter wędzony trafia na drugie miejsce w moim osobistym rankingu zaraz po Ondzie z Bevoga
Like a nice, peaty Scotch only it is a beer. Not for everyone, but totally for me.

Bue en bouteille de 66cl à la brasserie.
(Ouverte depuis 24h à renoter) Vintage 2008
Couleur noire, peu de mousse et pas deffervescence.
Nez sur le café.
Attaque sur le café, le chocolat et le mocca, petite pointe fumée en fin de bouche avec de la tourbe qui prend la bouche.
Très bonne malgré le fait quelle soit éventée.

Bue en bouteille de 50cl. Malheureusement ouverte depuis la veille donc plus de CO2 du tout. Couleur pétrole, nez café poivré. Très belle complexité au palais, quasi liquoreuse, malt grillé, café, grande longueur en bouche. A regoûter mais très plaisante.

650ml bottle. 2013. Pours a dark opaque brown with thin off white head that doesnt last long. Aroma is cocoa, coffee a little smoke, bacon, charcoal. Really nice smooth texture. Just smoky enough. Bacon and coffee. Twiglets at the end.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2016 Black color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light brown head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, smoke, vanilla. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft.

2013. Deep brown color, beige head. Roasted malt nose, cured meat, smoke, chocolate, fruity notes. Roasted malt taste, coffee, licorice, light smoked, meat, hint of brown sugar. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture.
Yes dark robust brew. Cocoa and dark roast. Nice smokiness. Very dry and clean finish with some earthy hops in end.

Aroma: intense bacon, smoked, coffee, chocolate. Appearance: black, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: bitters continue, toasted malts, some caramel, bacon, smoky and savoury flavours. Overall: very nice Smoked, very well balanced. Pint at the brewery, Juneau.

2013 edition. Bottle (65cl) from Vinmonopolet, Oslo. Black colour. Inch-thick beige head, good retention (except for short-lived lacing), settles as a thick ring. Aroma of malt, smoked meat, lactose, slightly vegetal. Medium body, soft carbonation, nicely chewy compared with your average porter. Taste is mostly dry, well balanced by a pleasantly sweet maltiness, lightly smoked, with a mild bitterness that becomes more dominant towards the finish.
On tap @ Alaskan Brewing Company. Good balanced amount of smoke in this one, and its tasty. Beef jerky, chocolate. Complex and balanced.

Black and opaque color, has fine cream-colored foam. The aroma of smoked highlighted, old smoked ham, coffee, raisins, other dried fruits, peat and а hint of Scotch. Taste very velvety, soft, pleasant, and slightly warming, coffee, dark chocolate, sherry and old whiskey, smoked salmon and bacon. Perfect balance, really great beer. And after spicy and hopped previous one!

Poured from bomber into a snifter
 Appearance  The beer pours a super dark brown, bordering on black color with a nice billowy tan colored head. The head has a great level of retention, slowly fading over time to leave a god sum of foamy and stringy lace on the sides of the glass.
 Smell  The aroma of the beer is rather strong of a sweeter aroma with lots of molasses and caramel mixed with a good showing of a brownie smell of a slightly burnt and roasty nature. Along with these aromas comes a nice smoky smell mixed with a little bit of a grainy and hay-like aroma. Overall, the aroma is dark, smoky, and sweet. Its quite nice.
 Taste  The taste begins with a sweet caramel and molasses taste as the nose would have suggested. Along with these sweeter tastes is a rather strong roasty flavor containing within a nice hit of grain and char. As the taste advances some of the sweeter tastes dwindle a bit all while more char and some rather smoky flavors come to the tongue. The smoke really comes on strong more toward the end, and with some hay, more roast and a loss of the sweeter tastes, one is left with a rather nice roasty and smoky porter flavor to linger on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is a on the slightly thinner side for a porter with a carbonation level that is on the slightly lower side as well. The lower carbonation is great for the darker, smoky, and upfront sweet nature of the beer, allowing all the flavors to really coat the tongue. While said, a little thicker of a body would have accentuated these nice flavors even better, really allowing all the dark tastes to linger on the tongue. Overall, the feel was just OK.
 Overall  This was a very flavorful and tasty smoked porter with a nice sweet start mixed with a good showing of smoke and char flavor later on. If only the body was a bit thicker it would have been totally spot one. A very good one to try if you have not yet had it. Quite tasty overall.

BOTTLE 65CL from Bov. 2013 vintage. Almost black, with clear red highlights and a small mocha head. It starts rather smoky with notes of smoked bacon Bamberg style, and even some smoked fish. After the smoke calms down, you get some simple chocolate topping. The taste is low to moderate black malt sweetness, the smoke leaves a spicy note, low to moderate spicy bitterness and some ashes in the finish. So, apart from the savoury smokiness, this is a good, Smooth, but simple porter.

Vintage 2012. 
En välavvägd doft som domineras av rök, kött och kol. Här finns även en tydlig och tämligen söt maltarom. Hade nog förväntat mig mer komplexitet dock.
Brygden är helt svart och har ett snyggt, tätt skum med lång varaktighet.
Smaken är centrerad kring ett beskt kaffeartat nav med strålar ut mot karamellmalt, lakrits och torkad frukt  allt ackompanjerat av en trevligt avrundad rök.
Den direkta eftersmaken är förvånansvärt kort men det ligger kvar en svag, rökigt besk efterklang därefter.
Kroppen är förvisso fyllig men ger inget rikt intryck. Snarare kan fylligheten tillskrivas ett gott hantverk än en uppumpad trendighet.

Draft. Tight lace. Aroma of smoky ham and cereal grains, maybe oats. Flavors of mocha, chewy something, with a bit of chalk and a faint hint of dried fruit. For most of the time the beer is on the palate it vacillates between sweet and smoky, back and forth. Tremendous.
Botella @IPA - La Cervecería del Millón de IBUs, Gijon color amarillo oscuro, aromas resinosos final amargo. Color negro, espuma beige, aroma ahumado sabor maltoso.

Darkest brown, almost black. Rocky light-brown head.
Intense aromas of smoked ham, coffee, iodine, seaweed, squid ink (its a very marine porter).
Taste is salty, savoury and bitter. Soft and creamy. Long finish.

Pitch black beer with a generous foamy dark head and lots of bubbles.
Smell is lots of smoke and bbq meat, some leather, subtle hints of hop, bit of sharp lemon. Bit of roasted nuts. Salty, with some creamy chocolate.
Taste is creamy oily watery bitterness, beautifully balanced. Smoke and meat are a little bit less present with a bit more chocolate and some coffee. Nice fizz, touch of ash, resin. Full mouthfeel and full finish with a light astringence.
Between a porter and a smoked beer, I can find better specimens, which are not as herbal as this one. Interesting, but the heavy herbal tones on the flavour put me off.

Bottle a dark brown black colored beer with a tiny beige head aroma roasted malts smoke dark fruits caramel spicy and some hops flavor roasted malts smoke dark fruits spicy some citrus dry fruits and hops
Noire, effervescence faible, col brun moyen. Principalement maltée, viande grillée, bien fumée, présence de fruits noirs, un peu lourde.

2013 Btl pours deep dark opaque brown color, huge fluffy tan head that disappears quickly leaving no lace. Aromas of, burnt wood,charcoal, earth and the inside of a meat smoker. Tastes of campfire smoke,dark chocolate,sweet caramel and earth. Medium body, creamy, soft mouthfeel, a tad under carbonated , and a finish that puts a twang on the tip of your tongue. The smoke stays in your mouth long after the beer is gone! This is my first smoked beer. I felt the intense smokiness was a little overwhelming. I thought a year of aging would mellow the flavors out a bit but they still were pretty bold. It was good but not great.
Butelka wypita w USA. Kolor czarny, piana obfita gęsta. Aromat suszonych śliwek,karmelu. Smak karmelu,wędzonek i suszonych śliwek. Średnie nagazowanie, łagodne piwo. Bardzo dobre,świetnie ułożone.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2015 Bottle 65cl / Botella 65cl. (Vintage 2012)
@ Cervezorama 2.0.
A: Black / Negro.
T/S: Roasted malt, smoked bacon, sweet, chocolate / Malta tostada, bacon ahumado, dulce, chocolate.

Sample, draught, during the Great American Beer Festival (Denver), savoured on October 4 2014; eye: black, opaque, tiny ring of grayish brown head, no lacing; nose: smoky, meaty, malt; mouth: smoky, meaty, malt, light hops, meaty finale with smoky presence, full body, average carbonation, lightly bitter, rich texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, en fût, lors du Great American Beer Festival (Denver), savourée le 4 octobre 2014; il : noire, opaque, petit anneau de mousse brun-gris, pas de dentelle; nez : fumé, viandeux, malt; bouche : fumé, viandeux, malt, léger houblon, finale viandeuse avec présence de fumé, corsé, carbonatation moyenne, légèrement amère, texture riche; en résumé : bien

650ml bottle of 2012 vintage. Black with tall but fairly quickly disappearing beige-brown head leaving some lacing. Smoky, peaty aroma with some tar, liqorice and hints of coffee and chocolate in the background. Taste is dominated by smoke, peat and roasted malts and grains but also has some bitter coffee and chocolate and hints of tar. Very nice smoke character and a good porter, just a little too thin on the mouthfeel, maybe drinking fresher or aging longer wouldve fixed that though.

Version 2013. Black with mocha color foam. Smoky aroma and roasted malt with some fruit in the background. Taste of dark chocolate and coffee with a bitter finish of roasted malt.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Endlich ein ausgewogenes Rauchbier, das nicht nach Schinken und Speck riecht. Angenehme Raucharomen, etwas Schokolade. Leicht Bitter im Antrunk, fruchtig nach Pflaumen, trockenfrüchten. Recht voll, kaum Säure, wenig Co2. Rauch ist immer präsent aber nie penetrant. Fein.

Couleur noire, légère mousse brune. Fort nez de chocolat, malté un peu fumé et notes douces. Gout malté, chocolat avec note fumées et amères (café) et notes de fruits secs et tourbe en fin de bouche, voir caramel et réglisse. Corps onctueux. Pas mal

0,651 l bottle from P&M Getränke, 2008 vintage. Clear, very dark red to black with a thin, foamy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Heavy and dominating aroma of dark chocolate, accompanied by more subtle hints of smoke, raisins, sherry and coffee. Sweetish taste of dark chocolate, followed by sherry and a subtle smokiness along with a gentle sourish note. Rather long, slightly bitter finish with lots of smoke and dark chocolate. Very nice to see the different flavours emerging one after another. Thin to medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, absolutely flat. Really good vintage beer. It has all the complexity you would expect from it as the different flavours are not just overpowered by the smoke. The body has not thinned out that much so that this beer is a very nice sipper. However, it lacks a bit of excitement preventing it from getting top scores.
How: Bottle Appearance: pitch black, minimal off-white head. Aroma: Smoked meat, wood, coffee, tobacco, bitter chocolate, rasins. Palate: medium to full body, soft carbonation.

3/14/15 from bomber dated 10/06/14. Nice chocolately head and color. Malty smokey flavor without much bitterrness. Very good. Kind of a leathery woody aroma and taste. One of the best porters I've had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours black with a medium head. In 2012 version aroma is smoky bacon with a hints of roasted notes. 2008 version aroma is different - a lot of smoked plums. Taste is smoky, rather sweet with roasted, caramel notes. Medium body, light carbonation. Very good smoked porter.

bottle @ hugos. Appearance: pours black with ok off-white foamy head with some acing. aroma/taste: caramel, chocolate, wood, coffee, smoke and dried fruits. palette: low to medium carbonation, full body, some caramel sweetness, average bitterness, dry finish, long duration and an oily texture. Overall: very nice complex stout

Pretty much best smoked porter that is readily available. Smell like an Alaskan salmon smoker, with great olfactory senses. Great porter mouthfeel with perfect co2. Nice roasts finish and dry. Oh so drinkable.

[Bottle from 2013]
Olive black colour, light tan ginger pillowy head. Smokey bacon, leather, fresh cut peat, subtle dried fruit & tobacco notes, light earthy with hints of black olives and roast malt notes. Light sweet-bitter harmonic with a notch of acidity and a certain complexity reminicent of leather, olives, roast malts and even liquorice. Medium-full body, bit slick texture, softly carbonated with a long lasting finish.

Bottle 65cl. Light brown head diminishing. Dark brown color. Aroma is chocolate malt, a lot of smoke and a great package of leather. Hint of berries. Taste is sweet, dry and strong. The leather is by all very present here.

2012 edition. Looks nicely: black with good head. Aroma: surprisingly very low smoke (probably because of 3 years of aging), well-distinguished: dark chocolate, coffee and cherry notes. Carbonation is too high. Smoke is in after-taste. Very good, well-arranged beer. Very similar to aged baltic porters.

2014 version. First pour: bomber into a tulip glass. Second pour: into a pilsener glass to try to see more (color, carbonation). Pours very dark, almost opaque black. 1.5 in thick tan head that retains nicely. Leaves thick, clinging lace as it receded. (This pilsener pour had a much larger head, that collapsed with a very nice visual effect from the bottom up. Also, if I backlit the pilsener, I could see a very dark red color behind the front-lit black.) Smokey aroma, as expected from the name, with a faint meaty bacon or ham note. A bit of a boozy smell, even though it is only 6.5%. Pleasant aroma, but not the traditional beer-like. Smokey flavor on initial taste, with a mild bitterness lasting into the aftertaste. Thick, creamy mouth feel. Almost no carbonation visible in the tulip or in the feel. The smoky bacon is there in the taste, but the smokiness is more subtle than I was expecting. With backlighting in the pilsener, I was able to observe light carbonation. The malt backbone of this beer is well represented, but still, the overriding taste is smoky and somewhat bitter. I would have expected more of a malt-forward taste for a porter, but I do like the taste nonetheless. I have two other bottles that my intention is to drink one per year and see how it ages. Im looking forward to see how this very good beer changes with age.
Smoky aroma... Color is black brown... Flavor is overwhelmingly smoky, like eating from a campfire... Almost too much... Okay at best, but I like my homebrewed version better.

Aroma is quite interesting - lots of smoke, malt, beechwood, even a sausage-like aroma.

Color is brownish-black, lightly cloudy, with a small white to off-white head.

Taste is heavy on the sweet with a long duration.

Palate is full bodied.

Overall a pretty good beer with some interesting and unusual aromas. I think the smoke is a bit too dominant for my taste though.

Mørk med medium høyde på skummet. Aroma av røyk, noe kaffe og noe tørket frukt. Smaken er kaffe og røyk (som i røkt skinke, bacon osv). Noe søt, med en mild bitterhet i ettersmaken. Tynn/medium konsistens.
Nice porter on the roastier side. Was having this with bbq so the smoke wasnt overwhelming. Would like to taste this layer without the bbq influencing my palate.
Transports you to Alaska with smoky notes reminiscent of smoked salmon or venison meat. Dark color. Strong smoky and coffee aromas. Rich and full bodied.

Black / brown beer with a beige head.
Taste malts, Smooky, coffee and raisins.
Bitter and smokkey afthertaste.
Good beer with only 6.5% alcohol.
One of the finest smoked beers on the planet. I really want to dink this with a couple of hot Filipino hookers while sitting around a campfire.
Bomber thanks to RespertFTW from notes. Deep brown with a dark head. Lots of roastiness and bitter malt. Not much smoke. Was hoping for much more from this.

Bottle dated 2013, gift from a friend. Dark brown, black, clear, nice beige head, disappears quickly leaving some bigger bubbles. Aroma can be easily smelt during pouring. Obviously smoky (pleasantly) and cocoa. VERY nice taste. medium sweet again smoky notes. Bitter and lasting finish. Oily, full bodied. Average carbonation.

Its got great balance between smokiness and a robust porter.

2013 edition, bottle. Pours in black body with high creamy tan head. Aroma has dark fruits, heavy roasty, light toffee. On the taste side, its pretty roasty, like bacon with low to medium earthy bitterness, the bacon is long in the after taste. Some coffee notes in the after taste, light on any sweetness. Body is full, light oily, medium to high carbonation. Not very well balanced in my opinion.

Alaskan Smoked Porter długo czekał w mojej piwnicy na degustację. I warto było czekać! Piwo w kolorze smoły, nieprzejrzyste zupełnie. Fajna, beżowa piana. Zapach unosił się w powietrzu już podczas nalewania do szkła. Czekolada i solidne nuty palone zdominowały odczucia węchowe. Smak to dopiero ogień! Znów mnóstwo czekolady i paloność na idealnym poziomie! Taka, jaką lubię. Także moc trunku jest taka, jak być powinna. Delikatnie piecze w podniebienie, bez ostrych uderzeń alkoholu! Wysycenie dość niskie, co sprzyja pijalności tego ciężkiego, wydawałoby się, trunku. Świetne, świetne piwo, warte swojej ceny!

Vintage of 2008. 65 cl bottle. Drinking 9/05/2014. Black and opaque color, has fine cream-colored foam. The aroma of smoked highlighted, old smoked ham, coffee, raisins, other dried fruits, peat and а hint of Scotch. Taste very velvety, soft, pleasant, and slightly warming, coffee, dark chocolate, sherry and old whiskey, smoked salmon and bacon. Perfect balance, great beer.
Bottle from saveur biere, france. Black color, brown head. Aroma is mainly smoke, roasty. Roasty body, smoke, coffee. Quite nice porter.

Bottle, 650mL. Home. A pitch blach beer with big beige creamy head ; good retention and lacing. Aroma of caramel, burnt, light smoky, herbal, dry fruit. Medium sweet, medium herbal bitter, abit dry. Medium body and texture, average carbonation, bittersweet lasting finish. Overall, really good "smoked porter" ; nevertheless, more "burnt" than "smoked".
Black with dark brown head . Wonderful smoked malt aroma . Silky smooth . Smoke , dark cocoa , mild roast coffee , mild smoke finish ...full body...great beer
Gedronken op onze bier proefavond. Één van de eerste smoked bieren die me goed bevalt.

Bottle. Pours an opaque black with a high, fluffy, lacy, light tan head. Nose is smoke, rubber, coffee, chocolate, ash, and wet earth. On the tongue, the smoke is intense, but balanced; its very forward, followed by espresso and earthy notes. Not much sweetness at all, though theres a little molasses and maple hanging around the edges just to keep it from being overwhelming. Really round, rich, and smooth on the tongue, with a long smoky finish. Intensely tasty.
Black pour at home from 22oz bottle. Whiskey and sweet taste. Strong. A great beer

2014 Bottle stamped A2014.
Glass: Tired Hands wine glass.
Appearance: Black body with a creamy mocha head.
Aroma: The aroma is strong of smoke left on clothes after a campfire with a dash of bitter dark chocolate. Aromas of coffee are present, though subdued. The smoke is strong here but not out of order.
Taste: Smoke is prominent, like campfire, that lingers long after the sip. The malt base is a bit mild with hints of chocolate and roasted malts. The body and flavor isnt as robust as the aroma though.
Palate: Medium to thick bodied, mild to moderate carbonation.
Overall: A darn fine smoked beer, one I would like to find on my local liquor store shelves. I wish the body had a little more umph to it though as well as the malt characteristic.
-Short review. 2008 vintage- Sweet smokey notes with burnt espresso. Full palate. Overall: Impressive considering the ABV.

bottle at home. 2012 edition. black cloudy color. coffee colored head. lots of coffee smell, raisins, mulberry, some chocolate, smoky aroma. medium body, taste of chocolate, smoky, coffee, some dried fruits, again mulberry, very good lots of flavor, good medium bitter finish.
Sehr torfiger Geruch. Im Geschmack dann Rauch und ein bisschen wässrig. Kaum Bitter. Leichte Röstaromen.

Geruch torfig-rauchig mit Sirup und Malz. Interessante Kombination. Sehr erdig im Geschmack, kalter Rauch, Schinken. Leider wenig süß und auch nicht die typischen Schokoladenaromen, die man in einem Porter erwarten würde. Vollmundigkeit nimmt etwas zu, sobald das Bier wärmer wird.
Currently I am updating my ratebeer with al the beers I drank but was too lazy to rate at the time. I give the scores I gave back than. If I drink the beers again I might re-rate them.

Bottle at home. Pours brown color, dark beige head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, smoked, vanilla, licorice. Taste is medium bitter, lightly sweet, coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, nicely smoked, vanilla.

Butelka 2013. W zapachu karmel, czekolada belgijska, espresso, nuty spodu od ciasta, wędzoność. Kolor niemal nieprzejrzysty czarny, z rubinowymi refleksami. Wysycenie średnie, piana gęsta beżowa, przyjemny lacing. W smaku świetnie zbalansowana współpraca wędzoności, rasowej czekolady i kawy połączona z karmelem i biszkoptem, piwo nie jest gęste, nie jest też wodniste, po prostu idealny balans który sprawia że jest ono ekstremalnie pijalne. Lekko kremowa faktura i słodkie espresso na długim finiszu tworzą genialną kombinację. Wzór do naśladowania.

Sampled from a 0.65l bottle @ RBNG 2014. This is a bottle from 2012. In the glass this one has a deep and dark brown body that has a little sidesticking kinda dark beige top. Smells smoked alright. Beefy smoke with a little bit of both dry licorice and chocolate. Smells nice. Yeah, its also smoked in the taste. Like matches, burned matches, soft beef jerky and chocolate. Gliding light oily in the mouth and soft to average on the prickling carbonation level. Quite flavorful. Probably worth a revisit. 15.02.2014
The leader and original in the category. You have to like/appreciate smoked beers to dig this beer.

Bottle at RichTheVillans tasting, 27/11/13. Clear dark brown, nice head leaves good lace. Rounded savoury smoke and sweet roast malt on the nose, touch of peat. Moderate sweet, chocolate, light coffee, dark toffee malt, medium hop bitterness, very dry finish, luscious smoky character. Very smooth, creamy, maybe a touch too spritzy but incredibly drinkable.
Deep brown appearance. Smoky meat and campfire in aroma. Taste follows suit, super smooth.

Bottiglia 65 CL, colore nero con un cappello di schiuma color nocciola e poco persistente. Al naso è molto semplice ma pulita, affumicato e in secondo piano note maltate, caffè e cioccolato. Al palato risulta molto simile con un aggiunta di liquirizia nel finale. Corpo medio, poco carbonata. Davvero buona
Not a bad beer. Smoked as a burned wood or coal. Well balanced but a bit soy souce like. Overall a good beer. Had better though.

650ml bottle, v2011, at home. Black color with beige brown frothy-creamy head. Aroma is roasted malty, bready, light chocolate, smoked, bacon. Taste is sweet and bitter, roasted malt again, chocolate and coffee, smoked. Body is medium, thin to oily, average carbonation, nice smoked and malty finish.

Sampled from a bottle, 
this beer had a dark brown-black pour and gave a tan, chocolate shake one to two finger head of bubbles that receded to a cover and ring, it left nice spots and fingers of lacing on the glass, 

it had aromas of a wood fire smoke, toasted malt and some roasted malt, coffee, a touch of oily smoke, 
some malt and brown sugar sweetness in the background, 

the flavor was wood fire and oily smoke, toasted malt and a little roasted malt, black coffee, 
faint caramel and chocolate, there was a little malt and/or hop bitterness after the finish, 

the mouth feel was light medium and creamy on the lips, and it had average carbonation, 

a very smokey porter, smoke was out front on the nose and flavor, a nice blend of a smoke drink.
From bottle . Dark murkyish brown. Coffee, burnt malt and whisky on the nose. Same burnt in flavour with a strong buttery component. Smooth after taste.
Poured from 1 pint 6 fl oz bottle. Dark brown, near black with beige head. Aroma of smoked malt, mild bacon. Flavour same with mild roast malt and leather. Medium body.
belle couleur noire; petite mousse beige; arômes de fumée; goût malté, café et un peu de houblon; finale avec une amertume intéressante et un peu de fumée qui reste assez longtemps

Dark and tan head. Aroma of smoke, chocolate. Tastes smokey, cocoa, tobacco and dark dried fruit. Heavy slick body. Long smokey finish. Awesome sipper great fall campfire beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a solid black with a short tan head. It has a rich, smokey aroma with some tobacco, chocolate, and dark malt. The flavor is smoke and dark malt with a dark chocolate finish and smooth body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 edition, 65cl shared bottle @ home from Mitra.
Body is dark brown,
Head is small, fizzy, mostly diminishing, good lacing.
Nose is smoked ham,
Aroma is smoke, chocolate, mild coffee, ash.
Taste is medium to heavy roasty bitter.
Finish is long lasting, moderated smokey roasty bitter.
Full body, slightly sticky texture, soft carbonation.
Not bad, but too much hype.

2013-Pours the color of black with a small tannish head. It definitely has a smoke aroma but there is something more, some kind of sweetness that I cant put my finger on. I am kind of afraid that the taste will follow the nose, I cant see how it cant. Im scared. The aroma slaps me in the face when I go to drink it. Scareder. Taste does follow the nose but its not bad, yet. Maybe a Smokey caramel/chocolate flavor that seems to get easier to drink the more you drink(thats a good thing with anything you drink). Overall a unique flavored beer that is really good but I dont know if its what I crave as a beer, but it is good. Hard for me to rate.

[2013] 22oz bottle. Deep brown with a frothy tan head. Flavors are smoked meat, roasted malts, molasses, chocolate, coffee, charred wood, caramel, licorice with fruity and salty notes. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

rich and intensely flavored" is right...for better or worse. Most people love or hate this beer. the smokiness is anything but subtle. A good dose in the nose. While in the mouth, the big full bodied porter qualities get to come out and play, but the finish is almost all smoke...and is there a hint of fishiness in that finish? recommended. definitely unique. stones is a touch thinner, but easier to drink. i like this beer (my wife hates it) but i dont think id want to polish off a 22 by myself."
Dark brown with a medium brown head. Aroma is coffee, smoke, ham and grain. Taste is chocolate, coffee and malt
Bottle at home, 2012 vintage. Pours black, dry and bitter, smokier as it warms.

Bottles from Rehills, Newcastle and Safeway, Heaton, Newcastle (now closed). 2012 Vintage aged for 2 years before drinking. This inky black beer pours with a thin tan head. It has a slight sour red fruity flavour, liquorice and salty brine notes followed by a gentle smoked finish. Superb!

22oz bottle - pours black with dark brown head . Wonderful smoked malt aroma . Silky smooth . Smoke , dark cocoa , mild roast coffee , mild smoke finish ... Could drink this all day . Excellent ! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Toll für Whisky Liebhaber
---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 vintage bottle from the Trembling Madness in York. Pours black with a thin tan head. Starts rich and meaty with a fair amount of spiciness. Peaty smoke on the finish. Very good quite intense beer there are chocolate notes and a little coffee too. Slight band aid finish.

Had a bunch of times and it does differ, vintage to vintage. But it is always really good. Never a distracting problem always great smoke aroma and roasty charcter, and always perfect head and carbonation. A++++ brew

On tap at Apex. 2012 vintage. 

A: Deep black, cappuccino head, good lacing. 

N: Band-aids, campfire ashes, some cocoa, bacon fat, and a hint of lactose. 

T: Big smoke, good sweetness. 

M: Medium-heavy body. A touch creamy. 

O: After the Baltique, this one is appreciably less rich. The smoke elements are still there, but it does fall short in comparison. At the same time, this is a venerable beer and its still worth your time, especially aged.
22oz bomber. Smells like salmon smoker minus the fish. One of best brews around. Smoke roast coffee toffee, all in nose and taste, rich mouthfeel and just overall great brewski
Brown/black with a half inch of tan head. Aroma is phenolic and smoky with chocolate. Taste is the same, and finishes in band aid.

light beige head fades fast with structured lacing. coffee coloured. aroma is leather and roasted malts. taste like aroma, lactose, lots of liquorice and bitter chocolate aftertaste is long bitter. medium body and carbonation. smokey for sure, but real nice especially for the abv. bottle 65cl / 2012 version / bbf may-2017

660ml bottle at home. Dark brown with a medium tan head with low retention. Medium to full body with light to moderate carbonation. Smoked sweetness with some herbal bitterness. Roasted malts, brown sugar, wood, coffee, spices and herbs. A quality porter.

Illata egy jól ismert, pörkölt malátás hangulatú porter karakterét eleveníti meg, melyhez csak pár fázissal később csatlakozik egy égetett faháncsos, tölgyfás, kissé sós és füstölt húsos aroma. Az illatjegyek között ez esetben is ott bujkál egy édeskés, kávés vonulat, mely kissé finomítja az összképet, ami azonban csak belekóstolva válik igazán kiegyensúlyozottá. A füstös pörköltség foka ugyanis épp ideális ahhoz, hogy ezt a jellemvonást anélkül tudjuk a sör lényegi elemének tekinteni, hogy az összes többi komponens statisztaszerepet játszana az előadásban.
