Ugyan robusztus, masszív darab, a csípőskés szénsavasság és a kezdeti intenzitás után kisimul a szerkezet, és egyre befogadóbbá válunk az ízjegyek iránt, melyeket egyébként egy karakteresebb porter, vagy éppen stout esetén is örömmel fedeznénk fel azzal a szinte üdítő különbséggel, amit a tölgyfacsipszes pörköltség pikáns vonulata csempész az italunkba. Jellemvonásainak az érlelés következtében történő változása újabb tesztelés alapját képezhetné, biztos vagyok benne, hogy az idő ez esetben csak nemesítené a fenséges testet...

Bouteille 09/10/13. Une bière brune foncée presque noire avec une mousse brune épaisse. Un nez de moule fumée, chocolat et caramel. Une superbe texture quasi huileuse. Une bouche au saveurs de fumé, de poisson, une touche diode (très peu). Très bien faite, un classique

Vintage 2013. Merci à dresden pour la bouteille. Cette bière qui est presque noire développe une mousse beige foncée. Le nez offre une prestation des plus intéressantes : malts fumés, chocolat fruité, mélasse, touche de réglisse et pointe de jambon fumé. En bouche, des saveurs de bois brûlé et de café viennent se rajouter aux éléments chocolatés, fumés et rôtis. Au palais, le corps crémeux quoffre cette bière est digne de mention. En arrière-goût, une amertume de grains noirs et une fumée contagieuse refusent obstinément de quitter lintérieur de ma bouche. Merveilleuse!

2012 Alaskan Smode Porter in a 650 ml bottle. Very dark to black colored with a small brown head. light sweetness, medium bitterness, very smokey. full smooth body with a slick feel.. I really like this one!

Bottle: Black center with some translucent, deep mahogany & ruby outlining the edges; a fine, light-tan film quickly disperses on top. Lovely aroma of sweet, smoked sausages & ham, sweet campfire smoke, peated malt, roast, faint molasses, & a bit of charcoal. Just a down & dirty smoked beer, but I love how the smoke show so much intensity & refinement all at once. Never overbearing. Same goes for the flavor. Smooth smoke & roast. Smoky meat & charred hickory sausages, with a moderately sweet liquid smoke undertone. Slight, burnt chocolate peaks in towards the finish. Aftertaste is like waking up and sniffing your fire-pit the morning after a campfire. Spent wood chips, smoked, charred, & ever so slightly sweet. Smooth, medium body with a mild oiliness. This is a truly awesome smoked porter.

2013 From a 22 oz. Bottle. Like black coffee. Absolutely no head at all. You can immediately smell and taste the smoke. Great earthy flavor with a smooth lingering after taste. Wish I bought more than 1.
Bottle from beersofeurope. Almost black. Smoked but like a cigar rather than smoked ham. Some liquorice, some malt, but not strongly flavoured besides the smoke.

Piwko z nie dużą goryczką. Dobrze wyczuwalna czekolada i lekkie nie dominujące jej nuty wędzone. Piwo jest zbalansowane w smaku przez co jest bardzo pijalne. Dosyć drogie, cena zależna od rocznika, ponieważ można je długo leżakować.
honestly dont remember much about this one, just that it was decent on the smoke.

Poured from a 2011 bottle into an Alaskan Brewery Pint glass. Aroma is chocolate ... and a very slight smokiness. Appearance is brown black like old motor oil. Had a three finger tan head that hung around for quite a bit. Taste is dark chocolate and smoke. The smoke is perfectly balanced with the chocolate. Palate is smooth with just the right carbonation. Overall an excellent beer that aged well. If you can get your hands on a bottle give it a try. Cheers!

Poured from a 2011 bomber into an Alaskan Brewery Pilot Series Pint glass like darkest of brown black.
Aroma is smoked malts. 
Flavor is like chocolate dipped bacon with touch of smoke. Finish makes me think of coca cola. Smooth beyond words. Love this brew. Had 06, 11, 12, 13 with the exception of 06 never disappointed.

Butelka - edycja 2012
Piwo ciemnobrązowe z delikatnymi rubinowymi przebłyskami, piana drobna, obfita, brązowa. Dym, owce, jabłko wyjęte z kompotu, nuta wędzona z odrobiną torfu, śliwka i lekka nuta wanilii. Lekki dym, czekolada, kawa, odrobina torfu, owoce, palony słód. Goryczka niska. Brakuje ciała, głębi, pazura. Zbytnio ugładzone. Aksamitne, sesyjne.

Draught at Oskar Blues. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with coffee, roasted malts, licorice, nuts, smoke, oak and chocolate. Bitter finish with nuts, roasted malts, chocolate and smoke. Excellent smoked porter.
Pretty decent. One can actually taste ghe smoke. I could only do one glass though.

2008 model @ DØE Århus South Smokebber tasting: 6 years old
Fine beer, I was hoping a little more smoke, because after 5 years should be in the foreground according to the brewery.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2016 The archetypical smoked porter, a staple of American craft beer culture and probably the best known beer from the state of Alaska, tasted fresh in 2012 but renowned for its ageing potential, so now revisiting from a four year old vintage bottle.  Very dense, coffee cream-like, fairly thick, yellowish beige head, forming a thick moussy rim around the glass and patches of tan foam in the middle, crowning a very dark chestnut brown beer, as good as black in general appearance, but with reddish brown edges.  Strong bouquet of smoked bacon, smoked herring even, charcoal, bitter chocolate, beef jerky, burnt toast and burnt wood, walnut, roasted pine nuts, cigar tobacco, cold black coffee, black peppercorns, old dried kitchen herbs, black olive, porcini, dried fig, leather, some very vague but perfectly natural iron, very old dried orange peel, vague soy sauce somewhere - and then, especially after warming up, a very elegant, old madera-like touch of oxidation adding subtlety and finesse.  Clean onset, some dried cranberries, fig and a sourish blackcurrant touch, very low in sweetness, followed by a well-positioned, black olive- and cured meat-like umami flavor which extends over a nutty malt core in the middle, providing some very subtle caramelly sweetishness buried under a strong toastedness, roasted bitter and vaguely coffeeish in the end, beautifully connected to the smoked factor which rises up retronasally, cigar tobacco-like, smoked birch wood even, eventually gaining that bacon-like smoked meat flavour you get in all classic Rauchbiers.  Mouthfeel meanwhile is rounded and slick, softly carbonated and a bit thin at first, but gaining body in the finish thanks to the layers of malt.  Ends with lingering roasted bitterness, noble and well integrated smokiness and a peppery, spicy, herbal hop bitter touch supporting the bittering malts, but a remnant of the caramelly sweet touch sticks to the back of the mouth as well; the tiny accent of oxidation is there too retronasally and adds beauty and subtlety.  This is not the most complex beer I tasted so far, not even the most complex porter, but it is a beautiful beer in its balance of toasted bitter and smoked malts with hop bitterness.  A classic in many ways, beautifully and intelligently structured and a delight to slowly savor.  Four years of cellaring have toned it down just a little bit, it seems a tad more mellow than I remember, but that could just as well be my palate having become more adjusted to smoked beers - generally speaking, I think this and other Rauchbiers, whether they are classic Bamberg lagers or modern and porter-based like this one, are so recommended for ageing simply because they do not change dramatically over time; the smoke keeps them from deteriorating even at a modest ABV, comparable to the way food was smoked in bygone eras just to be able to preserve it.  I would not mind tasting this at ten or fifteen years of age as well to see how it evolves further...

660ml bottle (2013). Pitch black color. Tiny to almost no head. Sweet, malty, raisins, faint smoke in aroma. Smoked, bit of milky, faint rubber and bit ashy taste. Long lasting roast in aftertaste. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Nice one!

Dark brown, clear, tan head. Biscuit, cocoa, fairly pronounced but pleasant smoke, Flavor: bready malt, biscuit, bakers chocolate, smokey and grainy malt, finishes fairly dry. Well made. Smokiness is pronounced in this year-old bottle, but its not over the top, and works well with underlying malt character.
Lekker, maar toch niet helemaal mijn ding. Beeje te muf, maar ja dat is de rook natuurlijk
Cola brown pour, small beige head. Aroma is smoked meat, barley, and chocolaty caramel. Taste is smooth salted caramel, tons of roast, and chocolate malts.

Bouteille (2012). Saveur Bière. Belle robe noire, mousse beige gourmande. Nez bien malté aux senteurs cendrées et fumées . Bouche complexe et crémeuse. Attaque douce puis puissante sur le malt torréfié et fumé soulignée par de petite notes de café. L'amertume très agréable lui confère une belle longueur en bouche . Finale sèche toujours imprégnée par ce délicat goût fumé. Une merveille de finesse et de gourmandise!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

W aromacie wyraźna wędzonka, nuty ciemnych słodów. W smaku dość wytrawne, wędzoność jest, ale subtelna, gorzka czekolada, kawa, paloność. Trochę jak stout, a nie porter. Trochę za mocno nagazowane. Fajne, choć mogłoby być fajniejsze.

650 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with two fingers of brown, good lasting head. Aroma is smoke, bonfire, ham, chocolate, grain coffee and plum. Nice roastiness with medium bitterness creates good finish. Low carbonation. Nice, velvety mouthfeel. Medium body. Low alcohol note with pleasant warming. Balanced, very good beer.

650ml bottle from The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Black color with a thin brown head. Aromas of smoke and wood. Taste pretty much the same with some roastiness added. Like a nicely roasted bacon strip. Semi-bitter aftertaste. Medium body with low carbonation.
0,65l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts and woodsmoke. Flavor is roasted malts, alcohol and woodsmoke. Very nice indeed. Not too heavy.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2015 2011 vintage, nearly 4 years old. Ive been drinking this beer a long time, but have never rated it. This vintage is one of the best in awhile, though. 
Creamy, generous graham cracker colored head over what appears to be opaque black body, but a bright light behind reveals is deep, clear chestnut brown. Head fades sky leaving some lacing. Aroma is smoke, smoke, and dried cherries, with an undercurrent of black malt. The smoke isnt sharp, though, but mellowed, like the inside of an old cabin. Taste is fire roasted apple and black malt, faint lemon zest, lightly spicy, with that undercurrent of smoke. Finish is slight tart and bitter. Body is thinner than I remember, but middle of the road for a non-imperial porter. Fine, subdued carbonation. Still one of my favorite porters, and the one all others are measured against, this vintage stands as my favorite year.

A year later and Ive opened the same vintage. Still quite smoky, a little cola/ rootbeer, and coffee.

2013 bottle - approximately 9 months since bottling. If your a fan of smoked beer, which I am, you must seek out this beer. The porter base harmonizes perfectly with the smoke to create meat like flavor that is unique and tasty.
Flasa - Miro. Cierna farba, kremova pena. Vona sladova, udena. V chuti jemna sladovost, prazene slady a najma udenina. Anglicka slanina a udena klobasa ako vysita.

This is a bottle from the 2011 bottling. I worried that I had let this one cellar too long, but I was gladly mistaken. It pours with a black color and a thin, fizzy, light brown head. The aroma lets you know that it is a solid porter at its base, as there is a dark, roasty, bready sweetness, and the smoke adds a wonderful complexity rather than masking everything else. The flavor is so wonderfully meaty, with the smoked malts being much more assertive, although the smoke still doesnt overpower the sweet and roasty characteristics of the porter. Medium bodied and having a light carbonation, the texture supports the flavors nicely. Overall, Im a fan of smoked beers and Im a fan of porters, and this blends the two well.

Dark licorice black. 
Nose is astringent chocolate peet ask chocolate milk. Sweet, chocolate cake with pie crust. Smoky peet malt and licorice.
2012 Bottle - Opened May 26, 2014. Smoky flavor, not overpowering or cloying. Aroma was understated, didn't add much to my enjoyment. A beer that should define its style. Very good.

2013 edition, shared by puboflyons. Pours dark brown, damn near black, with a thin beige ring of a head. Nose is campfire and barbequed meat. Flavor is semi sweet with the malt base being more pronounced. Hints of cocoa, caramel and vanilla. Still smoky and meaty enough. Hints of my late fathers pipe. Body could have been more robust, only medium. Overall, quite good.

22 oz. bottle thanks to puboflyons, thanks Jeff! 2013 vintage. Dark murky brown with thin ring of head in a sample glass. Nose is light smoked malts and hints of chocolate. 
Flavors of smoked malts, wood and some traces of roasted malt. Secondary hint of beef jerky and licorice. Mouth feel is kind of ashy, medium in body with a nice balance of smoke malt and sweet notes. Nice brew.

Bottle @ ild og røg ølsmagning. 2008 vintage. Very dark brown, small tan head that last, good lacing. Aroma, malty, roasted notes, smoke, dark fruits, chocolate, sherry. Taste, roasted malts, chocolate, dark fruits, caramel, coffee, smoke. A nice sweetness. Dry mouth feel. Slightly thin body.

Rauchige Bacon-Aromen mit Kaffee und röstigem Malz. Farblich Richtung Cola, sehr schön. Am Gaumen Kaffee, röstiges Malz, leichte Fruchtaromen. Schöner Einsatz von Kohlensäure, weiches Bier. Wunderbar.
Black with a brown head - Good smoked malt aroma - Good smoked malt body with some woody notes - Smoke goes into the finish - This was good

Bottle 65cl. 2012 version, tasted in May 2014. Black with almost no head. Strong smoked aroma with tar. Very full bodied taste. Can imagine that not everyone appreciate the strong taste, but this is just a beer after my taste. The smoked taste is not to mix with peat which often is used by whisky oak aged beers. Long finish.

Bottle 65cl. 2008 version, tasted May 2014! 6 years old. Aroma is much more subtle, softer and in balance. Not aggressive at all. Taste is round and Im sure that this can even develop much more in direction of getting softer. Very nice

Well done. The nuances in this make it work really well. Smoked malt and wood aromas. Dark brown in color with a light tan head. It appears rich. Medium weight with good carbonation. The beer has smoke essences but they dont overpower. Roasted malts blend with wood and coffee character. I felt like I should outside on the porch in the winter while drinking this. Really good.
A fine beer. Quite smoky with a good bitterness on top of hints of dates, chocolate and coffee. However, theres perhaps a tad more sour flavor here than I personally appreciate.

Cervesa fumada molt intensa i gustosa, cada glop és diferent.
Cerveza ahumada muy intensa y sabrosa, cada sorbo es diferente.

Aroma of peat smoke is rich and sweet. Creamy full bodied mouthfeel initially and leads to a watery middle and finish. Charcoal smokiness and roasted malt are the theme. Had off draft at yardhouse seattle. With 119 taps I question their quality. I need to buy a bottle of this to compare, because this is simply not great.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2015 Pours a dark drown from the bottle with thin bubbly tan head. Aroma was heavy on the smoke, but earthy vegetal notes behind it and a kiss of english yeast. Taste is more towards the smoke and wood, hints of earth and roast. A little heavy on the smoke, but not crazy overbearing, wonder how old this was.

Bottle 
smoke, woody, toast, roasty, cereal, herbs, earthy, coffee, vanilla, brown, hazy, frothy, brown foam, light sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, full body, oily feel, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter and long finish,

Perfect balance between porter-ish style and color and smokiness. Pours dark with medium tan head, disappearing rather quickly. Pungent aroma of roasted coffee and chocolate. Long aftertaste of smoke and chocolate. I fully recommend

Bottle, 2012 edition. Black colour, tan. Aroma: smoked, a bit like from a camp-fire rather than from smoked ham, quite strong, but not unpleasant; dark malt, a bit ash, some dark chocolate. Medium bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation. Complex, yet not too aggressive. Really enjoyable.

Bottle from Csak a Jó Sör. 2012 edition. Aroma smoky, chocolate, roasted. Clear dark brown colour. Taste is roasty, smoky, light chocolate. Overall rather bitter with very light roasted astringency (OK). Roasted finish, moderate duration. Very good one.

Look: Pours with huge, thick, mostly very fine bubbles (some big ones in the middle), head. Good, slow, sticky retention (big bubbles breakdown principle). Leaves a thin, creamy top layer and fair amount of lacing. Dark brown with strong amber hue, cant see through but seems relatively clear.


Smell: Smoked, first associations were of light pork meat but combined with salty notes it creates a raw smoked salmon smell - fantastic. Also some light fruity notes, watermelon and little sweet tomatoes. Porter backbone is present, but light - milk chocolate warmth. Its very clean.


Taste: Light sweet middle, some hints of chocolate, caramel, dates, coffee. Very light sour and mineral notes. All builds up and goes to very clear, clean medium bitterness, mostly ash smoke with a bit of roast. Very smooth, light porter milkiness with light hop presence at the end too. 


Mouthfeel: Medium, medium heavy body feel, silky, smooth - very good. Fills the mouth completely.


Overall: Its very clean, the salmon smoke character is very unique and outstanding, porter backbone is barely noticeable. A very interesting example of the style and good representation that the smoke can do some unique and superb shit.

Near black. Aroma of beef jerky. Taste is smokey dark malt. Not much else. I don't love smoke beers but this isn't bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thin tan head dissipated quickly, low lacing. Deep brown liquid. Moderate dose of smokey aroma but reminded me more of old camp dire ash more than smoke use in foods. Detected some bandaid smell, but may be the smoke and not necessarily phenolic. Smoke taste present throughout and slightly overpowers malt (or hops if any?). Moderate body, finishes very dry with lingering smoke. Interesting beer and ok balance, but I was expecting better based on the many good reviews and references. I wish the smoke character was more pleasant and not so ash-like

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

15.02.2014. 0,65l Bottle. RBNG-14. Black colour with tan head. Smoked aroma with dark malts, coffe and burnt roasted malts. Campfire! Real smoky flavours. Dark malts makes the body and there is a good bitterness. Nice beer.

Bottle, 2013 edition. Black with a medium sized tan head. Smokey nose. Flavour is also dominated by smoke with notes of charcoal, a bit meaty, roasted malt, chocolate, Medium body, oily/creamy texture, soft carbonation, medium sweet and bitter with some light acidity. Very soft and pleasant and not overdone so its also pretty drinkable.
I had a bottle from 2012. This is a beautiful beer, smokey yet not overly meaty which is good. Very smooth and wonderfully balanced mix of flavours going on.

Birra dallaroma pungente che caratterizza anche il sapore finale.Al palato,la struttura oleosa si aggiunge alla ricchezza del cioccolato,creando un contrasto con il sapore di frutti di bosco. Peccato però...è finita subito!!! :-P

Shared 2013 bomber. Thanks Ben! Very murky dark brown, minimal cap. Aroma is a good balance of coffee, smoke, chocolate. Taste is sweet and fairly bitter. Medium carbonation, dry finish. Chalky mouthfeel.
@ Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget (79:-). Rök, charkuterier, rostad malt, en del sötma, medelfyllig. En ganska rökig avslutning.

Sampled at the 2014 Untapped festival in Fort Worth. Pours a hazy near black with a brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has lots of smoke and roasted malts, with notes of bacon and dark grains. Flavor has a smoked dark grains and roasted malts with a hint of bacon.

Ive had my eye on this pint bottle in the fridge at the Scheveningen Brouwcafe for about a year now, but tonight its mine... all mine. So here I sit on my lonesome at the bar with just the one glass and this amazing delicacy awaits me. First off it poured a deep mahogany with a thin whispy tan head and no lace at all. The aroma is strong malt, dark chocolate, light smoke and liqourice. The flavour is strong bitter with a rich frothy creamy malt alcohol bitter, smoky "and the bandit" dark chocolate yeast, hop spice, bacon, egg, Thai green curry, Captain Birdseye fish fingers..... ok ok, I was clearly in dreamworld after the "hop spice" bit... but I think you get the message. It tasted pretty damn good! Coming back to reality, it was medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. So to summarise..... This is a beer Ive wanted for a while, but tonight, shes mine, all mine. Every man and his dog has rated this except me and this small bottle of absolute loveliness cost me a kings ransom, but as I sit here at the bar and look out of the window at the harbour full of pretty boats in front of me with a glass of this superb porter in my hand, I really dont give a flying fcuk. Its Friday night and a great weekend awaits me and Im celebratin in style. Life aint so bad when we have such great beer :-)

I had 2 years and 6 years old ones. Pours really dark. In aroma theres lots of smoke. Smokey taste with hints of coffee, barrel (oak) and even some fruits. Nice dry lasting attertaste. Older one was a little bit better - somehow smoother.

Pours a dark brown-black with minimal head. Aroma is primarily smoke. Flavor also dominated by smoke, with roasted grain, some coffee, bitter chocolate, even some leather. This would be a good beer to add some hot pepper flavor to.

The beers that came close in taste were at least 5% higher in alcohol.
Never had this much flavor out of 6,5% but this one was bottle aged for 2 years...it helps!

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, coffee, smoke
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium sourness, medium bitterness, light sweetness, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-perfect
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkelbrauens Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch rauchig, holzig, röstmalzig. Geschmack sehr röstmalzig, leicht rauchig holzig, Karamell, dunkel Früchte.
Aroma is pungent smoked malts and hickory/oak. The flavor is smoked malts, hickory/oak, hints of smoked meat, dark malts, fruit and a long and acidic/tangy/slightly dry finish.

Bottle from Systemboalget, 2012 version. Pours dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, smoked wood, vanilla and caramel. Taste is mid sweet malt, a very nice and well balanced smokiness, finish is rounded with a subtle bitterness and some woody notes. Smooth medium body with a soft carbonation.

From a shared 65cl bottle at RBNG-14. Pours very dark brown, close to black, with an off-white head. Fairly mild, but very nice smoky aroma with the wooden/bonfire notes. Sweet with a moderate bitterness. Smooth and well balanced, but slightly boring. (2014-02-15 - Grand Tasting, Fredriksten festning, Halden)
Year 2012. Bottle from Systembolaget. Smoky aroma with hints of chocolate and coffee. Dark with thin head. Malty taste with smoke, coffee and chocolate.

Flaske 0,65l fra Systembolaget Luleå, Storheden. Drukket i Skibotn 29 Des 13. Svart. Så vidt gjennomskinnelig. Høyt lysebrunt kremaktig skum som varer en god stund. God røykaroma med litt røstet malt. Myk munnfølelse. Smaken balanserer mellom røykøl og porter. Bra - men litt tam.

Dark brown body with a tan head. My kind of smoked aroma, i.e. gentle woodsmoke without too much meaty stuff. Also roasted malts and fruits in the back. Hints of smoked meat in the flavours, but the gentle woodsmoke is the dominating element. Light to moderate sweet with a moderate bitter finish. Smooth and pleasant texture. A very nice one.

[Sample @ RBNG14 Grand Tasting, Fredriksten festning, Halden ]

At RBNG 2014 Halden. Black color, good offwhite foam. Smoked and roasted aromad, also coffee and leather. Full body & high complexity . Good bitterness & balance. Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Il corpo robusto scuro e un sapore affumicato sono le caratteristiche i questa birra molto singolare. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85
From a bottle shared in Park City UT. Smoky nose. Flavors of licorice and coffee. Medium bodied. Smooth roasted finish.
Sample at a tasting. Brownred body with a low head. Smoky, with hints of barbecue and campfire.
Smoked bacon aroma from a deep mahogany ale. More smoke in the flavor and finish. Roasted malts and hops are muted and unrecognizable. Not bad but not my style.

Finally got to drink this classic! Opaque deep brownish color wiht a medium creamy beige head. Aroma is phenolic with strong smoke notes and some toast. Taste is wood smoke, with some slight burnt caramel notes. Medium palate. Filling and comforting for a winter evening.
660ml bottle from Good Spirits Co. Virtually black with a good head. Smokey barbecue aroma. Peaty flavour. Sweet aftertaste. A very good well balanced smoked beer.

650ml bottle, vintage 2012, from Systembolaget Storheden Luleå, provided by djoeye. Deep dark brown coloured body with a rustic tint. Huge, bubbly, tan-coloured head slowly reduced to a remaining layer, nice lacing rings down the glass. Mid-sweet malty aromas of smoke, earth and chocolate. Fine blended malty taste of smoke, dark vanilla, dark chocolate, and earth. Dry, roasted bitter ending. Smooth on the swallow. Medium bodied. A well crafted beer, however, I must admit that I had expected even more from this one. (Enjoyed at home for more than one hour on a Friday eve, Tromsø 24.01.2014).

2012 22oz bottle in a teku. Pours black with a lacy, tan head. Aroma strong of smoked and roasted malts, a little chocolate and coffee, a light dough character, and hints of bitterness. Flavor the same with a nice smoky maltiness. Smooth texture. A really cool beer.
Really dark brown, almost black. Minimal head. light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, soft carbonation, medium body, sticky. Overall I really enjoyed the taste. One of my favs so far.

66cl bouteille @ RBBWG III, thanks BeerLover_Ben. Anno 2012 bottle.
Cuivrée, col fin café au lait.
Arôme est agréablement malté avec de belles effluves fumées et un léger caramel.
Palais est ici centré sur un fumé qui bien que léger suffit à donner une belle complexité à la bière. Le tout est sec, sur des pointes de caramel.

2012 Vintage. 65 cl. bottle sampled @ RBBWG 2014. Courtesy of & thx! to Beerlover_Ben. Lighter dark brown, little head. Very thick meaty smoke in the nose, comes positively German across to me, rich malts, touch dark fruits, liquorish, rich dark malts, touch caramel. Taste is rich meaty smoke, liquorish, almost touch soy sauce, rich dark malts, soaked dark fruits, raw tobacco, thick coffee. Very substantial body. Very solid & very robust stuff.
Fra flaske (2012-utgaven) på Cardinaltreff aug-13: nesten svart med beige skum. Smoked indeed - tjæresmaken hadde holdt til en femmil!

(2008) first exp with smoked brews I had too harsh, and question was - why should I drink liquid meat? Then now I can say - some delicate and well balanced smoked brews actually I like. This one definitely is one of them.
Very rounded moderate maltiness, with notes of smoke, wood, vanilla, choco, licorice, some hops for balance. Sweet with bittersweet finish. Really liked this one.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2015 Bottle at RBWG14 
Pours next to black . Ok white foam 
Smell is smoked indeed
Taste is smoked , too smoked for me . 
No thanx 

Resampled again at BBF 15. WOuld agree with the explication given above, and even gave it the exact same score now as I did back than.
This beer is the best of the best. Pours like heaven smells like a campsite. Tastes reminiscent of good smoked meats mixed with an excellent Porter worth every penny.

Bottled. Dark cola color, thin beige head. Intense, tarry but soft smokiness, chocolate, loads of bready malts and some fresh fruity notes. Extremely smooth flavor has soft, slightly salty smokiness and deliciously bready maltiness. Dark chocolate and ashy roasted notes. Pleasantly dry finish with balancing bitterness. The level of roastedness/smokiness is perfectly matched with other malty flavors. Medium bodied, velvety texture. Really, really good beer!

2009 Vintage
Tasted on 1/6/13 from a capped 22oz bomber bottle purchased quite some time ago at Sun Devil. Pours opaque, nearly black dark brown with a very thick tan head that slowly recedes to messy, thick lace. The nose is more smoke than anything else, with plenty of dark chocolate and coffee malt to back everything up. The flavor is the same, with the smoke really dominant up front, with tons of roasted malt and a touch of added vanilla on the back of the palate. The body is medium with average carbonation and a long smoked, bitter roasted, and light touch of vanilla sweet finish. This beer is holding up very well, and having had it several times in the past, it is still an accurate reflection of what this beer is and can be.

2008 edition! Pours black with white head. Nice roasted aroma with spicy oak and a bit smoked. Tastes like standard porter, just with some notes of smoked meat, but so so little. Typical coffee and roasted aftertaste. Though to me it was not the fullest beer, bit watery, maybe because of the other beers that I had before. I waited for something more special with this one.

Pours pitch black and leaves the same colored body; with a two finger off-white foamy head that yields some sporadic lacing; the smell is smoky, roasty, with a little bit of tobacco and oak; the taste is basically the same with a bit of coffee coming through and a bit of that meatiness usually found in rauchbiers, roasty aftertaste, dry finish; its sits fairly well on the palate (wants to try to be somewhat heavy but actually isnt); overall, I like this and would have it again

Bomber from Drinkstore. Black pour, rocky tan head. Peaty roasted malt nose. Bitter notes in the flavour, some sweetness and a little smoke. Nicely balanced flavour. Decent body, decent amount of carbonation.
Dark ruby colour , small beige head. Aroma of chocolate, smoke, wood, forest fruits. Taste is light bitter. LIght to medium body, kinda thin texture, soft carbonation. Vintage 2011
Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Smells very smoky. Has an extremely smoky taste, primarily smoke, touch of bitterness, very good.
Dark brown, some beige foam. Medium carbonation. Complex smoked beer. Bitter with balanced smokiness. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and smoke.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2014 From the 2012 vintage bottle. It pours perfect with its deep dark brown to near black color and lingering tan head. As far as I am concerned the aroma is absolutely perfect too with its smoked cheddar cheese ester, dark malty character, and enriched earthy hop note. All Porters should look and smell this good. The body may have been its weakest link because it felt thin to medium. The taste was also a lot like the Grafton Village Cheese Company smoked cheese ends and a mild sweetness along with a low to moderate bitterness at the end. This was one remarkable beer. The only thing keeping me from giving it a 5 out of 5 was the body.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2014 Recension från baklogg. Flaska köpt från SB. Svart vätska med kraftigt mörkbrunt skum. Dofter av brända kaffebönor och tobak med en dominerande arom av rökta charkuterier. Syrlig smak med inslag av röda bär och sedan, återigen, total dominans av rökt prickigkorv. Eldig munkänsla och lång eftersmak.
Bottle from 2008 drank december 2013. Pours a black colour with a small head that disappears quickly Aroma of roasted malts, smoke, liqourice. Flavour is medium smoked, some sweetness. Enjoyable!

One of my favorite rauchbiers around. This one is very smokey, and has a solid roasted malt backbone to go with it. Its big, bold, you would think it would be higher in abv. Delicious stuff! Superbly balanced.

22 oz bottle (2013) from Evergreen Discount into my NBB globe glass. Pretty much black with a tan head that eventually dissipates and leaves minimal lacing. Smoky, spicy, malty aroma. Similar flavor with roasted malts, a touch of chocolate and earthy bitterness. Medium body.

One of the best smoked beers outside of Bamberg. Blood brown color, no head, aroma of campfire, chocolate, and walnuts. Taste is pretty much the same with a small hint of hops in the backend to balance out the malts. So smooth and delicious, excellent beer.

Draft in Las Vegas. Jet black pour with a lasting tan head. Some good lacing. Aroma was the fun part. It smelled like great times had while camping. Campfire, roasting greasy meats over the fire, homemade sausages, and roasted veggies. Nice porter base to the beer with heavy malts and mild coffee. Taste was not as bold or powerful as the aroma, but the smoke and smoked meats was certainly there. Kind of had a beef jerky taste (which I love.) Medium body, light carbonation. Finish is smoky and meaty.

2012 vintage, little over 1 year old. Pours black, small beige head, mostly lasting. Quite pronounced aroma. Rich Campfire, sausagey, smoked and sweet maltiness, just a bit of chocolate. Flavor follows, just not quite as rich. Medium body, soft and sorta creamy. Finish is a long pleasant lightly smoky roastiness with some chocolate. Superbly well-made beer.

2012 vintage. just over a year over. 
very smokey. smells like sausage, campfire. 
Taste is similar. Tastes like eating smoked sausage while smelling your sweatshirt the morning after a campfire. 
Nice, smooth finish.
Nice smokey aromas. Pitch black with tan head. Chocolate, Coffee, lactic sour note, with no burnt flavor. Dry finish.

bottle from Bierzwerg, vintage 2012. Deep black, large beige head. Smoky nose. Full-bodied, dark, very dark malts, coffee, espresso, dark chocolate, and a touch of smoke. Not as smoky as many Franconian smoked beers, but detectable.

Bottle from 2012. Dark brown liquid, beige medium head. Very nice smoke aroma. Sausage, bbq, meat, tar, caramel. Taste is a little bit more anonymous with some bitter coffee in the aftertaste. Body is kind of thin.

2012 edition. Dark smokey nose, The beer starts thick, nicely smoked and dry. Very dry. The mainpart is dry, slightly malty, very roasted and slightly smokey. Full-bodied. The aftertaste is long, slightly sourish, dry, and great roasted-smokey-malty!
--> Great beer! --> 13/12/14/13
Dark brown body with a tan head. Smokey aroma and taste. Woody and a hint of coffee and chocolate. The best smoked beer I had so far.

Smoked beer may be an acquired taste but once you get passed the first few sips it is a singular kind of tasty. Alaskan Smoked Porter is a great example of the style. Just enough smoke to support the chocolate and coffee notes without overpowering them. Rich and balanced flavor and beautiful to look at. Its the beer equivalent of a big old leather easy chair. A terrific beer.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown pour with a thin tan head, smokey aroma, smoke taste along with roasted malts a hint of leather, some sweetness and hop bitterness manages to come through the smoke. Excellent stuff.

2012 bottle. Dark brown shade with a hint of ruby. Nice lasting head and lace. Great smokey, woodsy aroma conjuring up twigs and log fires. Dark chocolatey taste with bitterness, smoke is less prevalent here but adds a nice undercurrent. This is definitely one of the best smoked beers Ive had.
Svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av malt, røyk. Smak av malt, røyk, kaffe og sjokolade. Cardinal.
Duft av røyk. Fin dyp mørk farge, tilnærmet sort. Lite skum, litt langs kant. Smak av røyk, sjokolade og frukt.

Donker kleurig bier. Weinig tot geen schuim. Zoet en zuur in balans met een sterk bittertje aan het einde. Smaak gerookte paling en laulierdrop. Gedronken met de aa zuipclub.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Uit de 0,66l fles op de AA-clubavond. zwart bier met fijn bruin schuim. In de geur gebrande mout en peat. Smaak is bitter met gebrande mout iets wat waterig. Niet heel bijzonder
Notes from backlog. Smoky, rich and lots of roasted malts. A very nice mouthfeel.

22oz bottle (2013). Pours jet black with a brown head. Smoke, burning wood, roasted malt, coffee. Nice balance between bitter and sweet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Amstein - 2012 - Black color, creamy tan head - aroma is woodsmoke, ashes, chocolate, roasted malt - flavor is roasted malt, woodsmoke disapear a little bit in the malt backbone, chocolate - medium body, creamy, low bitterness, medium carboantion, roasted light smoky finish - good but nothing impressive

Dark colour, good head. A nice aroma, lots of caramel. 
In the tast its mainly dark chocolate and coffee. The texture is oily as you might expect of an porter. The smoked malts really makes this class beer. You have to like this beer style, but if you do, youve got the jackpot.
smoked essence, not as robust as a German rauch, but smooth and mellow. Burnt =toast and campfire come through in the nose, coffee and chocolate in the taste. Nice.
65 cl bottle @ home (2012 vintage). Pours black with a tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are subtle smoke, roasted malt, coffee, and liquorice  with a slightly bitter finish.

Bottle from 2004. A dark brown beer, with an average beige head. In the nose there is smoke, light peat and chocolate. It is a medium bodied beer, with a low carbonation. In the taste there is meat, smoke, brown malts, whiskey malts. The aftertaste is light smokey, malty and light coffee. A nice smokey porter, better then the 2012 and 2011.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 2012 bottle pours black with creamy tan head. Big smoke and meat aroma with a hint of malts. Smoke, chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and a hint of meat flavors. Medium body and a smokey chocolate finish. 12,13
Bottle share at Darkness Day. Poured very dark brown with tan head. Aroma of light smoke. Slight bitter drying taste.
Pours black with tan head, aroma is roast with smoke, taste is similar with nice smoke finish, tasty!

1998, 2000, & 2009 vintages shared by Eric at his October 2013 tasting. Pours deep, rich murky brown body with thin lacing. Aroma is roasted bark, sweet-chocolate-covered almonds, smoke and spice. Mouthfeel is rich and smokey with notes of rich smoke, grain, lots of nuts, tree bark, espresso, and NO bandaid character - the best part of a good smoked beer.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Campfire aroma. Sweetnes, bitterness, lighter body than I had expected.

FROM NOTES: June 28, 12

A: Moderate smoke but not overpowering. Roasty malt and some cocoa. 
A: Pours dark brown with some orange around the edges and a creamy light tan head. 
T: Smoke up front, but not too much. Toasts malts and milk chocolate M - Medium coating with a mild tingle on sides of tongue and back of throat. O: Mild but deep flavor and a good feel.
Small sample at Olutexpo 2013, Helsinki. Colour is black with brown head. Aromas and flavours: Smoke and roasted malts.

1998 bottle shared by Eric. Poured brown/black with no head or lace. Aromas of thick cut bacon, chocolate, smoked almonds, roast, and grain. Body is creamy as hell with light carbonation. I usually hate smoked beers but this one was so fucking smooth and rich that I downed the glass in no time. Amazing shit.

(Bottle, 0.65 l, at OlutExpo 2013) The beer poured black. Its head was small and lightly brown. Aroma had smoke, roasted malts and liquorice. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were roasted malts, smoke, sweetness, liquorice, ash and bitterness. Aftertaste was roasty, smoky and bitter. A very nice smoky and roasty brew.
Svart med beige skum. Hovedsakelig røyk i lukten, litt kaffe kommer gjennom. Bbq smak, noe søtlig igjennom røyksmaken.

shared a 2012 bottle. poured black with a two-finger off white head. a lot of smoke, roast, wood/oak. with a small hint of coffee, and a dry finish. not a big fan of smoked beers, but this one is pretty tasty overall

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2014 Bottled, 2012 edition, large sample. Dark color, short lasting creamy brown head. Aroma of smoke, licorice, chocolate, roasted malts, some earthy hop, hint of leather. Elegant and complex. Quite bitter in taste, both from malts as well as hops. Smoke in flavor is much less than in aroma, but again it gives the subtle edge. Some biscuity sweetness balances the dryness from the smoke. Wonderfully complex and elegantly balanced. A true gem.
Bottle. Clear black pour. Very nice balance of classic porter taste and smoke. Smooth and nice body. Didnt find the smoke taste overwhelming.

Deep black, thin ring of head stays by glasses edges. Sweet smoky aroma invites, deep roasted coffee, licorice, medical herbs. Great pure smoky flavor, medium body, bit oily feel, dry roasted, long bitter finish, bit berries. Tasty, pure, nuanced, well done smokyness, enjoyed!

Appearance: near black, with one finger of rich, creamy tan head that leaves minimal lacing.  Aroma: 	lots of smoke, with some bittersweet chocolate, talc, chalk, and char.  Taste: 	very smoky, with ash, charred wood, bitter chocolate, and a hint of resinous pine.  Finish: lingering ash tray, with some mild bitterness from the chocolate. Notes: Bottle from 2012, was really excited to try this based on the reputation. However, was super disappointed. The smoke notes were very ashy and not in balance against what seemed like a pretty watery porter base. Frankly, doesnt hold a candle to either the Stone Smoked or the Great Divide Smoked Baltic.
My biggest Alaskan want while on vacation in Alaska. Very nice to the style with a nice smokiness. I would like to do a back to back with Stones Smoked Porter. Would definitely want again.

Bottle to tulip
Chocolate, chipotle, molasses and malt. Deep brown, almost black, with a thin creamy head. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, red pepper, chipotle, and toasted malt.
Bottle - Vintage 2011 - Smoke and some dark fruit. Jet black with a rich brown head. Tons of smoke, little bitterness and finishes with more smoke, molasses and some dark fruit.

Bottle from ølbutikken.
pitch dark, smooth brown head.
Clear smoked aroma, sausages and ham, roasted malts, also general smoked notes.
Flavor is pretty smoked too, mostly charchoal like smoked notes, also roasted malts, appears a little bit watery, flavor profile is a little out of balance i think with lots of smoke, but not so much porter to back it up.

Bottle 0,65l Bottled. 17.09. 2012
Color - Black, against the light ruby. Nice, creamy foam, pretty lacing glass.
Aroma: Basically smoky-bacon, a bit chocolate, just perfect. 
Taste: In the foreground smoky, bacon, then dark chocolate, then chocolate mixed witch smoky malts. Great balanced. Long tasty finish, a bit dry with dominating chocolate. Full body, smooth and velvety texture, a bit to high carbonation.
Wonderfull beer, to slowly drinking but very drinkable. It was young but very very good. Older ones can by perfect!
UPDATED: JAN 29, 2014 Tap at Library Alehouse, super nice smoked porter, dark roasty big fan of this one

Black, brown edges, nicotine coloured head. Aroma of smoke, chocolate, coffee, islay whiskey? Once you taste it, the smoke is more subdued and quite dry, clean and medium bitter with a lingering finish. Medium to low carbonation, smooth mouthfeel. Quote excellent.

2007 smoked porter
Serving type: bottle


Appearance- Black with a nice thick dark tan head and good tan lacing

Aroma- Dark smoky coffee aroma with a slight sweetness.

T/P - Much like it smells Smokey flavor with a sweet chocolate coffee flavor. Mouth feel is very nice and smooth..

Overall- Alaskan brewery never disappoints and they do not with this one either. This is a very good Porter and would be enjoyed even by those who do not typically like dark beers. I wish I could drink it more often, but it is a limited release and only comes in the larger Pint bottles. This is not bad in itself it just means it coasts more, but it is well worth it.

Aroma: rosted malts, smoked notes.
Appearance: totally black, tiny beige head.
Taste: roasted dark malt, chocolate, smoked notes, well balanced, low bitterness.
Palate: full body and high carbonation (maybe to high).
Overall: Very good smoked porter, well blanced, drinkable, nice smoked aftertaste. Highly recommended.

Bottled from Just Beer Association. Well, this is strong! Aroma is with strong roasted malt, smoked bacon. Luckily, taste is more balanced between smoked malts and coffee. So it avoid the nauseated smoky taste, and stays and interesting beer.

2012 versie, zwart/bruin met bruine kraag
aroma: koffie, geroosterde-, gebrande mouten, chocolade, gerookte mouten, hout
smaken: rokerig, koffie, chocolade redelijk bitter, matig zoet
afdronk: bittertje, sterke koffie, lage co2, zacht creme/romig mondgevoel, zeer goed bier.

Bottle 50 cl. Black with a large foamy lightbrown head. Aroma of burned malt, chocolate and some dark fruit sence. Medium bitter with a light sweetness, nice long burnt end. Liked, almost Aecht Schlenkerla.....

22 oz a year old bottle. Pours dark brown with creamy, beige head and lively carbonation. Aroma is of lox, coffee, dark fruit and vanilla. Body is full and crisp. Taste is of smoked malt, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, dark fruit and herbal hops. Finish is long, bitter-sweet. This brew made a trip to Alaska worthwhile. The brew was even better fresh on tap at the brewery.

Very dark brown, fizzy body, big brown head. Aroma: roasted malts, coffee, some bitterness. Taste: at first malts then roasted bitterness some fruity, alcoholic tinge and despite of the smoked feeling, there is a syrup-like felling in the palate.

2008 ed. pours a deep, clear brown with a dark tanned head. Aroma of tar, smoke, roasted malts and dried meat. Taste is moderate smokey with a well balanced roastyness. A bit sweet at first, but has a decent bitterness in the aftertaste. Medium bodied and rather softly cabonated

On draught at Fire and Brimstone Festival at Saraveza. Almost black, brown color. Aroma of milk chocolate, dark malts, and subtle campfire smoke. Taste has a more prominent smoked quality, but the sweet chocolate and roasted malt notes still shine through. Finishes with a chocolate and smoke aftertaste.
Bottle. Color dark brown with medium head. Aroma malt, roasted, smoke, vanilla. Taste malt, wood, light smoke, alcohol.
Sample at DØE 2013. Black with a tan head. Aroma and flavour of smoke, oak, tobacco, vanilla and chocolate.
Almost black in colour, offwhite head. Smokedness in taste. Perhaps missing the complexity of the best of Bamberg.
Bottle. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is smoked, coffee, roasted malt. Flavour is smoked, roasted malt, chocolate. Full body. Very nice beer.

Versión envejecida del 2008, con lo que los matices son distintos. En el aroma se nota un ahumado muy intenso que opaca a los olores de las maltas. Al beberla, se nota que el lúpulo se ha disipado casi totalmente debido al envejecimiento, mientras las maltas ahumadas se notan muchísimo. El amargor es moderado y de vez en cuando, dependiendo de con qué lo marides, puede salir un sabor dulce. El sabor no es el más complejo del mundo, pero es muy interesante. Cuando el sabor evoluciona, el ahumado se disipa, quedándonos más con las maltas.

Bottle. Black colour with an off-white head with good duration. Aroma is strong smoky with wooden notes and tobacco. Flavos is dominated by toasted malts, soy sauce and slightly smoked fishes. The final is slightly bittery with toasted malts notes, moderate smoky and light ashes hints.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle.
Poured a beautiful oily black with a thick brown head. Smokey aroma with dark malt and cocoa. Burnt flavours with dark, bitter chocolate and dried fruit. Palate of lingering cured meat smokiness, grains and dark roast coffee.

Crashing into the glass deep brown beer, leaving a dense and thick foam on top. 
Smoke enters the nose first. Not exactly the same kind of liquid smoked like in Heller-Trumin products. Roasted, slightly burnt maltiness. Background has a gentle bite of tar. I expected much more intensive experience. 
Flavor has smoky maltiness, tar and toast. Roasty is on the edge whether its burned or not. In the background there is delicately sweet taste caramel and fruitiness. The aftertaste is long. 
Mouthfeel of this beer is the weakest part of the area. Medium-bodied and drinkable beer, but too watery on the body. 
Alaskan Smoked Porter is in the end quite a decent smoked beer with a really small faults, potential. A classic that can recommend the tasting smoked beer lovers. (Via G-Translate for lazy people).

2012 Bottle: Pours black with a medium light brown head that is mostly lasting. Roasty aroma has hint of cocoa, coffee beans, dark chocolate, and a light char presence. Rich earthy flavor is malty with hints of dark chocolate, pine, and vanilla with a creamy smoky finish. The smoked style doesnt get much better than this. Delicious!

2012 edition.
Black as a sin. Beatiful brown head that leaves a lot of lacing. 
Nose: Roasted malt, vanilla, coffee, dried fruit, tobacco, dark chocolate, ash, dark bread and smoked meat. 
Taste: Smoked meat, roasted malt, leather, dark chocolate, coffee, pine and licorice. 
Medium body with little carbonation. 
A great, complex brew. I just love it!
Beautiful black porter with reddish notes and a nice chocolate colored crown. Strong aroma of smoked charcuteries. Taste of tar and smoked cheese. Quite a mouthful!

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, 2011 vintage. Pours pitch black color with a 1-2 finger dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of big dark chocolate, roasted malt, cocoa, light coffee, light char, smoke, toast, and roasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of roasted/dark/smoked malt notes with good strength. Taste of dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, toast, light coffee, dark bread, light char, smoke, and roasted earthiness. Lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, light coffee, dark bread, toast, smoke, light char, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity and balance of dark/roast/smoked malt flavors; with zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a creamy and fairly slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is a fantastic smoked porter. All around awesome balance, complexity, and robustness of roasted, dark, and smoked malt flavors; and extremely smooth to sip on. A highly enjoyable offering.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2014 Mooie donkere kleur met een volle donkere schuimkraag. Ruikt, koffie, geroosterd, toast en iets rokerig. Smaakt iets waterig. Verder tonen, koffie, toast. Prima, maar iets dun van smaak.
A dark brown beer with a small beige head. Aroma is roasted malt and smoked, notes of caramel. Taste is sweet and malty. Smooth with some good bitterness to balance sweetness.

Bottle, Beer Ritz, Leeds. Black pour with a dissipating light brown head. Very roasty nose with notes of smoke and chocolate. Sweetish flavour that displayed all the qualities of the nose. Smooth , clean and easy drinking with plenty of character. Im not the worlds biggest lover of smoked beers, but this is certainly one of the more enjoyable examples Ive tried.

Had this the day before falling ill - I may well have been on the way down when drinking this, as I failed to detect the greatness that many others have; maybe doing it a disservice by simply calling it a slightly smokier than average smooth porter; will have to rate again one day.
Dark reddish body with a tall beige head.aroma is smoked,berries.taste is smokey,salty.bitter finish
Not a huge fan, aroma is prevalent and very smokey but not amazing. Taste is overly smokey and kind of watery.

Bottle. Creamy off-white good mostly lasing head. Dark amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Nice smoked notes. Average heavy bitter flavor. hops and smoke in nice balance. Long moderate bitter finish. creamy palate. A very nice smoked.
Black color with okay head. Smoked and hobby burnt flavor and aroma. Very nice.
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 Shared a bottle of the 2012 edition. Truly amazing. Really strong, roasty and smokey.

22 oz. bottle. Pours almost black, with a creamy light brown head. Smoked Porters are one of my favorite styles, and this one does not disappoint. Smokey aroma and palate, with tones of coffee and leather. Finish is a little thin, but a nice smokey aftertaste lingers. Wishing a had a plate of ribs to go along with it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Parallel tasting, 2008 and 2012 versions. Black body light brown head. Aroma has lots of tar and smoke, older version has more, the 2012 one has just bit of smoked sweet malt. 2008 has flavour of tar, slick roasted ashy malt and some flat malty bitternes. 2012 has quite fresh hops flavour with some smoked malt, the medicinal and spicy hops are quite nice in this one. 2008 is really thick and dark and heavy while 2012 is refreshing and highly carbonated. Both versions are in really great balance despite being really different. Mixed aftertaste, there is no separation in this one of course, is really complex treat of different levels of tar and smokeness, sweetnees and bitterness. Last tastings are when I combined the two together: Tar disappears from aroma, just smoked malt. Perhaps warms too much when something flat maltiness comes up.

2 x 650 ml bottles. Parallel tasting with 2008 and 2012 vintages. A15. 2012 bottled on 09/17/12. From bierzwerg.de.
Aroma of the 2008 is very much tar, smoke and rather strong sweet vanilla and 2012 version has smoked ham, smoke, roasted malt and some hoppy freshness compared to the older one. The flavour is smoke, vanilla sweetness, very strong liquorice, salt and roasted malt. And that was the 2008. 2012 on the other hand is bitter hops, roasted malt, mild vinegar, liquorice and mild sourness. 2012 is quite fizzy. 2008 is smooth. Absolutely great and complex brew. The two vintages are so different that you could easily say theyre different brews. Brilliant!

Decent aroma of smoke. The taste is good with a bit of sweetness that makes this beer really good. However, the aftertaste is a little too thin. Would like to have more power there. But I think it was okay to drink. I was prepared for the worst when I saw that this was a smoke beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

2012 bottle.
Appearance: Black/dark brown with a two finger thick tan head.
Aroma: Smoky a little like smoked bacon initially but mellows into a gentler wood smoked aroma. Pine, pepper, slight toffee, bread and chocolate.
Taste: Low sweetness, medium bitterness, low/medium sourness, smoky, toffee and chocolate.
Palate: Smooth light texture and body, slightly prickly carbonation, with an astringent, peppery and smoky finish.
Comments: Gorgeous, very easy to drink. left a glass lace.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2015 Bottiglia 2012. Nera, oleosa ed impenetrabile con un lieve accenno di schiuma marroncina. Un tripudio di cioccolato amaro, cenere, caffè, malti tostati e zucchero a velo che avvolge narici e palato in un abbraccio cremoso e molto intenso. Nel finale emergono note di liquirizia, setosa nella struttura, di corpo medio e quasi priva di effervescenza. Lho solo assaggiata ma mi ha colpito in positivo, da riprovare alla prima occasione.
Black with tan head. Smoky fire, notes of smoked meat, sweet licorice, malt, leather, some kind of dark fruit. A bit of warmth.

2011 vintage from Rakuten, pricey but very nice. Bottle split with Brian. Fantastic smokey aroma, dark thick syrupy looking pour with a thick reddish-orange brown head that dissipated fast. Nice mellow burnt coffee, some chocolate & smoke which while evident in the aroma kind of pops in & out in the flavor. It ends on a pleasant bitter aftertaste. A really well made smoked beer & you have to love them for creating the Smoked Porter style. Good stuff.
Bottle 65 cl 2012 vintage @ Kultainen Apina. Black with a small beige head. Sweet malty, roast aroma. Smoky malty flavour.
Flaske fra systembolaget. Svart farge, beige skumtopp.kaffe, lakris,, roast, røyk . En fornøyelig øl

Bottle (vintage 2012): Literally as black as ink with ruby spots, big but loose brownish head, moderate to solid leathery and toasty to smoky nose, supported by a distinctive fruitiness in the background; moderate to solid dryish bitter-sweet flavour, smooth and medium-bodied; robust leathery and more toasty than smoky finish, followed by an ashy aftertaste. Simply delicious...

Aroma of malt and barbecue. Pours very dark with a thick creamy dark tan head. Medium bodied. Lightly smokey, like the smoke from a barbecue pit. Roasty and malty. Slight thin bitterness on the finish. This beer was hyped all to hell and Im just not seeing it. I mean, its an okay beer but 99? For real?

Flaske: Årgang 2012. Sortbrun klar øl med et lækkert cremet skumhoved. Duften er let røget der går over i smagen der er elegant og velafbalanceret imellem røgen og den sødlige porter. Virkelig en lækker øl.

This is an amazing beer! I have had numerous batches and am never disappointed. It has a deep, smoky flavor, with nice malt characteristics and a hop finish. Best smoked beer out there. I was lucky enough to be invited to a party the brewery hosted at the GABF and got to enjoy this fine beer with smoked salmon that they flew in. Great party.
Aroma of slight smoked malts. Black brown with off white head. Smoky taste with bitter chocolate malt some bitter bakers chocolate.

Bottle. Black with tan head. Smells like a bonfire, some molasses. Tastes like a bonfire as well, tiny little chocolate and molasses with dark fruit but mostly a smoke party. A little thin and bone dry. I was hoping for better. Just another smoked beer....
Mooi donker biertje dat erg naar rook ruikt. Sterke smaak met een echte rooksmaak. mmmmm
Bottle at Bierfass. Thick dark body and a brown creamy body. Aroma of smoke, tar, chocolate and coffee. The taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter. Low in alcohol but still tastefull.

2012 vintage, shared at home. Pours jet black with tight tan head, lasts well, a touch more carbonated that I expected. Smells of smoked salmon! Maybe wood. Tastes is all dark, burnt malts and caramel sugars. Full bodied, rich. Deeply satisfying in some kind of primal way.

This review is a side-by-side tasting of a 2007 (Thanks Keir!) & 2012 bottles. 
Aromatics: The 2007 is missing a lot of the smoke characteristics that the 2012 has more prominently. It replaces the smoke with chocolate, subtle figs/ raisins, and a slight alcohol note. The 2007 edges the 2012 out greatly.
Appearance: Color for both is deep dark and oily looking. 2012 pours with much higher carbonation and head retention. 
Taste: 2007 is much more complex and adds a nice difference to the brew with raisins and figs. But I still do enjoy the smokyness of the 2012.
Palate: 2012 is heavy on bubbles and has a fizzy mouthfeel. The 2007 maintains a just below normal carbonation level. Mouthfeel is much mroe smooth.
Overall: These were both great beers. It definitely got better with age.

Ar: big roasty smokiness, ash, tar, Wood, Smoked meat, some dried fruit, chocolate, coffee and vanilla. 
Ap: black colour, medium beige head, lacing. 
F: smoke, ash, tar, coffee, roastiness, light fruitiness, rather soft bite and actually no say near as full bodied as expected. 
P: medium bodied, but considering the flavours the body needs to carry the experience is a bit thin and watery. 
T: quality brew, but considering the reputation I was a little bit disappointed.

Bottle from Systembolaget enjoyed at home
Pours quite dark, black in glass, tanned head. Smells of smoked malts, tar, roast, coffee. Taste is moderate sweet, roast and smoke, peat. Quite watery texture. Moderate bitter. Quite drinkable; nice roast and smoke. A very nice smoked
Bottle from Systembolaget. Smoky and sweet smell with chocolate. similar taste. Just enough smoke and nice to sip at.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a creamy beige head. Aroma of smoked grains, wood, roasted barley, some fruitiness and caramel. Flavor is sweet and roasted with some beechwood smoke and coffee. Medium body, soft carbonation.
2011 drank early 2013. Wintergreen smoke malt. Tastes is meat meat and smoke. Its sweet but with balanced bitter finished.  Feel is super soft carbonation, velvet, silt.  So very nice.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 30.05.2013, 0,65l bottle (2007) @ home:
Big creamy longlasting cocoa colored head. Aroma is very rich, salty licorice, liquid smoke, coffee, cocoa, salty caramel, dark malts, dark berries. Taste is very mild, almost a little watery, dark malts, burnt caramel, cocoa, grass, raw licorice, a hint of smoke. Aroma is just awsome, taste has probably started to fade a lot for a while beeing only 6,5%. I think Ill have to taste this one a little younger as well. Still, this is an awsome beer!

29.10.2013, 0,65l bottle (2012) @ home:
Aroma is not very far off from the 2007 bottle. Tast is actually very boring and a little watery, so at least some aging is definately a good thing. Still, it should have had a thick(er) body, and maybe even a little higher ABV.

Pours pitch black with small tanned head. A lot of smoke in the aroma with notes of burned wood and roasted malt. The smokiness continues in the taste together with roasted notes, vanilla and some dark chocolate. Very enjoyable and easy to drink.

Big bottle from Bierkoning, Amsterdam, kindly provided by my mother-in-law and sharee at a local tasting. Pours black with a light brown film. Mellow smokey roasted nose. Mouth adds acidic and bitter flavors skillfully balanced and the smoke is well integrated and unintrusive. Medium to full bodied. Leaves the tongue dry.

Bottled 650ml. -Thanks a lot my darling Ines for bringing this from Amsterdam. Black coloured, medium sized pale brown head, smoke and mild bacon in the nose. Roasted malt, smoke, wood and bacon with hint of chocolate in rather bitter finish. Nice one...but expected more...

This bottle was brought to me by sister-in-law for providing her co-worker with a bit of free legal advice.  After my first experience with a smoked beer was pretty awful, I tried this brew with great trepidation.  Imagine my delight at the complex flavors presented by this beer.   The smell of smoke and malts blends well and reminds me of camping trips with my dad and grandfather.  Pours nearly black with a solid tan head.  Flavor is smoked with just little bit of bitterness and malt.  Like this beer and will try again.  Bottle - Gift from Sister-In-Law

Botella. Black colour. Big brown head, good lacing. Smoky roasty pleasant aroma indeed. Good filling mouthfeel. Flavour of roasted malt and smoke along with chocolate and mild coffee. Væl smakkandi tjúkmyrk bjór.

2012 Bottle at home from drinkstore
Dark brown with fluffy tan head. Smoky, chipotle slightly bacon. Quite wood smoky, very fruity finish, low carbonation, sweet full bodied, toasty barley. Fab
Coffee colored. Stiff head, slowly disappearing. Smoky fragrance, smoky flavor, some sugar, coffee, dark chocolate and bitter herbs. A decent porter but nothing special.

Its quite dark in here so I dont which color this beer has. It looks great. I like the smell. Smokey and some fruity tones. The taste is great too. Burnt and roasty. The palate fits in great with this one.

Bottle from bierzwerg.de. Almost black colored beer with medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, smoke. Taste, initially roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, than smoked ham, sausages arrives. Smokey finish. Enjoyable beer.

65cl Bottle @ home, bottled in 2012. Ive just poured this clear, dark brown liquid, with ruby reflexes in the light and a thick creamy mocha-coloured head. Light smokey aroma, espresso coffee, ash, some dark honey sweetness coming through as it warms up. Super silky in the mouth, full, smokey taste, not much of the sweetness in the aroma left, but still strikingly balanced, not as aggressive as many german rauchbiers are. Leaves a light but lasting coffee impression in the mouth. Very nice, Id really like to try it along with some food to pair with.

650 ml bottle, 2012 vintage, kindly shared by abemorsten. Black colour, moderate tan head. Lovely and balanced aroma between the smoked and roast malts. Roasty and smokey flavour too, but here the notes of "smoked sausage" come through a bit too strong for my taste.

Vintage 2004 shared by AZ crew.  Glad they aged this as its still hugely smokey and id imagine any harsher would be borderline unpleasant tasting.  pours jet black with one finger head.  nose of delicious frying pan of bacon.  Tastes of super amounts of smoky bacon, some peat straight from islay, maple syrup, chocolate, and woody.  Kinda beats you over the head in flavor but thats what I need now and again

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2013 Bottle, 2009 vintage. Pours a near-black deep dark brown body with a large caramel-hued creamy head which fades quickly. Nose is smoke, tar, leather, tobacco, deep malty tones and hints of dark chocolate and licorice in a very delicate harmony. Incredibly pleasant. Taste is mellow dark malts up front, then leather which turns into tar and smoke, dark chocolate, licorice and burnt toast in the finish. Sweet, smokey aftertaste with beautifully contrasting burnt sugar and caramel tones. Full body, rich and creamy, with a medium carbonation serving just perfect to propel the flavors and aroma. This is like a symphony in my mouth, and one of the few American top beers that have actually surpassed my expectations lately. A great beer, worthy of its high rating.
2004 Vintage.  Pours dark brown/black in color with strong smokey aroma.  Tastes much of the same with hints of roasted malt.  Smoke was a little to overpowering for me.
Bottle 65 cl. Really interesting smoked ham scent. Tast is also pretty much smoked ham.

Bottle at The Anderson, Fortrose. It pours near black with a medium beige head. The nose is roasty, liquorice, smoke, bacon frazzles, Dandelion & Burdock and treacle. The taste is roasted malt, liquorice, smoke, meatiness, bacon frazzles, moderate bitterness, earth and touch of blackcurrant jam with a very dry finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and slightly sticky mouth-feel. Decent, but doesnt quite meet expectations.
Aroma of smoked cherry wood. Not that complex but a nice flavour. Good carbonation. Soft and silky. Taste is quite smoky. In the background I find some chocolate. Not that complex.

Bottle: Just the 2012 version:
Medium sized creamy, tan, vast, thick and slowly changing or disappearing foamy head.
Brownish black colored beer.
Aromas of coffee, smoke, roast, meat, light chocolate, some liquorice wood, creamy deep roast.
Flavours of bitters, roast, smoke, coal, light tar, malts, smoked burned branches and wood, light creamy spiced.
Aftertaste of malts, roast, smoke, bitters and light tar ish tones
Low carbo, soft silky mouthfeel, medium to fuller body and a creamy texture.
A crisp smokey beer. Very nice!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Tiefschwarz mit reichlich hellbraunem Schaum, ein Gedicht. In der Nase eine Mischung aus Torffeuer und Schinkenräucherei, ich liebe es! Mittelschwerer Antrunk. Im Geschmack halbtrocken, röstmalzig, rauchig. Nicht so komplex wie das Aroma verspricht, aber dafür sehr süffig. Mehr Stout als Porter, nichtsdestotrotz lecker!

Bottle, 2012. Pours black with a red glow and a medium tanned head. Aroma is mostly a nice smokiness, some chocolate, metal and a bit of bacon. Taste is a quite subtle smokiness, some sweetness and a light bitter finish. Body is a bit thin.

Bottle 650ml, a dark beer with good off white head and lacing. Nose is peated like with dark malt notes. Aroma is quite heavy on smoked notes with ashes and a deep dark malt and coffee body, finish has peated notes such as for isle of islay whisky. Good, would be grate with several years vintage.

A really excellent smoked porter. This was the 2012 release. I had wanted to age this, but kept looking at the bottle and in a burst of anticipation when the feeling was right, ripped off the cap. Pours a beautiful black with a tan head that dissipates quite quickly. In the nose is like a recently burned forest that is doused with light rain. In the mouth is balanced, delicately smoked and lightly carbonated with a residual dry smoky aftertaste. A lovely beer. Would always like to have one ageing in the cupboard.
Pours dark brown, almost black with brown-ish head. Aroma of smoked fish, roasted malt, licorice and fireplace. Flavour of smoked fish, medicine, and roasted malt. Very interesing.

Bottled. Pours dark brown in color with a tan head. Notes of smoke and wood in aroma, perhaps even some notes of dark chocolate are there. Light saltyness, dark chocolate with some notes of smoke in taste. 
Quite smooth and not that aggressive. Smoked schwarzbier for me.

A colabrown beer with a medium and beige head. Aroma is balanced, roastiness, liquirice, dry and aromatic smoke, smoky ham, hint of coffee. Taste of smoke, roastiness, some liquirice, coffee, the aftertaste is dry and roasted. Medium bodied, low carbonation, nice to drink. The succesful beer, the smoke isnt dominate, its only nicely balanced with others nuancees, great beer.

Shared 650ml bottle at Porterhouse Cork. Pours a burnt black with a thin beige head. Smoked oak, bacon, toast and pine on the nose. Taste is medium sweetness, light bitterness, salt. Very smoky, more coffee and dark chocolate than expected, naturally a lot of smoked oak and bacon. Smoky and sweet aftertaste, reasonably dry, quite full-bodied. This is really great, especially because it retains its porter qualities through the smokiness. Expensive but worth it.
Scura riflessi mogano buona schiuma piuttostovpersistente affumicata legno lievi toststure smaro mefio discreta secchezza buon corpo

Appearance: Black color with a frothy nice beige head. Some lacing.Aroma: Chocolate, roasted malt and some smoke.Palate: Medium to full body. Slightly sweet, and a mild bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Coffee, chocolate, roasted malt and some smoke.Overall impression: Lovely beer together with smoked salomon. Balanced and not to heavy smoke flavor.Personal stats: Bottle from a trade with Nisse666US state #21

Bottle shared at a tasting at DSGs place. Thanks Eyal for this one. Pours black to brown with a nice beige head, aroma of cigar, sausage, chocolate, smoked fish, flavor is dry and malty with coffee, smoked fish, chocolate and light acidity, medium to full bodied, great

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2016 almost black colour, massive brown head; aroma of chocolate, herbal liqueur like notes, roasted malt and smoked cheese; taste of coffee, dark chocolate notes, burnt toasted rye bread, smoked notes, and minimal sweetness.

**2011 Smoked Porter** 22 fl oz / 650mL bottle into a pint glass. Served cold.

Aroma: Campfire ashes and smoked meat. Maybe a little black coffee. Definitely some strong malt.

Appearance: A very handsome opaque dark ruby with a thick, creamy, lingering beige head.

Taste: This beer tastes like smoked meat. Smoked sausage and jerky. So, so good. Theres some dark chocolate flavor, but the big, up front flavor is all smoky meats. And it is delicious.

Palate: Rich, full body. Coats the palate, lingers and warms.

Overall: Exceptionally good porter. I havent had a beer that tasted so much like meat before. Granted, the Voodoo Doughnut / Rogue Bacon Maple Ale was really bacon-y, but this stuff is hardcore, smoked meat. I felt like I was eating jerky in a smokehouse. This stuff is fantastic.
Bottled. Pours pitched black with a biig brown head. Smells roasted malt, alot of smoked meat. Tastes roasted malt, abit coffee, smoked meat, tar with a similar finish.

Bottle, march 2nd 2013. Very dark brown body, small tanned head. Aroma of smoked bacon, roasted malt, burned wood. Taste has a more subtle smoke presence, letting coffee and earthy hops join in, with hints of licorice. Good massive body and a complex bitter aftertaste with wood and dark malt. A great beer!

Bottle sample at a tasting at DSGs place. Thanks zvikar. 2012 bottle. Pours very black with light brown head. Very smokey aroma, fire-pit-like.Tastes mildly bitter, smokey, like eating a bonfire-cooked potato peel. Medium body, round, slightly sweet finish, mild carbonation. Dry and then smokey aftertaste. Pretty amazing.

Bottle shared during a brewing adventure while troubleshooting technical difficulties. Big smoky aroma, beef jerky (or salmon jerky if I stay on theme), brown sugar. Dark brown pour, khaki head with some irregular lacing. Sweet, smoky, tasty. Slick texture, medium body, average carbonation. Nice for my first time. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Malt, brød, tøv, let røg , stald, grapefrugt , træ , fad , alkohol , sortbrun, brunt skum , syrlig, sød, lette bobler, vinøs. Dejlig

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smak och doft av choklad, kaffe, slipers, rök. Porterkaraktär med stor och kärv tallbeska.

At a tasting, 2012 bottle, smallish head, opaque black colour, aroma of smoke, pastrami and wood, flavour of smoke, charred wood and roasted coffee, very dry , medium bodied, feels quite light bit balanced and sublime. Enjoyable and fun to sip.

Currently drinking while typing. A very nice beer this is indeed, obviously a very steep price for us English people but nonetheless I try not to let it bother me. Nice rich aroma of sweet boozy smokiness with burnt malt smoke and toast, roast and slight hop note. Its a beautiful beer to look at with its soft fluffy beige head that sits on top of a black/dark brown vessel. Tastes of a well balanced malt blend with a beautiful smoked flavour from the Alder smoked malts with a non intrusive hop profile with a clean bitterness, hidden alcohol and drawn out roasty smoked malts. Smooth velvet textures on the tongue with full body and soft but pleasant carbonation. This beer is a treat for sure, the real question for us English is whether we are happy to pay for the high price tag.
650 ml. bottle.  Pours black with a nice tan head.  Aroma of smoke, malt, and chocolate.  Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, smoke, and some dark fruit.  Well done!

2012 bottle. Pitch black colour with an off white head. Roasted malty aroma with smoke, coffee, smoked ham, brown sugar. Light body, ideal carbonation. Great smoked flavour with coffee, brown sugar, some smoked meat and vanilla. Really tasty and easy drinking.
A smoky roasted flavor with nice bitterness and some sweetness. Oily mouthfeel. Very dark brown in color with a light brown head.

Color negro, ligeramente translúcido con matices rojizos. Espuma biege, ligera, pero duradera. El aroma es, por supuesto, ahumado, pero desvela notas de café amargo. El sabor inicialmente muestra los ahumados, pero con un final y un regusto amargo intenso. Correctamente carbonatada y con un textura ligera, es muy agradecida de beber. Salvo que no te gusten las ahumadas, es muy recomendable.

Bottle at home with James and JP. Dark reddish brown/black, frothy lively head fades to almost nothing. Slightly metallic, big BBQ smoke and a touch of dark chocolate on the nose. Soft chocolate malts, hint of coffee and then a big big meaty smoke hit that lasts right through to a roasty bitter finish. A little fizzy. Would like to try a slightly older version, a little bit rough round the edges just now! As it warms, a bit more warm malt comes through though to balance it out. Pretty good. Sampled straight after Buxton Smokey & The Band-Aid, still struggling to decide which I prefer! Purely because of its slight age and balance, Buxton maybe edges it a tiny bit.

(bottle) pours a pitch black colour with a frothy light brown head. aroma of honey-smoked ham, floral hops, brown sugar and green grapes, with a hint of campfire ash and dark chocolate. flavour is mostly toasted malts, with light hints of ash, caramel, peat smoke, paint thinner and a light-bitter finish. watery body with lively carbonation. disappointing.

Appearance: Basically black, some dark tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, some dark fruit. Smoke, tar, bacon.
Taste: More dark malt, smoke, roasted. Chocolate? Very nice.
Info: 650ml bottle, 31/3-2013, 221/300, 232/500, BB: 26/12-2026
Bottle. Deep black with a tan head. Aroma is smoke and bacon. Flavour is creamy smoke, some burnt malt, a little acid on a long creamy finish.

30-MAR-2013, bottle @Morten, from Ølbutikken.
Black with high, lasting, lacing, creamy, tan head.
Smoky aroma. Meat as well. Roast.
Taste is smoke, roast and meat. Medium body and carbonation.
Fine smoked. OK easy drinking for a smoked.

65cl bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours opaque black with a thin crema head. The nose has intense smoke and a hint of raisins. The taste has smoke with a demerara note through the middle and the finish is more smoke. The palate is very well balanced - full bodied but tight in texture with a long elegant finish. Overal, a very nice beer.
Pours the blackest of black, with a thick crema head, aroma is smoke an raisins, Taste is smoke to begin with, demaraha  sugar, boozy, big bodied, long well defined Finish

2008 version: Dark, almost black coloured. Off-white head, mostly lasting. Smoked aroma, faint chocolate and soy-sauce too. Soft flavor, bacon, sweet start, light acid, moderate bitter finish. Creamy texture.

65cl Bottle, thanks for sharing Marc! 2011 vintage. Almost black colour, creamy beige head. Aroma of tar/kreosote, pure cocoa, bitter chocolate, light peaty and earthy smoke, campfire, hard roasted malts, nice sweetness as well. Flavour is medium sweet, hard roasted malts, chocolate, cocoa, campfire, decent bitter finish with some chocolate. Light to medium-bodied. Nice.

Bottle. Pours black with a big beige head. Notes of smoke, wood, milk chocolate and alcohol in the aroma. Unique taste combining smoke and a portersque sourness. Notes of chocolate, coffee beans and herbal hops. Dry finish. Medium bodied. Creamy... no milky texture.

Bottle.
Pours dark borwn with a big tan head.
Balanced porter with some dry wooden smoke and red berries.
light smoked aroma,black, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, creamy, soft carbonation, smoked bitter finish.
220313. Bottle at home. Pours black with a nice head. Aroma burnt malts, coffee. Slight dry malty body. Not very smokey. Medium bodied. Not Bad.
Bottle at a bottle share. Pours a near black color. Nose is extremely smoky, as youd expect. Taste is also quite smoky, with some roasting coming through underneath. Nice and smooth.

0.65 L bottle, kindly shared by KnutAlbert.  Dense medium-sized light choco colored head. Body is translucent brown with a red glow. Soft and rounded malt aroma with mild sooty light sourish smoke. Sparkling carbonation, creamy texture.  Taste is soft and full malty. Fairly dry, with subtle ash/smoke tones and hint of black chocolate. Rouned smokey malt finish. Very good, indeed.
