On tap at the Amsterdam Cafe in San Francisco.  Black with a good creamy brown head.  Nice chocolate roast aroma, smokey.  Really nice light smokiness, has substance to it and is enjoyable.
Dark brown colour. Nice smokey aroma. Taste is smokey, roasted malts.

Dark brown, not as dark as I would have thought. Massive head. Nice smokeyness in the aroma, some rater said smoked salmon, think that is right, it´s a more delicate aroma than other smoked beers. Very long roasty, malty finish, with some hints of wood and slightly bitter roast. World class

Aroma is smokey but not overpowering. Pours dark black with not much head. Smooth to start with a complex smokey finish. Delightful.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska 650 ml, @ SB Knalleland, Borås. 
Svart öl med ett givmilt cappucinofärgat skum. Rökig doft (som från ett fiskrökeri), nyinköpt hästsadel, mörk choklad och kaffe. Först i eftersmaken återkommer rökigheten, och ger en skön munkänsla. Innan detta är det choklad, röda bär, vanilj och svagt av kaffe som ger munnen vad den vill ha.
Bottle. Thanks to Alvaro from petroleos blog. Pours black with tan head. Smoked salmon aromas, some coffee. Same for taste, with roasted malts.
Bottle @ Beer Temple. Black colour, tan head. Nose is smoked malts, fruits, roasted malts. Flavour is smoked malts, fruits and chocolate. Pleasant.

650ml bottle,2012 vintage from Cotteridge Wines shared with Steve.14th march.Very dark brown pour with a medium sized tan head which soon diminished.Nice aromas of roast malt,chocolate and smokiness which all appeared in the taste.Coffee,cocoa and vanilla also detected after a few more sips.Medium bodied,smooth and tasty porter.
From a bottle. Tastes like cold smoked salmon and coffee. Smells like coffee, cocoa, spices, slightly sweet.

Bottle. Pours deep, dark brown with average, creamy tan head; short retention and spare lacing. Aroma is roasted and chocolate malts, smoke, plums, cranberries, floral and earthy hops, and light woody notes. Flavor is roast malts and smoke dominate with supporting dark chocolate, earthy hops, ash, dark fruit esters, and faint oak and vanilla; dry, smokey finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle (vintage 2012). Dark brown, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, light caramel and some roasted malt, light smokiness. Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor, light caramel and some roasted malt. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, some roasted malt and faint smokiness. More roasted than smoked - cannot be compared with Bamberg style.

Once your nose gets anywhere near this beer you will flashback to sitting around a campfire. Its quite dark but sediment can be seen around the edges. It tastes of smoked meat like maybe moose jerky. The head is not to be missed for it tastes a bit like black coffee. I have one aging so look forward to my review of this brew.

65cl bottle from Bierzwerg. Vintage 2012. 09/17/12. Poured black with a thick brown head. Aroma has smoke, licorice and roasted malt. Pleasant smokyness. Flavor has smoke, ash, licorice, hops and roasted malt. Long roasty finish with hint of coffee. Woody notes coming more as it gets warmer. Pleasant, tasty porter. Smooth, medium to full bodied.

Bomber, SB. Pours pitch black with a good diminishing tanned head leaving lacing. Aroma is roasted soy smoke a bit peaty slightl fruity tones. Flavor is dry roasted malty slightly smoked salty licorice good bitterness which lasts long. Finishes dry and bitter roasted.

Refrigerated brown 2011 bomber poured into a snifter.  Pours black with small beige head which dissapates quickly.  Little lacing, medium/thick body, well carbonated, and smoke aroma.  Taste is roasty, smoke, and some meat (mostly salami with some bacon).

Its almost a perfect 10. Almost.
Its the only one that can compete with Schlenkerla.
Great aroma and taste. Smokiness to the maximum. 
I could find a metallic touch at the aftertaste, which I hope goes away when aged. This one was 2012. I have another one which I will age for a couple of years and see how it goes. Very nice beer.

Medium beige head. Opaque black body. Roasty charcoal smoke aroma with earthy caramelly notes. Dry-sweet licorice charcoal smoky taste with chalky burnt notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, mealy mouthfeel. Dryish smoky licorice and chocolate aftertaste with mealy sooty notes. Nice, harmonic, and drinkable. (0.65l bottle shared by KnutAlbert.)
Bottle. Deep black/brown color with tan top. Taste of cedar, ash, roasted malts, charcoal, and slight coco. Medium body. Solid smoked!

65cl bottle - 2012 vintage. Served in Tulip. Deep dark brown colour with a light brown head (three fingers). Aroma is roasted malts and cookies, very nice. Taste predominantly shows dark chocolate, roasted malts and coffe. The smoked character seems to help with providing the mentioned flavors when mixing the ingredients. Little or no sweetness, no alcohol at all on the other hand. Mouthfeel is medium, carbonation is just average. Good beer!

Clear black colour, reddish hue, tan head. Smoked aroma, ash, malts, chocolate and beef jerky. Smoky flavour, bacon, light sweet touch. Finish smoke, ash and bacon.
Nice brew!
(From 66cL bottle @ American Beer Tasting, Café De Kleine Wereld, Breda)

Bomber (from tasting session notes). 2007 vintage (about two years). Aromas of Band-Aids and deep smoke. Light-medium body -- might have had more body when fresh. Initial has smooth chocolate. Mid goes sweet and add smoked blue cheese,  Final continues with the smoky blue cheese, and has fried bacon notes, too. Very ong finish. Full-flavored stuff. Smooth and silky.

2008 bottle at fletchfighters tasting. Thanks guys! Pours really dark with a light brown head. Aroma is smokey malt, roastiness, wood and chocolate. Taste is light to medium sweet and smokey leading to a smokey and roasty chocolate finish. Really awesome.

[old] Bottle. Black. Smokey malts on the nose, Soft roasted tones, chocolate. Body is medium full, smoky tones (some beef jerky, a bit of bbq), dark chocolate. Overall a pretty soft, slightly smoky porter. The bottle had been open for a while, so some things might have been lost already.

Nose is of smoked wood and chocolate, smooth lively mouthfeel with flavours of smoked ham, dark chocolate, fruits and a slightly sweet finish. Shall be buying another one or two and stroring them for a while, shall rerate within 2 years :D

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2013 Bottle at home, thanks to Ben K fom PDX for gifting me this one, 23/02/13. 2008 bottle.
Light black/exremely dark mahogony brown with a tan head that quickly dissipates.
Nose is smoked gammon, dark malts, touch of chocolate, dark fruits.
Taste comprises smoked meats, dark lightly roasted malts, molasses, chocolate.
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, smoked dry finish.
At the top end of the smoked beer spectrum !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Thanks for sharing Roman! 2008 bottle. Pours dark almost black with a small light brown head. The smell is smokey meat, jerky dark roasted malt. Taste is roasted malt, smoke. It is silky smooth with medium body...aged well. Overall, very nice with fairly subtle smoke which is well integrated. Glad to try a 4 year old bottle.
Sample at Mitra Bier Experience2008 bottle. Dark, light brown head. Aroma and taste are overipe fruit, some smoke and rye. Taste is smokier than aroma. Bitter.

Sörspecialista, Budapest

 Vöröses fekete színe van, közepes méretű, krémes, bézs színű és igen kitartó habbal. Illata mint a füstölt sonkának, ami mellet van egy kis kávé, megpörkölődött faforgács, barna malátakeksz, vanília. Ízében is erősen érezni a füstölt húsos aromát, dohányt, kávét, tőzeget, fát, melaszt, bbq zamatot. Közepesen testes és buborékos. Utóíze is füstös, keserédes és száraz. Remek sör, ez valóban brutálisan füstös és remekül megy egy kerti sütögetéshez.

15/II/13 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle from Biernavigatie (webshop, NL) @ my birthday tasting - BB: n/a - 2012 vintage (2013-174) 
Clear dark purple brown beer, big beige head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: smoky, some chloride, bit chemical, caramel, bit sweet. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: smoky, caramel, little sour, more smoke. Aftertaste: caramel, pretty bitter, hoppy, little malty. Not subtle enough to be really great.

Bottle, 65 ml, at Bruggens Ølbar. Had this one almost 10 years ago in America. Nice to see it on shelves in Denmark. 2012 vintage. Very dark brown with a frothy, average-sized tan head, good retention and laceworks. Aroma is charcuterie and dark roasted malt. Flavor is smooth, sweet and smoked malt, a little tar, bacon, hops. Lingering smoked medium bitter dry finish. Delicious. Gets better for every sip.

2011 bottle. Deep black-brown with ruby highlights. No pop when opening and pour is worryingly smooth. Even hardening the pour up near the end only yielded a brief, scant off-white head leaving no lace. Nose is smoked hickory and roasty malt. Medium body with minimal carbonation. Roast malt, smoked hickory and ham, chocolate and some tart dark friut and tobacco. Finish is medium and more of the same, with more roastiness coming out late. A superbly balanced smoke porter - if only carbonation had been normal in this bottle. Dunno if the reduced carbonation and mellow taste are a function of the age of this bottle, but I will absolutely be getting a 2012 bottle or two to measure it against. Not just a good smoked beer, but also a very good porter.

650ml bottle.
Pours a clear, really dark mahogany brown, with a thin beige head.
Huge, complex, smoked aroma, malt, caramel, iodine, licorice, ashes, tobacco, chocolate, lightly phenolic.
Off-dry, medium to full bodied, high bitterness, balanced CO2.
Smoaked, roasted taste, malt, ashes, chocolate, earth, caramel, coffee, licorice root.
Pacled with power, yet a bit harsh. Will mellow out nicely with age. (2013-02-10)
Dark brown pour,beige head,excellent lace.Aroma of smoke,dark fruit,chocolate and wood.Flavor is malty with a sour edge.Notes of bacon smoke,wood and bakers chocolate. Medium body and carbonation.
Bottle @ home vintage 2008 The aroma is smoked malt, sweet malt and coffee.... The flavor is thin, smoke, light roasted malts, caramel and light coffee.......

Bottle.
Pours black with a 1 finger brown head, good retention.
Aroma has roasted and sweet malt, hemp rope, subtle smoke.
Taste is quite sweet with subtle smoke, wood, some chocolate and some slightly sour and salty notes at the end.
After taste is long, dry and bitter.
Smoke could be a lot heftier in this one, otherwise a good smoked porter.
650 ml bottle. Aroma of smoked meats and dark malt. Tastes of smoke, dark malt, tar and burnt malts. Body is thin to medium. Nice beer

(Bomber from Bryggens Ølbar; Brewed on September 13th 2012 and BB December 26th 2026) Pours black with medium, tan head that diminishes. Decent regeneration and lace. Aroma is smoky in a relatively subtle, woody, non-peaty way. Creamy, softly carbonated, medium body with a lingering, roasted finish. Taste largely follows the nose and the malt present as body and a roasted, slightly ascorbic presence. Decent and well balanced for a smoked porter. Girlfriend says: "It's for me easy to drink."

Bottle. Pours cloudy dark brown with stable light tan head. Clear aroma of roasted malt, caramel and beans. Rich, roasty flavour of malt, coffee beans and dark chocolate. Good, dry aftertaste. My 500th rating... definitely decent enough for celebrating my 35th birthday :-)
Courtesy of Ogreface, thank you! Poured deep ruby-black with a medium tan head that disappears slowly. Aroma of smoked ham, bbq, light ash, earth, liquerice. Medium body, dry finish.

(2012, 650 ml)

Appearance: Pitch black, thin tan head.

Aroma: Campfire, cola, vanilla.

Taste: Thin tasting. Starts of with quite a bit of tartness, vinegar, green apples. Segways into roasted notes, coffee and quite a bit of smoke.

Bottle 2011....Dark brown pour,beige head,excellent lace.Aroma of smoke,dark fruit,chocolate and wood.Flavor is malty with a sour edge.Notes of bacon smoke,wood and bakers chocolate. Medium body and carbonation.Finish is a roasted malt dryness with a touch of salt.

Bomber, courtesy of Ogreface, thanks!
Deep ruby-black pour with a medium tan head that melts down slowly to a lacing one.  Aroma of ham and barbecue, light ash, earth, liquerice. Medium bodied beer on a malt base with the character of barbecue, ash and burnt wood, soot. Dry aftertaste, but it has some bbq too...

From a bottle 9/18/12, 6.5% abv, pours dark brown / black with quite a large foam head which hangs around, carbonation is good. Aroma has smokey bacon, roasted chestnuts, a little chocolate, resiny hops and a slight smokey bitterness at the end. Nice beer

From Salling, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 010213.
Black with beige head. Aroma of roasted malt and smoke. Flavour with coffee, chocolate and smoke
Bottle in CO with Janie and Bob.  Tastes like licking a burnt pine tree...which is awesome.

Bottle. Deep brown almost black colour with a medium sized tan head. Aroma is smokey, some hints of what might be chocolate, smoke, a bit of bacon perhaps and some more smoke. Flavour is sweet, slightly bitter and smoke with a side of smoke. Did I mention that it is smokey?

Bottled 2011. Pours black with a medium sized, tan head leaving a fair lacing. Nose of toasted malt, chocolate, coffee and smoke. Sweet flavor that ends up quite dry. Medium bodied, oilt texture and soft CO2. An excellent smoked porter. ★★★★

650ml bottle (2012 vintage). Opaque black colour with average, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, tan head. Smokey aroma has roasty notes, a spicy and peppery touch of chili. Taste is dry smokey, intensely roasty, minimally metallic, grassy hoppy overtones. Nicely balanced dry notes combining smoke, roast and hop.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2013 66cl bottle shared.
Thin tan head.  Deep burgundy pour.  Very nice smokey taste.

Bottle(2012). Voldby Koebmandsgaard, Hammel. Dark brown color with a medium tan head. Aroma is very smokey with a note of roasted coffee and chocolate. Taste is roasted malts, chocolate and some roasted coffee notes and a lot of smokiness.Very nice smooth and smokey finish. Great porter
had at the yagas chilli and beer festival. very smokey and roasty. will buy bottles of this

Pours black in the glass with a touch or red.  Aroma of smoked meats but not too overpowering like Aecht-Schlenkerla Rauchbier.  Smoke, cocoa and espresso flavors.  Overall, a nice expression of the style.  Glad to have it here in TX.

Bottle(2011) from my secret santa 2012, thanks Santa. Pours pitch black with a big frothy tanned head. Aroma of smoked salami and bacon, coffee and roast malts. Taste is light roasted coffee, light smoked bacon up front, and some moderate sweet light roasted malts all the way to the end. Smoked beer for everyone !
Smooth mouthfeel

First one I tried was amazing it had such a flavorful smokey after-taste but not like some liquid-smoke was just dropped into it. Super dark in color and not over-carbonated. The second one I tried a week later however was a completely different experience, there was maybe half of the smokey flavor if not less in the second bottle and was not as memorable. The quality control on this product is suspect, some bottles may taste WAY different than other bottles. I would still highly recommend this one for all to try
Poured black with a thick tan head. Aroma of sweet rauched malt. Medium to slightly watery body, flavour is of the smoked malt with some restrained bitterness. Surprisingly smooth.
Very dark brown with a thick tan head. Smoky and fruity notes. Malt, smoke, roosted and bitterness. Medium body with a nice balanced finish.

Aroma - I'm not in love with the aroma; a little smoke and a hint of hops. 
Appearance - dark, dark brown; almost opaque. Creamy light tan head that lingers long and laces heavily.
Taste - smoke, smoke, and more smoke. I can't really taste the beer for the the smoke. It's like sipping a bottle of liquid smoke, trailing away to something slinky that I can't identify.
Mouthfeel - pleasant, slightly grassy thinness.
Worth trying. Not my favorite, but certainly interesting.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 bottle.
Dark brown with a brown head.
Aroma: sausage, smoke, chocolate, roasted.
Taste: smoked meat, salt, licorice, cocoa, roasted, light sour, some bitterness in the finish.
Medium bodied, smooth.
Nice, but after wanting to try this since early 2010, my expectations werent met.

Pours near pitch black in color with a small tan head that fades slowly.  Great lacing. Aroma is very smokey but not burnt. Smells like bacon grease which is pretty awesome. Taste is packed with smokiness but it does not overpower. Really tastes like liquid bacon. Thick and creamy mouthfeel with a very smooth finish. Low complexity but very tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650ml bottle shared with Dutchdrebus. Dark brown color with a red glow coming through, medium sized light brown head that lasts for a decent while and leaves a nice lacing. Smell malts and smoke. Taste malts, smoke, lightly bitter finish. Medium body, ok carbonation.

Bottle @ home thx to benzai. Black with some ruby redness shining through, medium light brown head. Smells mostly roasty, some chocolate and a bit sweet. Tastes smokey, bacon, slightly salty even, roasty and a little chocolate bitterness. Medium body (quite nice for its abv) and soft carbo.

Pour opaque "light black(?)", with a large frothy beige head. 
Aroma of roasted malts, smoke, oatmeal, sweet licorice, slight coffee, slight leather and earthy notes. The taste is slightly sweet upfront, with a solid dose of bitterness towards the end. Medium bodied, with a semi-flat carbonation.

2011 Bottle: Pours a dark cola brown with a foamy coffee colored head.

Aroma is faint notes of smoke and roasted malts and a touch of chlorine.

The taste is salt and smoke with some bitterness and an almost ashtray finish.  The aftertaste is cigarettes.

The body is medium with a thin texture and no real carbonation to speak of.

Overall I am really disappointed in this beer.  I saw the 99 rating and went out of my way to trade for this bottle.  I was expecting something much more balanced than this one note wonder.  If you like the taste of smoke and ash and cigarettes, this beer would be right up your alley.  For me, Ill be looking elsewhere.

Cola like pour with a frothy beige head. Aroma: roasted malt, espresso, peat, prune, smoked woodchips. Taste and mouthfeel: bitter and very smoky. Slightly sweet from the malts, bitter frim the hops, espresso and smokiness.

Lovely

Bouteille courtoisie de Hogtownharry ou Blankboy. Nez malté fumé (bacon et jambon) et  rôti, moyen de chocolat au lait et chocolat noir, léger de houblon herbeux avec des notes fruitées (léger de prunes et de dates) et de café. Moyenne-ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture crémeuse aux notes huileuses. Petites notes fruitées (dates, léger de prunes) avec des notes de chocolat au lait ainsi que quelques notes de vanille et fumée de bois lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un goût de malt fumé légèrement terreux (qui dure toute la gorgée et rappelant la viande fumée) et  rôti ainsi quun goût moyennement amer de chocolat noir (notes de mélasse) et par la suite vient se rajouter progressivement un goût légèrement plus amer de houblon herbeux avec des notes de café noir et dalcool doux. Post-goût long aux notes sèches, fumé et moyennement amer de rôti, de chocolat noir, de café et de houblon avec de faibles traces fruitées (pelures de prunes).

22 oz bottle. Dark brown pour with a thick, light tan head. Aroma of milk chocolate, roasted coffee and smoke. Flavor is rich, roasty malt, some bitter coffee and a bacon. Medium to full body with average carbonation and a long, dry finish. This is a nice porter with a definite and pleasant smoked character.

Bottle @ Naples Beach. The pours deep brown with a tiny off-white head. The nose is plenty of smoke. Baked ham, semi-bitter chocolate. A touch of caramel. The taste is quite smokey, strong roasted malts. Robust chocolate. Medium body. Smooth. Overall, a pretty decent smoked beer. Im not obsessed with the style, but this is solid.

Aroma: Smelling of ashes, dark fruits, peat and smoke.Appearance: A brown and black colored beer. A high off-white head with small lacing and small curtains.Taste: Tasting sweet dark bread, dark fruits, roasted coffee and vanilla.Palate: Low carbonation, a soft and oily texture. A medium body with a slightly dry finish.Overall: A quite ok smoked beer, not too pushy.Note: Bottle 650 ml. Reviewed 2012-12-30.
Bottle 0,65ltr: Very dark brown/black brew with an gentle but superbe smokey smell and flavour. Taste of roasted malts, coffee, choclolate and peat, Alaskan Panhandle meets Bamberg.

2012 bomber pours an opaque dark brown (almost black) with a moderate tan head and good lacing.  Smell is of smoked ham or bacon.  Aroma has some roasted malts, coffee, licorice, peat and dark fruits, but the smokiness overpowers everything else.  Body is medium with active carbonation.  Mouthfeel is sticky. Taste is more bitter than sweet.  I love good porters and German rauchbier, but I wish that this one had less smokiness to bring out the complexity of an otherwise great brew.

2012 bomber poured into an English pint glass.  Black with a thick tan head.  Aroma is roasted coffee with a lot of smokiness and some earthiness.  Flavor is dark chocolate with some roasted coffee notes and a lot of smokiness.  Lighter bodied than I would have expected, but has a nice smokey mouthfeel.  Overall a very enjoyable smoked porter.

Bomber from SB cons 2012-12-26 Göteborg
AR: smoked susage, chocolate, white sugar
AP: dark dark brodn with ruby rim, lively sand brown slowly deminishing head, leaving wee curtains
F: heavy bitterness, tar, raw peatiness, smoked salty meat, salt licorice, wee chocolate, finish is raw peaty bitterness, feeling is thin. There is lack of some honey sweetness or similar in this beer, I doubt this beer will be much better after some years of storage!
On tap at Zeightguist, pours a nice dark colour with a foam head. Nice roasted smokey woody aroma and tase. Excellent beer.

Bottle from Systembolaget, my first beer from Alaska. 

Black with a medium tan head. Aroma and taste of malt, smoke, ham, some wood and some licorice. Not that complex but nicely drinkable.

Bomber courtesy of RoNo. Pours very dark brown with a rather small frothy brownish beige head that leaves lots of trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly sweet, tiny fruity and smokey witch roasted malts, charred wood, light peat, banana bread, sweet dark bread, prunes, raisins, burnt cereal, sweet liquorice candy, moss and hints of incense. Taste is tiny sweet and bitter with roasted malts, smoke, burnt cereal, charred wood, smoke, sweet liquorice candy, caraway, sweet dark bread, coffee hard candy, unripe banana and hints of resinous wood, grapefruit rinds and pine. Mouthfeel is round, soft, tiny astringent, tiny watery and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with roasted malts, sweet liquorice candy, smoke, charred wood, pumpernickel bread, light peat, coffee hard candy and hints of burnt cereal. A great balanced perfectly smokey beer.
Bottle @ tasting. Dark brown pour, thin tan head. Aroma of smoked eel, bacon and wood. Nice suubtle and balanced smoke. Flavor is subtle roasted smoke. Nice and clean, nice balance. Great brew.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is smoky roasty bbq, nice malty note. Awesome. Flavour is roasty malt, bbq, smoke. A bit thin for the abv, but still very nice.

It has a dark brown, almost black color and a light brown colored head. Its aroma of strong smoke... its very, very nice smoked nose. The flavor isnt as smoky and is very light on the palate. Its easy, flavorful, nice, roasted character is light and makes for a good standard porter. It would be nice if it had just a little more body and had a little more smoke in the flavor. Some toasted notes come through in the finish that are pleasant and blend well with the smoked malts.

Bottle. Opaque black/very deep brown liquid with medium tan head. Aroma of smoke/charkuteries, tobacco, dark chocolate, coffee, toffee, ash and light raw sugar. Nice stuff. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of tobacco, dark chocolate and light ash. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice stuff, very balanced and smokey.

Den här ölen ingick i en extravagant ölprovning och av de ölen som provades var detta den största besvikelsen. Men i största allmänhet var det en god öl med mycket rökt prickig korv i smaken med inslag av lite syra. Kroppen var något tunn men balansen var till belåtenhet.

Bottle: Black colour, big brown creamy head. Aroma is dominated of leder, woody,, smokey, and dry fruity hops. Flavor had a nice smokey/woody mouthfeeling. a nice compelx porter, medium body, medium fruity/smokey finish. Nice
Lovely if you like Smokey things. Smoked sausage but in a good way. Makes a nice change but not cheep

Riktigt mörkt brun öl, nästan svart med ett beige skum som ligger kvar. En hel del rökighet i doften. Inte whiskeyrökighet utan mer en charkuterirökighet. Hittar även lakrits och lite aka i doften. Rökigheten i smaken balanserar bra mot de rostade tonerna. En ra porter som lyfts till en riktigt bra smoked porter.
Smoky anise and dark chocolate aroma. Dark black with foamy white head and lots of lacing. Taste is meat, malts, dark chocolate, a bit sweet. Nicely carbonated. Nice beer.
Nice smokey taste, Nice ballance, but i think its a little bit boring, its to easy to drink
@ Basunen: Stor sälta och trevlig rökighet. Mycket len smak (sammetslen) fin balans och trevlig sötma.

2002 bottle aged at the brewery sent recently in trade! Big thanks for getting this bottle at a Alaskan brewing store tasting and sending it my way! Pour has a very dark brown mahogany color and it does still have carbonation and a ring of light brown head that fell off quickly. Aroma opens with a nice sweet smoked malt, light peat, dark bitter chocolate, black coffee, and some campfire. Very lively for a beer of its age. Mouth feel is on the lighter side and there is some slow carbonation kicking around. Flavor has a nice base beer underneath, smoked malt, dark chocolate, light bitterness, and some coffee. I am not generally a fan of smoked beers but this has mellowed so well and the porter itself has enough left to still be plenty flavorful. By far the oldest beer I have tried and really an example of what age can do to the right beer.

As a Porter, It kick ass; With its rich Chocolate and Roasted Malt Flavors. As a Smoked Beer, its a bit underwhelming but still has solid Ham, Oak, and Smoke flavors. I would still recommend this beer because it has alot to offer in terms of flavor, even if some flavors are stronger than others
Dark robust smokey aroma and flavor.  Creamy brown head it is a nice beer that I enjoy sipping.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Black with a medium, beige head.
Very smoked aroma; tar, leather, bacon.
Rather high bitterness and carbonation.
Leather, salty licorice and tar in the flavour.
Surprisingly light body.

Great balance to this beer, but there's no surprises for me that makes this beer interesting. It's good but nothing special. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with no head
Smoky medwurst aromas. No hoppyness at all.
Extreme smokyness in taste. Werres the rest. Very very one dimensional. Lets put some smoky mslts in this mothafucker. Come on!

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2012 I feel bad for rating this so poorly, but it was definitely the disappointment of the evening... Pours black with low tan head. Aroma is smoke, german sausage bacon, I also pick up a lot of peat and whisky barrel. So far so good, but unfortunately, the taste is pretty much the same, with tons of smoke and burnt malt and a lack of balance. Especially annoying is the light body which makes all that smoke come across as just bitter and nasty, not enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 07.12.12
Visual: Pours black with a one finger khaki head.
Aroma: Slightly smoked some bitternes.
Taste: As aroma and a touch of campfire, thin body, moderate carbonation.


Visual:
Aroma:
Taste:

Appearance was clear reddish black with creamy diminishing tan 1 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are sweet bitter chocolate malts, smoked bacon, coffee, maple, hops are  mild herbal and spicey. Palate was soft smooth champagne-like CO2 with meduim-full body, then long smokey bacon wonderful warming porter finish. A beautiful smoked porter.

Alaskan Smoked Porter 2012

Pours black with a one finger khaki head. Nice smoked meat and winter campfire aromas. Taste follows the nose well. Smoked meat, roasted bitterness, and a touch of campfire.
Medium to thin mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Very nice beer, very robust and savory. 

-
Bottle. Pours dark with strong smoked wood aromas. Flavor is smoke, wood and some other flavors. A very nice smoked beer. Would definitely pick this up again.

Good looks make a good first impression. Light aroma, but right from the first drink, the heavy smoke hits you, and it is good. Very complimentary for this porter. Great taste and aftertaste. The smokiness never dies down, either.
Bottle pours a black color with thick lacing off white top. Scent is roastedr, smoke and coffee. Taste coffee and smoke.

2012 vintage, not that agd expensive stuff... Anyway, pours an almost black body with light tan head. Quite some smoke, of the bacon-y kind. Some toasted malts and forest aromas. Very wintery. Well balanced bitterness and (smoked) malts. Gives some pecan nut taste and quite earthy yet not thick at all. Well carbonated. Neither porters nor smoked beers are my favourites but this works very well; very well indeed. (Bomber from De Bierwinkel Leiden)
Flaska från SB. Öl brygd på alrökt malt. Mörkt brun vätska. Lätt kropp, ganska torr, mild rökighet men ändå kärv på av brända och beska toner. Lite för torr/kärv för min smak.

2011 vintage bottle shared at Beer Temple.  Pours black with a tan head.  Aroma of smoked ham in the forefront, with the normal porter aspects in the background.  Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.  Really nice and well balanced smoked beer.
650ml bottle.  Pours a very dark brown with a large head.  Aroma is burnt wood and smoked ham.  Taste has light smoke and berries to start.  Ashy, smoked ham finish.
Alaskan does this one up proper. smoke is there in full effect but you arent left as if you were licking burnt wood. The base porter is tasty and plays well with the treatment.

650ml Bottle - Dark brown, almost black, with some red tinges. Smoky malt, ash, beech, chocolate and coffee in the aroma. Roasted and rich taste with the smoke being noticeable, yet more subtle than I anticipated. Notes of dried fruit, coffee and liquorice can be detected.
Definite smoked character. Aromas of charred wood and chocolate malt. Rich flavours of cocoa, malt, and smoke. Very well made and will drink again.

2012 bomber bottle. Aroma is dark with some smoky dryness.  The appearance is dark with some brown around the edges, nice tan lacing. The taste is very dark malt with tons of smoke through out. Finishes a very dry coffee malt. The palate is ok with all that smoke. Overall, a great beer, and I really don't care for many smoky beers. I have another one that i look forward to putting some age on. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark cloudy brown with a reasonable beige head. Aroma is smoke, leather, chicory, burnt straw, subtle hints of dark fruit. Creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied, smoky palate with a lingering greasy smoke finish. Taste is smoke, bacon, peat, soy sauce, chicory, hints of chocolate and roast grain. One of the better smoked beers I've tried.

Vintage 2011. Pours a chocolate black with a fluffy beige head. The nose is old camp fire. Medium bold. The pallet is smoke meat, ash, with a smooth middle and finishes with a smoky astringency. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of my first smoked beers and still one of my favorites. Plenty of smoke and char without tasting like an ashtray and the chocolate and malt of the porter still shine through. Really glad this is finally available in Texas!
Great smoked flavor. Really good balance between porter/smokiness. A little on the light side. Easy drinker for a smoked ale.

22oz bottle.
Deep brown pour with a nice tan head.  Nose is smokey but not overly so - coffee, roasted malt.  Flavors of smoke, chocolate, and some dark fruit.

Bottle.  Pours an almost black dark brown with medium tan head.  Aroma of wood chips, dark chocolate, roasted malts, and vanilla.  Flavor is slightly bitter up front, but gives way to malty sweetness.  the smokiness comes through strong, but not overpowering. Also, hints of vanilla and chocolate in the flavor.  Very good overall.  Delicious.

Bottle @ BT, Amsterdam 
Pours dark red-black, with yellowish head.
Beech nose with light, smokiness. Lovely subtle use of rauch.
Light bacon. Tingling the palate. Lovely.

Pours dark and black with a small tan head. Nose is chocolate, bacon, coconut, coffee and hot dogs. Taste is sweet with a nice bitter smoke aftertaste. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean, medium body and long finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Jet black pour (tar).   Toffee colored head, fairly decent at first.  Smoke, roasted malt, and wood twigs in the nose. Sweet malt on the tongue.  Finish is smoked (meat),long lasting malt finish.  Try this beer.

Not being much of a porter fan, this is far and away my favorite one. 

This beer pours perfectly and, once it warms just slightly, has a deep rich taste and feel. The smokiness couldnt be a better complement to the beer. 

I stumbled across this beer a couple years ago, when it appeared on tap at one of my favorite bars, and have been hooked ever since. Its an especially nice beer to spend most of an evening with, a very nice slow drinker. It just seems to get better and better as it continues to warm and breathe. It serves well as its own fireplace.

If this beer were an album, it would be Leonard Cohens Various Positions. His voice, at this point, is slightly raspy, but still incredibly soothing, and its an album that can be played over and over and over all through the evening. Its a perfect fit for a cool winters night.

Very dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of woodsmoke, roast, and light cocoa. Taste is nice and smoky, but not overwhelmingly so. Lots of roasty malt character as well. Medium bodied. Overall, a pretty mild smoked beer, but pretty good.

2012 Bottle. Pours opaque dark brown with 3 fingers of brown head, good retention. Smells is dominated by smoke. Hints of wood and malts. Smoky, mesquite flavor with roasted malts. Finish is bitter smoke and malt that lingers. Medium to soft carbonation and a slightly oily mouthfeel. A tasty rauchbier.
Dark brown pour with a creamy dense laced  tan head,  the body is on the light side for a porter. Great smoked flavor , my first alder smoked beer

22oz bomber 2011 edition in honor of my 500th beer rating.  this one pours dark brown to black with light brown/tan head that pretty much hangs on command and swirling in the glass.  leaves like an oily lacing. the aroma is of roasted malt, peat and smoke which is not overpowering by any stretch and maybe some ash. the flavor is godsend in a glass. the dark roasted malt and peat mixed with the medium smokiness blends so well together a true treasure that i was able to procure.
Pours a black brown color with a foamy light brown head. Notes of ash, smoke, milk chocolate, booze, and brownies. Thinner mouthfeel.

2012 edition pours black with about a 1 inch tan head.  Smokey aroma with not much carbonation.  Medium smooth velvet mouthfeel.  Slightly bitter and dry towards the end.  I heard so much about this beer over the years I guess I was expecting a little more smoke.   Glad to see this beer finally make it to the Texas market.
Bottle - pours dark black with a heavy cola colored head. Has a smoky coffee flavor to it. I was highly impressed with the creamy mouthfeel. Nice roasty finish.

2012 bottle.  numerous times i have looked at this beer on RB over the years and just drooled over the label.  so much hype, and i could never get my hands on it in GA.  it wasnt until a spur of the moment work trip to houston(of all places) it found me.  pours a clear black, but not opaque with a small tan head.  meaty white smoke aroma.  lighter body than i expected.  the smoke flavor is strong without being overpowering...you can still taste a porter in there.  the porter itself comes off as being on the lighter bodied side with a lot of bitter roasted malt.  overall, theres not a whole lot of sweetness and it finishes quite dry.  i really like the smoke intensity.

Had the 2011....Did not pour as thick as I thought it would.  Black as night with about 1 finger head which lasted only about a minute.  Aroma was of rasted malts and medium smokiness.  After one year the smokiness has died down considerably.  Taste is roasted malts up front followed by a nice character of smoke.  A medium to heavy mouthfeel with just enough carbonation.  Looking forward to comparing the past few years with next years.

Pours dark ruby black with a large tan head. Smells smoky. Taste is smoky with a touch of smoked salmon. Medium-bodied with a smooth, velvety texture and supple mouth-carbonation, Alaskan Smoked Porter (2012) finishes with a touch of sweet smoke.

Bottle from Choice Beverages in McKinney.  Pours black with a thin tan head.  The aromas are smoked bacon, roasted coffee, black pepper and barbecue.  The mouthfeel is dry bitter and has a heavy body with low carbonation.  Lots of smoke chocolate and coffee in the flavors.  Really loved this one!  Cheers!
Blackwith a growing foamy Brown head. Nice smoky aroma with some roast malt. Smoked flavor is lighter than the smell but very present. Creamy mouthfeel and fantastically drinkable.

Black beer with a medium consistency. The aroma is a lot of beef and smoke. The taste is very smoky and has a strong bitterness as well. These take some getting used to but this is a good one esp. when youre hungry.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2013 
65 cl bottle. 2008 vintage.
Seems to age pretty well, doesnt taste better but hasnt turned worse either. Still quite strong with the smoky aroma, less hops obviously. Still excellent.
65 cl bottle. 2011 vintage.
Pours pitch black color with a small off-white head. Aroma of smoke, dark toasted malts, faint vanilla notes and some chocolaty coffee hints. Flavor of smoked ham, some dark roasted malts, vanilla, licorice and hoppy ripe fruits. Somewhat creamy palate with a dry burnt finish. Excellent.
4326

650 ml bottle. 2011 vintage.
Pours a pitch black colour with a creamy, beigeish head. Aroma of rich roasted malts, fern, smoked ham and wood. Flavour of rich roasted malts, smoked ham, strong wood, ripe fruits, bitter grassy hops and some salty notes. Medium bodied, oily and maybe a bit thin mouthfeel and a rich, smoked and malty finish. Rich and tasty.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2013 65,1 cl bottle vintage 2011 @ home, no BBE info
Sweetish and sticky aroma with smoke, tar, cocoa, ash and woody notes. Palate is slightly too high on CO2. Flavour is rather smoky with tar, some coffee, licorice and hints of ash. A bit sticky but good.

65,1 cl bottle vintage 2008 @ home, no BBE info
More licorice here and quite intensive finish with some warming alcohol. But this feels slightly watery.

650ml bottle
2011 vintage - Pours pitch black with a massive foamy head. Aroma of smoke, leather, roasty malts, hints of smoked ham. Taste is well balanced and complex with some smoked and roasty notes, hints of coffee, licorice and ash. Finish is roasty with some hints of licorice, smoked malts and coffee. Nice, well balanced and tasty.

Aroma:  Intense smoke, thats pretty much it.  Appearance:  Nice dark color, almost opaque, but the head is slight, a light tan color with little film.  Taste:  Excellent, the smoke is obviously the first flavor but an aftertaste of coffee, roasted malts, oak, and maybe some cherries.  Palate:  Nice, but weakens towards the end, not the syrupy texture I expected.  Overall an excellent beer and the best smoked Ive had.
The smoky flavor and nose is very strong. The mouth feel is thin for a Porter. There is no lacing. I wouldnt want to drink more than 8 ozs. Would be excellent to cook with.
Bottle, 2009 version. Smoked chocolate, dark sugar. Black, tanned lace. Fairly bubbly still, medium to light body. Bitter chocolate, roast, coffee, metallic smoke. Slightly flat in the finish.  Nice.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2015 2012 bottle. Thanks kapusil! Nice chocolatey porter flavors surrounded by smoky malts. As if Schlenkerla brewed an English Porter. Smoke is obvious, but not dominating. Would be nice next to some smoked fish. Chocolate porter with delicate smokiness. Fantastic!

Very dark brown pour, floaties, little head but I think that was due to the pour. Classic porter smell, sweet chocolate, faint coffee, and of course smoke. Taste is as advertised: porter plus smoke. Very well married.

Apparently Im supposed to fill this out. Take the numbers that I put down with a grain of salt if you will, but Im just your average NW beer junkie looking to sample as many different brews as possible.

Bottle. Pours deep opaque brown with floaties. Large tan head that slowly dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is smoked wood, coffee, dark roasted malts. Flavor is about the same, smooth and balanced with a light bitter coffee finish. Quite yummy.
UPDATED: SEP 14, 2012 Pours almost black. Great smoky aroma. Probably the best example of a smoked porter I?ve tasted. Highly recommended!

Pours dark rich brown with a finger of creamy light tan head
Aroma is thick with smoke, hazelnut and dark fruits
2010 vintage. Flavor is smoke and coffee. Light notes of wood on the tongue in the aftertaste. Light and effervescent carbonation obscures the taste up front, but in the finish that gets out of the way and the thick smoke takes over. Bittersweet cocoa stands out, with notes of cherry and strawberry. Hints of grassy hops linger in the back of the mouth, which is surprising for a two year old porter. Mouthfeel is a bit thin for the style, possibly related to the hi carbonation and the age.

Bottle @ TFODRBSG, Ulfborg. Vintage 2002. Clear dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate and smoked wood. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 180812

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2013 Bottle, 1 pint at TFODRBSG 2012. 2002 vintage. Finally, this is a beer Ive beer Ive been wanting to taste for several years. Fun that its a ten year old bottle Im drinking from when I finally get the chance to taste it. Its quite low on carbonation and head forming, dark brown in color and with some beige bubbles on top. Meaty, smoked ham like aroma with a solid dose of roasted malts. Nuts, some caramel and a hint of charcoal. Full-bodied, lightly oily, sweetish and quite bitter on the palate. Nice flavor with roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, nuts and bitterness. Really lasting finish, with the smoke and roasted malts blending nicely. A fine smoked porter indeed. Would certainly love to sample a fresh bottle. Rating: 8-3-8-4-16-3.9. 120818Bottle, 22oz. 2012 vintage. Looking gorgeous in the glass, next to pitch black, and topped by a dense, beige head that lasts. The aroma has some smoked salmon, hints of bonfire, and roasted malts and some chocolate. Theres a nice bitterness in the flavor, with some bonfire and smoked salmon. Roasted malts and chocolate too. Full body and a pleasant carbonation level. Bitter and roasted finish. A pure pleasure to drink. 130607

Bottle 473ml vintage 2002 @ TFODRBSG12
Pours clear brown with a small off-white head. Aroma has notes of smoke, ham, bacon, chocolate and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter woth a long smoked, chocolate finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle from 2002, 6.1% @ FOneFan, Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2012. Very dark brown with tiny beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, smoke and meat. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, little coffee, smoke, little meat, hops, little sweet and medium bitter.
Bottle @ Summer Gathering, Ulfborg. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, bacon, chocolate coffee and licorice.
65cl, Vintage 2011, American brew, thx to Secret Santa!, complex smoked Porter, smoked/malty and slightly roasted, balanced, clear, good head, good brew, yet expensive!
(Bottle). The smell and the taste is slightly sweet with elements of smoke, roasted malt, smoked cheese and chocolate, and a breath of fresh hops. Very nice and tasty!
2008 vintage.  Roasty and smoky aroma with some chcoolate faintly present.  Smokey, malty and againa little chocolate on the taste.  Holding up very well!

Bottle(s) thanks to savnac, thanks IRA. Pour is dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma is full of roasted malt and light smokey notes. Also hints of cocoa and a touch of bitterness in the later vintages. Certainly has smoke, but not overpowering. Flavor is true to nose with a nice balance of sweet roasted malt and light smoke. Also a touch of dryness in the finish. Really well-balanced and solid.

2010 bomber into snifter.  
Black with tan head, lasts quite a while.  Smells like a smoked porter, smokey, roasty, a bit of dark fruit.  Taste is quite smokey, some roast, a good amount of acidity.  Palate isnt exactly clean, but pretty standard for a porter.  This beer is fine, Im not a huge porter fan, nor a smoked beer fan, so its not my thing.
22oz bottle, from 2010. Thick dark red-tinted black. Sweet raison, chocolate malt nose. The sweet, velvety smoked malt comes in a little later. Balanced, sweet finish. Very nice beer

Poured from a 22 oz. bottle into a tulip.  2009 bottle.

The color of the beer itself is not quite black, with a few ruby-tinted edges.  A medium-sized mocha cap rests on top and leaves a few spots of lace down the sides of the glass.

There is not a heavy smoke presence in the nose, at least with this much time on it.  The aroma is full of fully roasted malt, with smoke, a bit of tobacco, some oak, and a bit of coffee in the background.

My first sip somewhat surprises me.  I was expecting a porter chock full of smokey malt, but this beer is much more subtle.  The roasted malt truly dominates, with just a light sweetness at the front of the sip.  A flare of smoke and tobacco that is rather gentle.  Some bitter chocolate and coffee grounds come in toward the end to provide the bitterness.

In terms of the body, this is right in the middle of the spectrum.  Balanced would be the best way to describe the carbonation - not totally creamy, but not really bold and crisp either.  The bubbles mellow in the background.

As someone who hates the sensation of overly smokey beers, so this has a nice flavor profile for someone of my palate.  I would definitely try this again, and it would be interesting to try a fresher bottle for comparison.

09 vintage on tap @ Beer Revolution. Pours a black color with a beige head. Aroma is very dark fruit forward, some liquorice and a slight amount of smoke. The flavor follows the nose with the dark fruits, coffee, liquorice, and slight amount of smoke. The body is on the lighter side of medium with a dryness. Overall kind of a disappointment, I expected more, but I hear the smoke fades, and comes back after a while, so I guess the smoke was on the fading point here.

Thanks to afdempse for sharing this tasty brew.

A: Nearly opaque, sizeable head and good lacing. Looks enticing!

S: Rich roasted malts, hops, coffee.

T: A really tasty beer. All of the flavors are integrated very well and work together quite nicely. Initially, I perceive roasted malts and coffee, followed by bittersweet chocolates and hops. There is a slight charred malt flavor (smokier than the roasted malt flavor) in there, as well.

M: Very nice feel. Crisp, clean, and delicious.

D: Id be happy to drink this anytime. Solid.

21 June 2012, bottle. 2003 vintage (9 years old!). Black and looks thin. Nose is lovely smoked salmon. Amazing that it is still this smoked after 9 years in the bottle. Thin and mildly fizzy. This is really smoky and has a noticeable smoked salmon flavor on top of burnt chocolate. Amazing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a turbulent mahogany with almost no head. A tiny bit of lacing. Thick smoky aroma, with just a hint of cherry and forward alcohol. Off-putting sausage flavor on the palate, with notes of pepper and coffee. Extremely weak mouthfeel and thin finish.

Aroma has notes of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, grassy hops and smoke. Very dark brown hue that sits black in the glass with an average sized foamy tan head that managed to stick around and leave a decent lace. Flavor is slightly sweet with a bitter smokey finish. Palate is medium bodied with an average carbonation. I really enjoyed this and would buy it regularly if it was available near home.

2009 Bottle

Poured into a snifter. Dark brown with a tan quarter inch head.

Wood burning smoke, toasted malt. Solid "smoked" beer smell with no extras.

Burnt wood, roasted malt, cocoa, bitterness at the rounds it out well.

Soft texture, medium body, moderate carbonation but not distracting.
Superb drink for any occasion... such as waking up in the morning. Really, an excellent beer with nothing bad to say about it.

2005 vintage.Tried the same vintage back in 2007ish at a tasting courtesy of Kook. This sample kept cellared until now, a present from a good friend.Cellar temperature and into a chalice. Pours a radiant and shimmering, deepest ruby with a thin but set and lasting tannish crown that leaves minimal legs. Charcuterie, smoke-house meats come through on first whiff. Meaty, cured pork, smoke ham, Biltong and anchovies amongst ashen peat and heather, strapped leather, Worcestershire sauce, dusty cocoa and heavily roasted coffee beans. The aroma is alive, full and piercing. Husky, smoky start in the mouth. Malt driven, smooth as silk and very long. Differs from the nose. The smoked meats are subdued, mellowed. Saltiness reminiscent of Worcestershire sauce and soft, leathery notes show its age. Bitter malt peak, spicy and peppery in the back with a heftily peaty, charred wood and bonfire ash finish and linger that is all controlling. This is sultry stuff, even after all these years. My old notes differed - bigger body, light spritz, clean, smoky malt profile - but it is far better now. A deliciously devilish porter. Very nice! (22fl.Oz)
2009 bottle courtesy of Wavers.  Aroma is rich chocolate, smoke, roast, and dark fruit.  Taste is lightly sweet and smokey with a nice clean finish.  Really great stuff.

Bottle from Bierkoning (EUR 16). Dark black body with puffy tan head. Nose is molasses, bacon and spices. Taste quite hammy with nice malts and coffee flavours. The texture is really nice and smooth. Really well done.
2009, a very good balance of roastyness and smoked malts. Rich and delicious, tastes like a much bigger beer than 6.5%

Shared by someone at the Montes Krown tasting yesterday.  2008 vintage.  Pours a coffee black with an eggshell head.  Pure smoke and maple in the nose.  Very heavy on the smoke flavor in the taste, along with the requisite porter components.  Decent, but not great.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2013 Pours black with a thick, lasting head, and a smokey, roasty, malty aroma. Taste is moderately complex, with notes of roasted, smokey malt. Has a moderately bitter and lingering finish which is good, not overpowering. This is a pretty good porter, and the smoke adds something new for me. Maybe bit light, and probably not one I would go for unless I wanted the smoked element.

Bottle. Thanks to GT2 . Pours very dark brown with a brown head. Aroma is smokey with fudge, toffee, milk chocolate, cocoa, liquorice and some wildish leather. Very nice and mellow balance. Taste is english liquorce, earthy notes, cocoa, bitter coffee, leather, weak smoke, hops and a pretty dry end. Very nice.

Bottle: Poured a dark chocolate brown with a tan colored head. Aroma is rich bakers chocolate with nice smokey edge. Taste is bakers dark chocolate, rich coffee, nice smokey grit and flavorful roasted malt.

bottle thanks GT2. pours dar brown with a reddish hue, Aroma:  the smoke is very present,  salami, bonfire, Bamberg malts,  cured meats, salty, salt water, the smoke is a bit overwhelming and its hard to pinpoint much else than that, but i get some sweet malty notes, caramel. taste:  very balanced, salty smoke, salami, grassy hops, bonfire, some tar, ashy, a bit more thinbodied than what I expected, chocolate, vanilla, dry. leathery, new wallet, earthy, light acidic, the smoke really compiments this porter!

2010 bottle from GT2. Pours dark brown with a small rim of head. Aroma starts off with a good bucker of smoke, some nice roast and chocolate, some dark fruit and vanilla, yeast esters, light hoppiness. Nice powerful aroma for a 6% beer. Taste is roasted up front with dark chocolate, coffee, roasty sourness and then the smoke comes up - lovely stuff. Body is rather thin, and the finish is soft and slighty bitter. Very nice for the style!

June 2009: I wrote this on BA. 2008 brew, 651ml brown bottle. Came to Shropshire via California and Prague, this was one well travelled bottle.

Poured into a Palm tulip shaped glass three times. Deep dark, ruby red, looked completely black until held up to a strong light, then the true colour became evident. Good tan coloured head on each pour, but faded to a wisp and collar as the beer wqs consummed.

Really smokey aroma, almost nicotine smokey. I have been to Bamberg to try the smoked beers there (on a few occasions) and nothing compares to the smokey aroma of this porter.

Too smokey for me to be honest, I tried to get into it, but it isnt a smoked ham or bacon flavour, this is a full in your face smoke house taste.

My wife was pleased to hear it was most likely the only bottle of this beer in the UK. She didnt want me to have to drink another!

I found it heavy going, but managed to finish the bottle, cheese and crisps helped me see it off.

Bottle.  Pours a dark black/brown with medium tan head.  Aromas are bold of oak, campfire, ashy.  Taste is smokey bacon, other smoked meats, campfire, roasted ashiness.   While the smoke component certainly dominates the flavor - it is not one dimensional and one can pull many flavors from the smoke.  Best smoke beer I may ever have.  Really a delicate malt balance.

Poured into a snifter. 2011 vintage. Big thanks to Callmecoon for this.

3.5 A: Black color. Two fingers of frothy light brown head. Retention is average and a moderate amount of lacing is left.

4.5 S: Smells wonderful! Bacon smokiness with a touch of campfire underneath. Caramel, supple roastiness, and chocolate notes. Clean, lightly grainy maltiness.

3.5 T: The smokiness in the taste is of a bit more charred variety. Still bacony as well though. Dry, ashy roastiness. Light chocolate and caramel.

2.5 M: Lighter medium body. Plenty of carbonation and slightly biting. Lacking creaminess.

3.5 D: Good beer, but smells a lot better than it tastes. After having a much better smoked porter yesterday, this has disappointed.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-06-2012 02:53:05

Huge thanks to RedBrewer83 (BA) for this awesome beer in a trade awhile back! 

Vintage 2009 poured into a pint glass. Pours a very thick, syrupy, jet-black. A massive tan head grows on top. Excellent retention; left tons of sticky lace all over the glass. Big chocolate and roasted coffee scents burst out, but the finish of smoked ham comes through with a vengeance! Wow. Thats awesome. 

This beer is like silk. So smooth and creamy; Id like to wrap up in this next to the fire. Subtle carbonation throughout. The cocoa and coffee comes out a bit in the flavor as well, and leaves a bit of a charred flavor in there as well. The smoky character comes out in the backend, leaving a roasted aftertaste. This is not overpowering with smoke, rather, there is a great balance with the Porter flavors and smokiness. Well done. Im gonna store away the other 2 bombers I got of this and try them in a few years or so. Recommend.

Great version of a smoked beer, not nearly as smoky as some of the classic German versions.  this one has plenty of smoke though and is greatly complimented by a rich chocolaty backbone, great with a big steak!

22 ounce bottle that poured a brown, almost black color with aromas of oak, ash, campfire, roasted malt, and some chocolate.  Flavors of roasted coffee, ash, chocolate, and some smoked meat.  As the beer warmed a slightly more bacony and vanilla flavor came through.  Real nice beer overall, and wouldnt mind drinking again.
Pours a black color with a good sized beige head. The aroma of smoke, caramel and chocolate. Taste has remnants of dark fruits, smoked malts and a bit of chocolate sweetness. Mouthfeel is medium.

Sent from a friend from the Pacific NW. 2008 vintage. From notes Jan 2012.

Fantastic smoked beer. The aroma had a little hint of bacon with the smokiness. It was an incredibly smooth smoked beer,  with a hint of sweetness. Just right beer for the rare chilly Southern night.

If this was the last beer I had before I died, I would go out a happy man. Especially good with some Alaska Smoked Salmon and and Smoked Gouda while sitting in front of the fireplace, in the hot tub, or watching asports event.
Pours a very dark brown color with a small tan colored head that goes away rather quickly.  Aroma of smoke, roast and bacon. Taste is very similar with hints of chocolate.  Mouthfeel is medium.
Solid beer.  Not much of a smoked beer fan but this was mild and allowed me to enjoy the beer.  Had great balance of malt profile so it complimented our steak dinner very well.  Had 22 oz bottle.
Pours black with a rather large off white head and good lacing.  Aroma is roasted malt and smoke. Taste is smoke, coffee and roast. Medium bodied with good carbonation.

2010 Edition: A deep dark porter with a thick frothy and lacing mocha head. In aroma, loads of smoked ham, grassy notes, herbal hops, very nice. In mouth, smooth smoked chocolate, peaty bacon, silky and smooth, alcohol warmth, very nice. Shared with Mike and friends, April 1, 2012.

2011 bottle. Pours a dark brown and small tan head leaving sticky lacing  The aroma is smoke pepper and oak. Thin mouthfeel with a smokey malt and oak with nice spicy finish. A good smoked from Alaskan.
Pours a thin black with 2 fingers of off white head. Smoke is huge on the nose and taste. A very interesting porter that I would like to try again soon.

Verticle tasting of 2008, 2009, 2010.  Really cool stuff.  The 08 & 09 were similar, with the 08 taking on a smoother edge, and also less vsicous.  The 2010 didnt hold a candle to the former with exception of the nose.  I will save the rest of my notes for the next verticle tasting.  We will do the 08, 09, 10, 11, and 12 as soon as it is released!

Bottle 66 cl, thanks to Tim. 2011. Okay, time has stopped. Had some years ago the 2009 version, and I stated as the best smoked ever had. No way. Time has passed, beers so, and Im in front of the Alaskan Smoked Porter again. In consequence, my expectations was really high. And wasnt disappointed. Indeed, OVERTAKED. ABSOLUTELY. Where do we start? Appearance is blackier than black, with a balanced beige foam; you could pour even from 10 cm and it doesnt override glass. This just for starting. Aroma is the triumph of smoke. High complexity that begins to provola (smoked cheese from South of Italy) and finish to bacon. But isnt aggressive, elegance is even that of smoked fish, salmon, tuna. Also youll find a gentle dark fruits bouquet, some sugar notes too. And crisp, incredibly crisp. Taste? Oh my, rarely Ive found such a drinkability. Carbonation brush perfection, texture is oily, body light to medium, malt astonishing and full of ashes, coal, wood, shorter in chocolate. herbs and young plums. Finish is initially thin, but after grows like a big wave from distance to the only goal of harshing; dries all your mouth not with an hop slaps, but like young fruit or whiskey or licorice or burned bread crust. It lasts incredibly for minutes, trust me. Youll chew and chew with nothing, but youre forced to without disturbing. And warms softly throat, no booze at all. What should I say? Not rated as Westies or top class IRS/DIPA, but one of the best beer in the world as well. Add its drinkability, its availability (in the US), its plain and straightforward character, its perfection among malt, carbonation, aroma, flavor and finish, its configuration for aging, and youll understand.

Pours dark black with thick brown head. Nose is black licorice and smoked wood. Taste is smokey dark chocolate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is insanely smokey... neat.  Taste is heavy alder smoke, followed by roast malts, coffee, and a little bittersweet chocolate on the finish.  Good stuff indeed.

09 vintage, pours a deep black body with a thin, off-white head. Smells amazing: smoky and meaty with undertones of rich, caramel malty sweetness. Very well-balanced aroma. Tastes almost exactly as it smells, with the exception of an unfortunate cardboard-like finish. Mouthfeel is on the thinner side, good for a regular porter, with a lively but fast-nucleating carbonation. Overall, this beer is both flavorful and highly drinkable.

2009 vintage - Poured into a Cigar City snifter.  Dark body with a thin, light-tan, head.  Light lacing.  Notes of smoked alder and roasted cocoa on the nose.  Smokey dark fruits and a touch of vanilla bean.  Smells lovely.  Taste is smokey bbq wood and cocoa with hint of red wine.  Smokey, slightly tannic, almost creamy with light carbonation.  The weight of the body is pretty good, but it would be nice if it were just a touch thicker.  However, this is not an imperial porter.  Overall, this is an awesome smoked porter.  One of the best, if not the best Ive had.  With roughly 3 years of age this beer is drinking very well and will probably continue to do so for years to come.  Definitely worth checking out if you like the style.

Opaque black body, creamy off white head with no stick. Smells of earth, smoke, cheese. Malt up front followed closely by a smoke and smoked gouda character, Goes down smooth with really no hops or bitterness to speak of. Slight roasted malt tinge but not much. Nice mouthfeel, though a little weak.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2016 Had this again and had to update my rating.  2012 on draft.  Jet black pour with a thin tan head.  Aroma is very smokey and a bit of copper.  Lots of lace.  Light bodied, but borderline on the medium side.  Lots of smoke on the palate with a lingering smokiness, like smoked meats, on the finish.  Very dry.  Very easy to drink for a smoked beer.  Easily the best Ive had.

--Original review below--

Aroma had a little bourbon in there, but lots of smoke.  A little too overpowering. Very smokey taste.  Very much like a campfire.  Creamy mouth that was very satisfying.  I had the 09 and the 11.  The 09 was smoke in the mouth while the 11 was a little more balanced.

Bottle @ Timbers, Denver. 2011 vintage. Pours black with a creamy light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, smoke, smoked bacon, campfire. Taste is roasted malt, smoke, hints of dark chocolate, smoked bacon. Medium to full body, quite high carbonation, smokey dry finish. Allthough i find it a little one dimensional, this is a mighty fine porter. 050212

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2013 A smoky aroma dominates combined with dark roasted malts and hints of mince meat. Pours a blackish-brown with little head and minimal lacing. The taste is smooth smoke, rich dark roasted malts,  with some biscuit/bread in the finish. Full body with moderate carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel. Overall, an excellent smoked porter worth drinking over and over.

Pours a blackish brown with small tan head, minimal lacing.  Aroma obvious of roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, vanilla and a decent smoke profile.  Flavor matches well, but it is just a solid brew, not spectacular.

Poured a nearly opaque, dark brown color with a tan head, that left light, sticky, tan lacing on the glass. Roasty, smokey meat, and cocoa in the aroma. Burnt wood, roasted and chocolate malts, and light alcohol in the finish.

650ml  bottle. Poured a big thick black colour with  a deep dense tan head of foam. Strong aromas of smoked wood and dark chocolate. Quite thin in the mouth for a porter but good smokey flavour is great.  Long smokey finish.
Poured black with an off white head that hung around the edge of the glass.  Smelled charcoal and smoke.  Tasted smkey and bitter burnt malts good beer

Bottle. The pour was a very dark murky brown with an average sized (1-2 finger) frothy light brown head that dissipated slowly into just a few puddles and a ring of residue, leaving behind some really good sheets of lace.

The aroma was right of front with a strong smoke odor and a moderate burnt dark bread malt, a light resin hop and a meaty yeast. It also had decently strong notes of dark chocolate, a dark roasted coffee and a hint of wood.

The taste was smoky and mildly sweet with a hint of chocolate at first and then became moderately bitter and quite roasty with a nice dose of coffee and had a pronounced smoky finish. The flavor lasted a really long time after the swallow, being mostly of chocolate and coffee but having a strong smoky ending.

Mouthfeel was right between medium and full in body with the texture being nice and creamy yet just a little dry and having a mild carbonation.

Overall an impressive smoked beer that had a ton of flavor with a very nice blending of the smoke, so it did not become too overpowering on the taste buds.

Color: Black
Aroma: Roasted barley and smoky, camp fire 
Body: Smoked malt, bacon, light sweetness, robust, woody
Finish: dry with some bitterness, oakyness
Over-all/Mouth-feel: Big body, lightly carbonated.

Bottle. Pours deep brown with small creamy tan head. Aroma and flavor are both excellent with plenty of smoky goodness that has a nice woody and earthy appeal along with a well balanced rich chocolate and roast note. Just the right level of smoke to be assertive but not dominate the palate. Medium body and a soft carbonation. Very good
Smokey pork Bar b Que aroma, crisp not overly smokey taste one of the best porter Ive had!
Bottle shared with beerboxer. Smells like smoked bbq ribs. Black in color. Light brown head. Starts off with a smoked taste and finishes smooth.
Pours a dark brown with a cola colored head. Aroma smells like BBQ pulled pork! Very smokey flavor. Sweet malt finish!
09 at Bottleworks. Its a chocolate smell. Very dark with a tan head. Very ashy finish. Rich and full bodied. Great beer.
Pours a near black body with a one finger tan head. Burnt wood, coffee, black licorice, and vanilla. Nice lacing. Very, very good.

Bottle. Pours a medium oily brown with medium off white head. Aroma has a massive meatiness to it. Lots of oak in the nose, like a campfire without the char. Flavor starts more like a traditional porter with earthy coffee notes and plenty of dark chocolate. The smokiness is in the finish. Theres a lovely lingering oak and meatiness at the end, where you feel it in your mouth for about ten seconds. Really prominent yet delicate (not harsh or obnoxious in any way). The finish is just the perfect blend of smoked and porter. Wonderfully done.

2011 edition. Ive had earlier editions too.  Im a lucky man to find this on tap in the lower 48.

Pint tap pour, black with a thin lasting head. Moderate smoke aroma, hints of sweetness.  Malt sweetness forward, moderate sweetness & hints of roasted malt.  Medium-heavy body, light hop bitterness.  Yum, a Wisconsin "not bad".

UPDATED: APR 3, 2012 From the 1/2012 3R6P tasting. Only my second beer from this brewer but one I have been interested in for quite some time. +++ Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured a black color with a small beige head that faded quickly and left decent lacing. The aroma was roasty hickory and bacon. The flavor was toasty malts with notes of vanilla, hickory, bacon and oak. The finish was long and dryish with lingering hickory and bacon. Medium body. Interesting.

2000 bottle: Strong Smooth aroma of meat and smoke. Color is dark brown/black, flat. Flavor is sweet, roasty, and overall meaty. Really quite good. Shared at Curtiss (Nashvilles Sweetwarer Representative) tasting.
Smooth with great smoked flavors. Try this one with peanuts!! As the beer warms the smoked flavor becomes stronger. Love this Beer!!!

A -pours deep dark brown with light tan head with some lacing. 

S - smoke smoke and smoke. Very subtle chocolate and toasted malts.. 

M - med body. Fairly airy.

T - On the nose is smoke and dark roasted malts. Smoke, chocolate and slight dark fruits on the palate. Sweeter malty ending, smoke throughout.

O - Smoke flavoring is too much. Tastes of simple smoke flavoring additive. Not complex at all. Good but not great.

6-

2011 vintage. 22 oz bomber into an over sized wine glass. Huge thanks to javit for this want of mine!

A - Dark black body, a little light shines through showing some red and dark brown tints. 2-3 finger dark grey/brown head formed which led to edging. Great lacing and retention.

S - Tons of natural smoke. Smells very savory and intense, like sticking your head in a fire place or a smoker. Very smooth with just a hint of chocolate sweetness and some bitter coffee beans towards the finish. 

T - Not as smokey as the nose would leave you to believe. Its certainly prominent, but the caramel sweetness of the malts are allowed to shine. Milk chocolate, coffee beans, and some dark fruits. The finish is slightly bitter and dry.

M- Medium bodied but crazy smooth. Carbonation is perfect for this beer.

O - Im not a fan of smoked beers, but I do love a good porter. This is an amazing beer. The smokiness is just really well balanced and integrated with everything. This is world class for sure!

Pours black with a medium mocha head.  Aroma has nice roastiness and just the right amount of smoke.  Flavor follows suit and adds more smoke...nice notes of charred wood...bit of dark chocolate but not sweet and not too bitter.  Mouthfeel is medium and fairly lively...finish is roasted and smoked...no medicinal or band aid notes like some smoked beers seem to have.

22oz bottle, 2009 vintage.  Shared at Luminarium 11.  Great carbonation with the solid black hue and off white head.  Aromas are fantastic, not overwhelming with the smoke, you certainly get some roasted malts and coffee aromas.  Palate is so balanced, the smoke hits you right up front then it dissipates into a roasted coffee mid palate, then a smooth silky finish with a slight cocoa.  Really the best smoked porter Ive ever had, I wish it were available where I am, just amazing.

2011 vintage, from Woodmans in the Falls. Pours coal black with a disappearing brownish tan head. Very little lacing. Aroma has smoke.  And smoke. A bit of sweet soy and meat. Taste brings smoked meat (ham?), then underneath roasted maltiness and chocolate. Strong smoked flavor is the main element. A bit salty and a bit sweet in the medium-length finish. Overall, I would think a more pronounced flavor presence with the smoke would have really lifted this more.
2008.  I had a flat one, but it was a "recapped" beer from a buddy, so I need to overlook it.caramel, black, Excellent Smoked taste.  Medium bitterness. full body,
Smoky peaty aroma. Dark chocolate color. Slightly bitter and smoky tasty with flavors of smoke, dark malts, and a slight coffee bitter flavor.

13oz draught.  Head dissolves to pinches of brown sand covering the center and a drifting ring around  the glass.  Lacing is fast over nearly opaque red body.  Aroma is kind of subdued but smoke of hardwood like a BBQ pit, chalk dust, sweet root like sassafrass, licorice and candy, with notes of bacon fat and some hint of grocery store bacteria.  Taste carries the smoke and is umami, sweet, salty, and bitter.  Palate is quite full with pleasant bitterness.  Overall, one of the best smokes.

Sampled at the Saint Louis Ratebeer Gathering into tulip glass. 2008 vintage. Poured an opaque mahogany color with thin film of tan bubbles with Belgian lace and slight alcohol legs when swirled. Powerful roasty and smoky aroma, very little malt, hops or yeast make it through. Robust malty-sweet flavor with loads of caramel and burnt unmalted barley, notes of toffee, coffee, bourbon smoked tobacco. Syrupy and dusty, a bit oxidized, but nicely aged. Long-lasting fruity, smoky, bittersweet aftertaste. An exquisite winter-warmer that actually gives the illusion of sitting in front of a campfire.

Sampled at the St. Louis RB gathering.  It poured a dark almost black brown color with a creamy tan head. The aroma was very smokey. The flavor was very smokey with a robust coffee flavor.  A very good Smoked Porter.
This is an amazing beer! My wife added some of this to her Wild rice Mushroom stuffing for Thanksgiving and it was over the Top.

Aroma is smoke, roast, chocolate. Appearance is dark brown with slightest hint of red. Small tan head. Taste is smoke, chocolate, roast... in that order. A sweet beer. Slight bitterness seems to be coming from hops as well. Palate is medium plus. Smoky sweet roasty malt linger nicely. Overall a very nice smoked porter. All flavors come together and balance nicely. Not a smoke bomb.

Black pour with a thick tan head
aroma is appetizing wood smoke over roasted malt and chocolate.
flavour is very smooth, nice woody and light meaty smoke over bakers chocolate bitterness. Lingering meatiness in the finish.
Very smooth.

Bottle shared at the 6th annual Richmond Industry Gathering, 11/27/11. Surprised I havent rated this one. Oh well, no time like the present. Pours a dark brown color with a thin frothy tan head. Decent head retention. Aroma of smoke, chocolate, roasted malts and faint hops. The taste is smoke, roasted malts, nutty notes and bitter hops. Medium bodied.

Date: November 25, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: AV3 Description: Opaque dark brown, nice tan head with a tiny bit of lacing, aroma was smoky, nutty, and coffee, taste was consistent but had a slight bitter finish, aftertaste was all about the smoke, medium bodied and smooth.  As it warmed the smoke seemed to lessen in the taste and smoothed out more.

Tap. Pours a rich chocolate brown with a middy brown, thick head.  Smells just a touch smoky with some coffee notes. the smoky flavor comes through tremendously in the taste, with a surprisingly smooth finish.  This is a great beer!

The mother of all smoked porters.  Rich, dark dark brown and an aroma and taste of smoked malts that is powerful but not overwhelming.  Josh and Angie brought this beer back from California on their honeymoon for me. 7/1/2010
22oz - Booming roasted notes with pervasive, appetizing smoke. Total lack of weight and mouthfeel.

2011 bottle. Pours a rich black with a then brown head and some lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, sweet chocolate, and campfire smoke. Flavor is rich milk chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, caramel, oak, smoke, and earth. Medium body with low carbonation and a smooth, chewy mouthfeel. Wonderful brew overall.
Extremely dark beer with a smoky aroma, The taste is smooth with roasted malts and chocolate. The smokiness continues heavily creating a unique taste. Smooth finish.

2011 bottle to snifter. Pours dark brown/black with a quick kahki soapy head that fades to a collar. Aroma smoke wood and peat with coffee and roasted malt. Taste is vanilla roasted brunt malt and smokey peat. Palate is medium and chaulky with a dry finish.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 2011 bottle.  Deep brown with off-white tan head.  Crisp roast malt, fruit esters, toffee, and background smoked malt/meats.  Clean, bitter roasted malt, burnt caramel, and salty smoked malt.  Residual roast malt.  Flavor sticks to the palate.  Classic, classic beer.  Could still use a little more smoke.  Outstanding.  Re-rate: multiple vintages.  Reality rate -0.2

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint. 2011 Vintage.

Appearance: Ruby black with thick foamy brown head and some nice lacing lines.

Smell: Very strong smoky aroma, with char, espresso, and dark chocolate.

Taste: Smoke dominates the flavor profile as well, with notes of chargrilling and a very nice undercurrent of the wood used. Malt backbone becomes more noticeable as it warms, with bittersweet chocolate, molasses, caramel, and a touch of coffee.

Feel: Pretty smooth and creamy body with moderate carbonation. Long, dry, smoky finish.

Overall: Other than some Rauchbiers, this is easily the most heavily smoked beer I have had. However, this is anything but one-dimensional.
This beer was one of the best beers i have ever drank.  It is the same look as guiness but has more of a smoky taste.

Dark brown to black. Opaque. Large tan head. Smoky aroma with some malt. Bread, yeast, and some hops in the nose. Wonderfully balanced flavor of smoky malt, firm bitterness, mild roast, and faint chocolate. Very creamy and full-bodied.How much smoke is probably a personal preference, and this one is a but overbearing for my taste. Still a fine beer though.

Woodsy first taste. Big Alaskan Brewery Fan. Hits the sides of my tongue with a burst of flavors. Coffee, Bread and chocolate hints make me like this beer and Colorado for my local liquor store to have it. I do taste a cough drop component but again faint. I will definitely stock this one in my cellar.

650ml bomber. 2011 batch B.

It pours a dark brown with a foamy tan head that likes to hold with some sticky lacing when it finally recedes. 

The smell is great. It has a big smokiness with some caramel, cocoa, and a hint of almost fruity sweetness.

The flavor is smoky with some woodiness, big bitter cocoa, and a hint of coffee. Basic but tasty.

A different take on a smoked beer but a good one.

Reviewed from notes at tasting.  This beer pours a very dark, sooty brown color with a ring of tan lacing coating the top of the beer.  It is very fragrant with an intense smokey, campfire smell that dominate the nose.  There is also some toasty wood as well.  The flavor is predominately a smokey, charred taste that reminds me of the smell your clothes get after sitting around a bonfire for hours.  Also in the taste is some oak and black coffee.  For me, this just seems like a novelty beer that was enjoyable for the 4 oz. I tried.  Any more than that would have been too much.  A very creative beer

22oz bottle from Discount Liquor Milwaukee.  Pours a jet black color with a light tan head.  Aroma is smokey, roasted malt, maybe a little chocolate.  Medium on palate with soft carbonation.  Flavor is bittersweet, smokey, chocolate, with a nice smokey finish.  The smoke in both the aroma and the flavor are dominant, but not overpowering.  An amazingly complex beer, well worth its reputation as one of the best beers in America.
